original_en_text: <page>Mmmm! Is it time? Our lands shake their sorrow! For the new beat, yes? Demanding! For a new rhythm...<hpage>These quakes you feel, they are not your land’s sadness, they are its collapse, one bound to happen if their source cannot be quelled.<page>What? No, no no... the beat... It is the beat our land wishes! Calls for it! Needs one new!
original_zh_text: <page>嗯嗯！！时候到了？？大地震颤，哀鸣！是为新的搏动？……如此迫切！为新的韵律……<hpage>你感知的震颤并非大地哀鸣，而是其崩解前兆。若源头不稳，终将倾覆。<page>什么？不，不不……那搏动……是大地所求！大地呼唤！亟需换新！
translated_text: <page>嗯！时间到了吗？我们的土地震撼了他们的悲伤！对于新的节奏，是的？非常要求！为了新的节奏。<hpage>你感受到的地震不是你的土地的悲伤，而是它的崩溃，如果它们的根源无法平息，那么它们肯定会发生。<page>什么？不，不，不。打败。这是我们土地的希望之声！呼吁它！需要新的！
secondary_translated_text: <page>Hmm! Is the time up? Our land shook their grief! For the new rhythm, yes? Very demanding! For a new rhythm.<hpage>The earthquakes you feel are not the sadness of your land, but its collapse, and if their roots cannot be subsided, then they will surely occur.<page>What? No, no, no. Defeat. This is the voice of hope for our land! Call on it! Need a new one!

original_en_text: Head quick for that vein of bells, and find my uncle hidden there. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure for that thing twisting within your shell, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 速速前往钟脉，寻我叔父踪迹。要说有谁能解你甲壳内的扭曲之物，非他莫属。
translated_text: 我们迅速走向钟声脉动，发现叔叔躲在那里。如果有人能为你指出一种方法来治愈你的躯壳扭曲，那就是他。
secondary_translated_text: We quickly walked towards the pulse of the bell and found our uncle hiding there. If anyone can point you to a way to heal your body distortion, it is him.

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm. Who are you, little you? Not a wish granter. For you haven’t enough fruits. Three we need, three I need! Find them, find them!
original_zh_text: 嗯嗯！嗯。你是谁，小小你？不是授愿者。苔莓不够。要三颗，我要三颗！去找，快去找！
translated_text: 嗯！嗯.你是谁，小你？不是愿望的实现。因为你没有足够的水果。我们需要三个，我需要三个！找到他们，找到他们！
secondary_translated_text: Hmm! hmm. Who are you, little you? Not the fulfillment of a wish. Because you don't have enough fruit. We need three, I need three! Find them, find them!

original_en_text: Ah! Here she is, safe after all! I was worried your battle with that enormous beast had left you badly wounded.<page>Shames me to have left you in danger there, missy, but I’m no warrior, and my tools ain’t no match for a creature like that.<hpage>It is well that you kept yourself safe. This settlement needs a fixer now, not a warrior.<page>Heh, maybe that’s true. Times like these all we can do is put our heads down and try to rebuild.
original_zh_text: 啊！你还活着！我还担心你和那头巨兽搏斗会受重伤。<page>让你独自涉险真是惭愧，但我不是战士，工具也对付不了那种怪物。<hpage>你保全自身是对的。这里需要的是维修师，不是战士。<page>嘿，或许吧。这种时候，埋头干活才是正理。
translated_text: 啊！她来了毕竟，她很安全！恐怕你在与那头巨兽的战斗中受了重伤。<page>小姐，我很羞愧让你陷入危险，但我不是战士，我的工具也不是这样的生物的对手。<hpage>你保证了自己的安全，这很好。这个解决方案现在需要调解人，而不是战士。<page>嘿，也许这是真的。在这种时候，我们能做的就是低下头，努力重建。
secondary_translated_text: Ah! She's here. After all, she's safe! I'm afraid you were seriously injured in the battle with that giant beast.<page>Miss, I am ashamed to put you in danger, but I am no soldier, and my tools are no match for such creatures.<hpage>You kept yourself safe, which is good. This solution now requires mediators, not fighters.<page>Hey, maybe this is true. At times like this, all we can do is lower our heads and work hard to rebuild.

original_en_text: Rest here with us, long as you like. Mightn’t be much time left, but at least we few won’t have to face that fate alone.
original_zh_text: 您想歇多久都行。虽然时日无多，但至少不必孤零零面对。
translated_text: 如果你愿意的话，就在这里休息吧。时间可能已经不多了，但至少我们中的一些人不必独自面对这种命运。
secondary_translated_text: Rest here if you want. Time may be running out, but at least some of us don't have to face this fate alone.

original_en_text: Ah! Glad I caught you for a moment, miss. You’ve done a fair service to this camp, given much more’n most.<page>I’d been thinkin’ on all your efforts, and set to making a little something to repay ‘em.<page>S’only a token, really! But I’ve put all me talent into it, much as I’ve got! Something to keep you company on the lonely roads above.<page>Hold onto it on your travels, and remember that you’re always welcome down here with us.
original_zh_text: 啊！可算遇着你了，小姐。您为这营地做的贡献比谁都多。<page>我琢磨着您的好意，做了个小玩意当回礼。<page>就是个信物！但我把看家本事都使上了！让它在孤独的旅途上陪您解个闷。<page>带着它上路吧，记得这里永远欢迎您。
translated_text: 啊！我很高兴我抓住了你一会儿，小姐。你公平地为这个营地服务，而且比大多数人都多。<page>我一直在思考你们所有的努力，并准备做点什么来回报你们。<page>这只是一个象征，真的！但我已经投入了我所有的才华，并尽了我所能！有东西陪你在孤独的路上。<page>请务必在旅行期间记住，这里随时欢迎您。
secondary_translated_text: Ah! I'm glad I caught you for a moment, miss. You serve this camp fairly and more than most people.<page>I have been thinking about all your efforts and am ready to do something to repay you.<page>It's just a symbol, really! But I have invested all my talents and done the best I can! There is something to accompany you on the lonely road.<page>Be sure to remember during your trip that you are always welcome here.

original_en_text: <hpage>This camp seems in poor condition, good bug. With the lands around turning deadly, I’d worry for its safety.<page>Aye. We surely aren’t seeing its finest moment, but this place has been serving us passing bugs for as long as any can remember.<page>It’s faith, you see! All those pilgrims, now and past. Our devotion holds it together. The camp’ll remain, and provide, no matter the troubles.<page>
original_zh_text: <hpage>这处营地破败不堪，周遭又暗藏危险，我担忧其安危。<page>唉，确实不是鼎盛时候。但这里长久以来侍奉过往虫众，已不知过了多少年月。<page>是信仰维系着这片营地，明白吗？是古今朝圣者的虔心庇佑着这里。任外面灾厄横行，营地永存。
translated_text: <hpage>营地似乎状况很差，虫子很好。随着周围的土地变得致命，我担心它的安全。<page>是的，我们当然还没有看到它最好的时刻，但只要有人记得，这个地方就一直在为我们提供传递错误的服务。<page>这就是信仰，你看！所有这些朝圣者，无论是现在还是过去。我们的奉献精神将他们聚集在一起。无论你遇到什么麻烦，营地都会留下来帮助你。<page>
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The camp seems to be in poor condition, with good bugs. As the surrounding land becomes deadly, I fear for its safety.<page>Yes, we certainly haven't seen its best moments yet, but as long as anyone remembers, this place has been providing us with the service of delivering errors.<page>This is faith, you see! All these pilgrims, whether present or in the past. Our dedication brings them together. No matter what trouble you run into, the camp will stay and help you.<page>

original_en_text: <hpage>What ritual calls you all together, pilgrim?<page>Our brother, this poor wretch in my arms, has walked his last aching step. We gather here to sing him farewell, and to mourn our great loss.
original_zh_text: <hpage>诸位聚集在此举行什么仪式？<page>这位兄弟，我怀中的可怜虫，已走完最后一步。我们在此唱别，哀悼逝者。
translated_text: <hpage>朝圣者们，是什么仪式让你们走到了一起？<page>我们的兄弟，我怀里可怜的家伙，已经迈出了他痛苦的最后一步。我们聚集在这里向他告别，并哀悼我们的巨大损失。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Pilgrims, what ritual brought you together?<page>Our brother, the poor fellow in my arms, has taken the last step of his pain. We gathered here to bid farewell to him and mourn our huge loss.

original_en_text: If the veiled bugs have an interest in you, enough to brave the wastes beyond our borders, then you must be rather special, yes?<hpage>In my own lands, some may once have seen me so. In this place, with my strength sapped, I am just another traveller.<page>Ohho! A traveller, but still something more. I can see it now. Of course! That focus!<page>Did those veiled bugs realise who they snared? Perhaps it is they who should be worried, eh?
original_zh_text: 既然覆面者对你有兴趣，甚至不惜穿越边境荒原掳走你，你肯定不是什么等闲之辈吧？<hpage>在故土，或许曾有虫如此看待我。但在此地，力衰之躯只不过是一介旅者。<page>嚯嚯！旅者？不止如此。我可看得很清楚，这专注的眼神！<page>那些覆面虫知道自己网住了谁吗？该提心吊胆的怕是他们，对吧？
translated_text: 如果面纱虫对你有足够的兴趣，敢于跨越我们的边界，那么你一定很特别，对吧？<hpage>在我自己的土地上，可能有人见过我，在这个地方，我的力量被削弱了，我只是另一个旅行者。<page>哦吼！旅行者，但还有更多。我现在看到了。当然！那个焦点！<page>这些戴着面纱的虫子意识到他们困住了谁吗？也许他们应该担心？
secondary_translated_text: If the veil worm is interested enough in you to dare to cross our borders, then you must be very special, right?<hpage>Someone may have seen me in my own land, where my strength is weakened, and I am just another traveler.<page>Oh ho! Travelers, but there are more. I see it now. Of course! That focus!<page>Do these veiled bugs realize who they are trapping? Maybe they should be worried?

original_en_text: My wish. Oh my wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them! Does the kingdom not send you, little you, to grant my desire?
original_zh_text: 我的祈愿。啊我的祈愿！我要这世间的三枚果实，小宝贝果实。我需要！王国没派你，小小你，来满足我的渴求？
translated_text: 我的愿望。噢，我的愿望！我需要世界的果实，三个小婴儿。我需要他们！小你，王国派你来完成我的愿望吗？
secondary_translated_text: My wish. Oh, my wish! I need the fruits of the world, three little babies. I need them! Little you, did the kingdom send you to fulfill my wish?

original_en_text: Ahh, awake at last! You should mind your strength, traveller. There’s no use wasting energy on an old nobody like me.<hpage>I see that now, madam. My welcome to your land has not been kind. I had reason to be wary.
original_zh_text: 啊哈！可算醒了！你该省省力气，旅者。在我这老骨头身上浪费气力可不值当。<hpage>现在我看清了，女士。但此地的待客之道可不友善。我保持警惕自有道理。
translated_text: 啊，终于醒了！旅行者，你应该注意你的力量。把精力浪费在我这种无名小卒身上是没有用的。<hpage>我明白，女士。我不客气地来到你的土地。我有理由保持警惕。
secondary_translated_text: Ah, finally awake! Traveler, you should pay attention to your strength. It's no use wasting your energy on a nobody like me.<hpage>I understand, ma 'am. I came to your land impolitely. I have reason to be vigilant.

original_en_text: Up with you! Up! I won’t have you dying on my floor!
original_zh_text: 给我起来！快起来！我可不想看你死在我的地板上！
translated_text: 和你一起！起来！我不会让你死在我的地板上！
secondary_translated_text: With you! Get up! I won't let you die on my floor!

original_en_text: <hpage>I am no pilgrim. I am Hornet, and I arrive in your land by no choice of my own.<hpage>I was brought to your kingdom by force, captured by strange bugs clad in veils.<page>Oho! How curious! The bugs of the Citadel, at the summit of our land. They veil themselves in service to their faith, or perhaps as slaves to something greater...<hpage>Then I shall seek their Citadel. If the veiled bugs would go to such lengths to bring me here, I intend to find out why.<page>Oho! Ferocious! Intimidating! Yours is no pilgrim’s spirit! You’ve the bearing of a hunter.<page>Welcome then, fierce traveller, to Pharloom! Our holy yet haunted land.<page>Before you depart, permit an old bug a brief warning. Best keep that weapon drawn.<page>Our kingdom is gripped by a curse. Its paths grow wild and dangerous, and though some still attempt the climb to the Citadel at its crest, none return to speak of what they see.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我名为大黄蜂。我并非朝圣者，也不是自愿来到这里。<hpage>是一群覆面怪虫将我绑来这里的。<page>嚯！稀奇！那是圣堡的虫子，盘踞在我们土地上头。他们覆面侍奉信仰，或者说……是更可怖之物的奴仆……<hpage>那我会找到圣堡。既然覆面者费心绑我来到这里，我一定会查清缘由。<page>嚯！够凶！这可不是朝圣者的脾性！你分明带着猎手的气魄。<page>那么欢迎你，剽悍的旅者，来到纺络！这个神圣却遭诅咒的国度。<page>启程前容老虫多句嘴，最好时刻握紧你的兵刃。<page>我们的王国正被诅咒啃噬。道路变得混乱凶险，山顶那座圣堡——尽管仍有勇者试图攀登，却无虫归来讲述见闻。
translated_text: <hpage>我不是朝圣者。我是一只大黄蜂，我来到你的土地没有任何选择。<hpage>我被强行带到你的王国，被戴着面纱的奇怪昆虫捕获。<page>哦！多么好奇啊！城堡里的昆虫位于我们土地的顶峰。他们服务于自己的信仰，或者也许是更伟大事物的奴隶。<hpage>然后我会寻找他们的城堡。如果这些隐藏的错误不遗余力地把我带到这里，我打算找出原因。<page>哦！激烈的！威胁！你的精神不是朝圣者的精神！你有猎人的风范。<page>所以，凶猛的旅客，欢迎来到法鲁！我们神圣但闹鬼的土地。<page>离开之前，请就旧错误发出简短警告。最好拔枪。<page>我们的王国被诅咒所笼罩。它的道路变得狂野而危险，虽然有些人仍然试图爬上城堡的顶部，但没有人回来谈论他们所看到的。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I am not a pilgrim. I am a bumblebee, I came to your land with no choice.<hpage>I was forcibly taken to your kingdom, captured by strange insects wearing veils.<page>Oh! How curious! The insects in the castle are located at the summit of our land. They serve their beliefs, or perhaps are slaves to greater things.<hpage>Then I will look for their castle. If these hidden mistakes went to great lengths to get me here, I intend to find out why.<page>Oh! Intense! Threats! Your spirit is not the spirit of a pilgrim! You have the demeanor of a hunter.<page>So, fierce travelers, welcome to Faro! Our sacred but haunted land.<page>Before leaving, please issue a brief warning about old mistakes. Better draw your gun.<page>Our kingdom is shrouded in a curse. Its roads became wild and dangerous, and while some people still tried to climb the top of the castle, no one came back to talk about what they saw.

original_en_text: So you’re another pilgrim then? Scuttled out of the darkness to climb the great path and bow at its gilded peak?
original_zh_text: 这么说你也是个朝圣者？从黑暗里钻出来就为攀那条路，去镀金尖顶上叩拜？
translated_text: 那么你是另一个朝圣者吗？从黑暗中挖掘出来，攀登道路，向镀金的山峰鞠躬？
secondary_translated_text: So are you another pilgrim? Digging out of the darkness, climbing the road, and bowing to the gilded peaks?

original_en_text: Well, look at that! You’ve gone and donated all those shell shards, just like I wished for! I can scarcely believe it!<page>Those shards are valuable, alright. Brilliant for crafting and fixing, very versatile.<page>More than that, though... it was a warm thing you did, the sort of kindness you don’t see much in this weary place.<hpage>Was this kindness? I must take care to learn of this land and claim what advantage I can from it. Answering requests like yours can often fit those ends.<page>Oh, it’s like that, is it? Well, even still, the help’s well appreciated, miss. Best of luck in your travels, and may every wish of yours be granted!
original_zh_text: 哎呀呀！你居然真捐了这么多甲壳碎片！跟我许的愿一模一样！简直不敢相信！<page>这些碎片用处可不少，又能造东西又能修修补补。<page>不过更重要的是……你做了件暖心事，这破地方可少见这种善举。<hpage>善意？我需要审慎了解这里，好为自己谋取利益。回应你的祈愿只是手段。<page>哦，原来如此？但帮忙总归是好的，小姐。祝旅途顺利，愿你所有愿望都能实现！
translated_text: 好吧，看看那个！正如我所愿，您已经捐赠了所有这些贝壳碎片！我简直不敢相信！<page>这些作品很有价值，好吧。非常适合制作和修复，用途非常广泛。<page>但不仅如此。你正在做的事情是一件温暖的事情，是在这个疲惫的地方很少看到的那种善意。<hpage>这是善意吗？我必须注意了解这片土地并获得我可以从中获得的优势。像你这样的志愿者请求往往可以达到这些目的。<page>哦，没错，不是吗？好吧，即便如此，我还是感谢你的帮助，小姐。祝您旅途顺利，一切愿望成真！
secondary_translated_text: Okay, look at that! As I wished, you have donated all these shell fragments! I can't believe it!<page>These works are valuable, okay. It is very suitable for production and repair, and has a wide range of uses.<page>But more than that. What you are doing is a warm thing, the kind of kindness you rarely see in this tired place.<hpage>Is this good intentions? I have to pay attention to understand the land and gain the advantages I can gain from it. Volunteer requests like you can often achieve these goals.<page>Oh, yes, no? Well, even so, I appreciate your help, miss. I wish you a smooth journey and all your wishes come true!

original_en_text: Oh, oh dear... what fearful events are sent to test we poor pilgrims! How could it be that our path to paradise is infested with such beasts?<page>To brave such a world... oh my. I’ll need more rosaries, that’s for certain. Please traveller, won’t you trade with me?
original_zh_text: 噢，圣堡啊……为何设置这等可怖灾厄考验可怜的朝圣者！通往乐土之路怎么会遍布恶兽？<page>要继续朝圣之路……唉，需要更多念珠。旅者，愿意交易吗？
translated_text: 哦，哦亲爱的。多么可怕的事件是为了考验我们这些可怜的朝圣者！我们的天堂之路怎么会充满这样的野兽呢？<page>勇敢地面对这个世界……天啊我肯定需要更多的念珠。来吧，旅行者，你不和我做笔交易吗？
secondary_translated_text: Oh, Oh honey. What a terrible event to test us poor pilgrims! How can our path to heaven be filled with such beasts?<page>Face the world bravely…God I definitely need more rosary beads. Come on, traveler, won't you make a deal with me?

original_en_text: You are my wish granter, yes? My wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them, so I wish!<page>You made the promise. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 你实现我的祈愿，对吧？我的祈愿！我要这世间的三枚果实，小宝贝果实。我需要，所以祈愿！<page>你应诺祈愿，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: 你是我愿望的实现者，对吧？我的愿望！我需要世界的果实，三个小婴儿。我需要他们，所以我希望！<page>你做出了承诺。一种比罪恶更强大的束缚。给我三块苔藓。珍贵的水果！答应我的愿望，然后工作就开始了！
secondary_translated_text: You are the fulfillment of my wish, right? My wish! I need the fruits of the world, three little babies. I need them, so I hope!<page>You made a promise. A bondage stronger than sin. Give me three pieces of moss. Precious fruit! Promise my wish, and then the work begins!

original_en_text: I’ve a long way to go, and much more to see. For now though, let’s just rest a little while, eh?
original_zh_text: 前面还有不少路要走，也有不少新鲜事物等着发现。但现在，不如一起休息一会吧。
translated_text: 我还有很长的路要走，还有很多东西要看。但现在，让我们休息一下吧，嗯？
secondary_translated_text: I still have a long way to go and a lot to see. But for now, let's take a break, huh?

original_en_text: Times are hard, so fresh supplies are always welcome! Bugs arrive here with nothin’ and often leave without much more.
original_zh_text: 时局艰难，物资紧缺！虫子们来时两手空空，走时也带不走啥。
translated_text: 时代艰难，因此随时欢迎新鲜用品！这个错误什么也没有，离开时也没有什么。
secondary_translated_text: Times are tough, so fresh supplies are always welcome! There was nothing for this mistake, and there was nothing when it left.

original_en_text: Well now! Seems I’ve traded you the last of my supplies, so I’ve got no more excuses to linger down here.<page>I’ll soon be making my way up to the great Citadel. As holy as I am with rosaries, I’m sure my path will not be an arduous one...
original_zh_text: 哎呀！最后的存货都换予你了，这下没借口留下啦。<page>很快要上圣堡了。揣着这么多念珠，肯定能一路顺畅……
translated_text: 好了！看来我已经把最后的物资换成了你，所以我没有借口在这里逗留。<page>我很快就会前往伟大的城堡。虽然我对念珠是神圣的，但我确信我的道路不会很困难……
secondary_translated_text: Okay! It seems that I have replaced my last supplies with you, so I have no excuse to stay here.<page>I will soon be heading to the great castle. Although I am sacred to the rosary beads, I am sure my path will not be difficult...

original_en_text: Bring more Mossberries here. Mmm. Yes, we will trade. Precious rosaries for fresh berries! Seek them wherever you see the green moss grow!
original_zh_text: 带更多苔莓来。嗯。用念珠换鲜果！青苔生长处都有踪迹！
translated_text: 多带点苔藓来这里。嗯.是的，我们会交易。新鲜浆果的珍贵念珠！无论你看到绿苔如何生长，都要寻找它们！
secondary_translated_text: Bring more moss here. hmm. Yes, we will deal. Precious rosary beads for fresh berries! No matter how you see green moss growing, look for them!

original_en_text: You bear your blade well, hunter, and you’ve skill, no doubt, so I don’t mean any unkindness when I say you still seem a little frail.<hpage>I was a long time spent captive, bound by seals strange to me. My strength is diminished, but recoverable.<hpage>By the time I reach that Citadel, I’ll be ready to face what waits.
original_zh_text: 你执刃的姿态不错，猎手，本领想必了得。不过恕我直言，你看上去仍有些虚弱。<hpage>我遭囚禁多日，又被陌生封印束缚。气力虽然衰微，但尚可恢复。<hpage>等我抵达圣堡之时，自然会做好准备。
translated_text: 猎人，你拿剑不错，毫无疑问，而且你有技术，所以我说你看起来还是有点虚弱，并没有任何恶意。<hpage>我被囚禁了很长一段时间，被奇怪的海豹束缚着。我的力量减弱了，但我可以恢复。<hpage>当我到达城堡时，我已经准备好迎接即将发生的事情了。
secondary_translated_text: Hunter, you're a good sword holder, no doubt about it, and you have skills, so I said you still look a little weak and don't mean anything.<hpage>I was imprisoned for a long time, bound by strange seals. My strength has weakened, but I can recover.<hpage>When I arrived at the castle, I was ready for what was to happen.

original_en_text: Oh! Hunter, aren’t you in a sorry state? You’re all bound up, looking worse than when we first met!<hpage>My shell has become host to a cruel parasite. Though my natural strength keeps it from consuming me entirely, I’m much weakened by its presence.<page>Well, this just won’t do! Pharloom’s already in the snare of one fell curse, we can’t have another vying to leech what life remains.<page>Best you head quick over to that town of bells, at the core of our kingdom. I’ve an uncle hidden about there, an old hermit, and a horrid curmudgeon.<page>That hermit’s a hard one to befriend, but he holds some knowledge about this kingdom’s maladies. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 哦！猎手，看你这副惨状。全身像被缠住，比初见时更狼狈了。<hpage>我受到险恶寄生体的侵蚀。虽凭借本源之力阻止了吞噬，仍被大幅削弱。<page>这怎么行！纺络已然陷于一道诅咒，怎能再让另一道来争夺残存的生机。<page>快去王国腹地的钟心镇，我在那有个隐居的叔父，就是脾气臭得很。<page>与他结交并不容易，但他了解不少病症。要说有谁能指点医治方法，非他莫属。
translated_text: 哦！亨特，你不难过吗？你被绑着了，看起来比我们第一次见面时还糟糕！<hpage>我的壳已经成为一种残酷寄生虫的宿主。虽然我的天生力量阻止它完全吞噬我，但它的存在让我变得更弱。<page>好吧，这行不通！法鲁已经陷入了堕落诅咒的陷阱，我们不能再让另一个人竞争利用余生。<page>最好赶紧去我们王国中心的贝尔镇。我有一个叔叔躲在那里，一个老隐士，还有一个脾气暴躁的可怕男人。<page>这位隐士很难结交朋友，但他对王国的疾病有所了解。如果有人能告诉你治疗方法，那就是他。
secondary_translated_text: Oh! Hunter, aren't you sad? You're tied up and look worse than when we first met!<hpage>My shell has become a host for a cruel parasite. Although my natural strength prevents it from completely consuming me, its presence makes me weaker.<page>Okay, this won't work! Faro has fallen into the trap of the curse of corruption, and we cannot let another person compete for the rest of his life.<page>It is best to hurry to the town of Bell in the center of our kingdom. I have an uncle hiding there, an old hermit, and a terrible man with a bad temper.<page>The hermit had difficulty making friends, but he knew something about the kingdom's diseases. If anyone can tell you the treatment, it is him.

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! And... oh! Such fruit! Perfectly ripe! Perfectly fragrant! Perfectly round! Take what you have earned, much of much rosaries!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……极品！熟透！芬芳！浑圆！拿好，念珠多多，你当之无愧！
translated_text: 嗯，珍贵的水果！而且...哦！这样的水果！完全煮熟了！很香！完美的圆圈！拿走你赚的钱，大部分的念珠！
secondary_translated_text: Hmm, precious fruit! And... Oh! Such fruit! Completely cooked! Very fragrant! The perfect circle! Take the money you make, most of the rosary beads!

original_en_text: O-oh! Traveller! Won’t you stop and make trade with an old pilgrim? Surely something here will aid you in your great journey!
original_zh_text: 噢！旅者！来与我做笔交易？总有物件能在旅途中助你一臂之力！
translated_text: 哦！旅行者！你难道不会停下来和一位老朝圣者进行交易吗？这里的东西一定会帮助您踏上伟大的旅程！
secondary_translated_text: Oh! Traveler! Wouldn't you stop and make a deal with an old pilgrim? Things here will definitely help you embark on a great journey!

original_en_text: You keep the fruit for yourself? For greed? Strange choice! It will only weigh you down...
original_zh_text: 私藏果实？贪婪？奇怪选择！徒增负担……
translated_text: 你把水果留给自己吗？为了贪婪？奇怪的选择！这只会让你感觉沉重……
secondary_translated_text: Do you keep the fruit for yourself? For greed? Weird choice! It will only make you feel heavy...

original_en_text: Don’t go thinkin’ fear’s keepin’ me from my own pilgrimage! S’just there’s a lotta work still to do here and few bugs able to do it.
original_zh_text: 别以为我是怕了才不去朝圣！实在是这里活儿多帮手少。
translated_text: 不要认为恐惧阻碍了我自己的朝圣之旅！只是这里要做的工作很多，犯的错误很少。
secondary_translated_text: Don't think fear is getting in the way of my own pilgrimage! It's just that there is a lot of work to be done here and very few mistakes are made.

original_en_text: Sing for our brother, who has died a devout death! All his pains and torments left behind, like the dust shrugged from a traveller’s shawl.
original_zh_text: 为兄弟而歌，他死得虔诚！所有苦痛皆抛却，如旅者抖落披肩尘埃。
translated_text: 为我们虔诚死去的兄弟歌唱！他所有的痛苦和磨难都被抛在脑后，就像旅行者披肩上的尘埃一样。
secondary_translated_text: Sing for our brothers who died piously! All his pain and suffering were left behind, like dust on a traveler's shawl.

original_en_text: Promised, then. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 祈愿已承，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: 所以，是的。一种比罪恶更强大的束缚。给我三块苔藓。珍贵的水果！答应我的愿望，然后工作就开始了！
secondary_translated_text: So, yes. A bondage stronger than sin. Give me three pieces of moss. Precious fruit! Promise my wish, and then the work begins!

original_en_text: Mm. Mmm! Who is it? An intruder! Terrible! To interrupt a humble druid as they work!<hpage>I meant no intrusion, druid. The sound of your laughter drew me to investigate.<hpage>This settlement is built around an old structure of the Weavers. Do you know of them? Do they inhabit this land still?<page>Mm? What settlement? What Weavers?! You speak nonsense!
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯嗯！谁在那儿？入侵者！可恶！竟敢打扰德鲁伊修行！<hpage>无心冒犯，德鲁伊。你的笑声引我前来探查。<hpage>这聚落环绕古织者遗迹而建。你可知晓他们？是否仍居于此？<page>嗯？什么聚落？什么织者？！胡言乱语！
translated_text: 嗯.嗯！是谁？入侵者！太可怕了！打断卑微的德鲁伊工作！<hpage>我的意思是，我无意打扰，德鲁伊。你的笑声吸引了我去调查。<hpage>该定居点是围绕韦弗家族的旧建筑建造的。你认识他们吗？他们还住在这片土地上吗？<page>嗯？什么和解？什么织布工？！你胡说八道！
secondary_translated_text: hmm. Hmm! Who is it? Intruders! It's terrible! Interrupting humble druid work!<hpage>I mean, I don't mean to interrupt, Druid. Your laughter attracted me to investigate.<hpage>The settlement was built around the Weaver family's old buildings. Do you know them? Do they still live on this land?<page>Hmm? What reconciliation? What weaver?! You talk nonsense!

original_en_text: <hpage>Madam, I return seeking power to aid the construction of a trap, at request of your sibling residing atop the Citadel.<page>Aye, hunter. So you managed to rouse the old fool. I’ve known it coming, felt it, and glad I am! <page>Rest’a my family spent far too long huddled and glum... or dead! Not me! I’d always been thinkin’ it a waste to just take what’s coming, when her up top wakes.<page>Better to fight for freedom or go out in a blaze, oh ho!
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，我应你同胞之请归来，寻求助力建造陷阱——他正蛰伏圣堡之中。<page>啊，猎手。你果然说动了那老顽固。我早有预感，真是欣慰！<page>家族里其他虫要么缩着发愁……要么死了！我不一样！早就觉得坐等顶上那位苏醒是浪费生命。<page>宁可死也要争取自由，嚯嚯！
translated_text: <hpage>女士，应您住在城堡顶上的兄弟姐妹的请求，我回来寻求帮助建立陷阱的力量。<page>是的，猎人。所以你设法叫醒了那个老傻瓜。我知道它要来了，感觉到了，我很高兴！<page>休息一下我的家人挤在一起太久了，而且不快乐。或者死！不是我！我一直认为接受她醒来后即将发生的事情是一种浪费。<page>最好是为自由而战，还是到火里去，哦哦！
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Ma 'am, at the request of your brothers and sisters who live on top of the castle, I have returned to seek the power to help build the trap.<page>Yes, hunter. So you managed to wake up the old fool. I knew it was coming, felt it, and I was so happy!<page>Take a break. My family has been huddled together for too long and unhappy. Or die! Not me! I always thought it would be a waste to accept what was about to happen when she woke up.<page>Better to fight for freedom or go to the fire, ooh!

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! Ah... but! This one is not so fresh. Rotten! Stench of death! A meagre amount of rosaries for you. As much as you deserve!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……但这颗不鲜。腐坏！死气熏天！只配少少念珠！
translated_text: 嗯，珍贵的水果！啊...但是！这并不是什么新鲜事。腐烂！死亡的恶臭！送给你的小念珠。做你应得的事！
secondary_translated_text: Hmm, precious fruit! Ah... But! This is nothing new. Rotten! The stench of death! Little rosary beads for you. Do what you deserve!

translated_text: <hpage>皮尔比。朝圣者的名字叫皮尔比。

original_en_text: Once this wishwall is up, bugs’ll be able to seek help from any able shell around. You could even try granting a couple of wishes yourself, missy!
original_zh_text: <page>等这祈愿墙立起来，大伙就能向能者求助了。小姐你说不定还能帮忙实现几个愿望呢！
translated_text: 一旦这堵愿望之墙建立起来，该错误就可以向周围任何有能力的外壳寻求帮助。小姐，您甚至可以尝试实现您的一些愿望！
secondary_translated_text: Once this wall of wishes is established, the error can turn to any capable shell around it for help. Miss, you can even try to realize some of your wishes!

original_en_text: Rest here with me as long as you like. I’m not ready to leave yet, and a little company is always nice.
original_zh_text: 你想休息多久都可以。我尚未准备好启程，有个伴总是好的。
translated_text: 在这里和我一起休息多久都行。我还没准备好离开。有朋友总是件好事。
secondary_translated_text: Rest here with me as long as you like. I'm not ready to leave yet. It's always a good thing to have friends.

original_en_text: Down here, you can’t hear the cries of the pilgrims above, only the faintly ringing bells. I’ll stay and meditate a little longer, before I start my own pilgrimage...
original_zh_text: 在这儿听不见上头朝圣者的哭嚎，只有隐隐钟鸣。启程前我要多冥想会儿……
translated_text: 在这里，你听不到上面朝圣者的哭声，只有微弱的钟声。我会留下来冥想一段时间，然后开始我自己的朝圣之旅……
secondary_translated_text: Here, you can't hear the cries of the pilgrims above, only the faint sound of bells. I would stay and meditate for a while, then embark on my own pilgrimage...

original_en_text: Farewell, brother Pilby. May your shell harden the path for others to tread.
original_zh_text: 永别了，小皮尔比。愿你的甲壳为后来者铺路。
translated_text: 再见，皮尔比兄弟。愿你的身体为他人铺平道路。
secondary_translated_text: Goodbye, brother Pierby. May your body pave the way for others.

original_en_text: ...Hm. Who here knows the name of this little pilgrim?
original_zh_text: ……嗯。在场有谁记得这虫的名字？
translated_text: ...那么，这里有谁知道这个小朝圣者的名字呢？
secondary_translated_text: ... So, who here knows the name of this little pilgrim?

original_en_text: Common stuff, shell shards, but very practical. I can use ‘em to patch almost anything up, and this camp’s always in need of some mending.
original_zh_text: 甲壳碎片虽然普通，但实用。我能拿它们修补大半东西，这营地可少不了修修补补。
translated_text: 常见的东西，贝壳碎片，但非常实用。我可以用它们修复几乎任何东西，而这个营地总是需要一些修复。
secondary_translated_text: Common thing, shell fragments, but very practical. I can repair almost anything with them, and this camp always needs some repairs.

original_en_text: And another poor pilgrim lost, eh? Just the thought of it makes me weary. Better to put my head down and work ‘til the job’s done...
original_zh_text: 又没了个朝圣者？光想想就累得慌。还是干活吧……
translated_text: 又一个可怜的朝圣者失踪了，嗯？光是想到这个我就觉得累。最好低着头工作，直到工作完成。
secondary_translated_text: Another poor pilgrim disappeared, huh? I feel tired just thinking about this. It is best to work with your head down until the work is completed.

original_en_text: Hm? A fellow pilgrim, are you? About to start your great journey to the holy Citadel up top?<hpage>I am no pilgrim, sir, though it seems we will be travelling a similar path.<page>Not a pilgrim? Well, it makes no difference, I suppose. We all must walk the roads, up and up, though most of us will fall long before we see the grand gates.<page>If you’re wise, you’ll stop here and rest a while before heading out into that dangerous world...
original_zh_text: 嗯？你也是朝圣者？准备启程攀登圣堡了？<hpage>我并非朝圣者，先生，但前路或许相仿。<page>不是？也罢。众生皆须行路攀爬，但大多未睹圣门便殒命。<page>你若明智，启程前应该在此休整……
translated_text: 嗯？你是一个朝圣者，不是吗？您准备好开始前往圣城的伟大旅程了吗？<hpage>先生，我不是朝圣者，尽管我们似乎也会走上类似的道路。<page>他们不是朝圣者吗？好吧，我想这没什么区别。我们都必须在路上走来走去，尽管我们中的大多数人在看到宏伟的大门之前都会摔倒。<page>如果你明智的话，你会在这里停下来休息一会儿，然后前往那个危险的世界……
secondary_translated_text: Hmm? You're a pilgrim, aren't you? Are you ready for your great journey to the Holy City?<hpage>Sir, I am not a pilgrim, although it seems that we will embark on a similar path.<page>Aren't they pilgrims? Well, I guess it makes no difference. We all have to walk up and down the road, although most of us fall before we see the majestic gate.<page>If you were wise, you would stop here to rest for a while, and then head to that dangerous world...

original_en_text: And for the parting, a gift. An amulet of we druids. Or me druid? No others, I think.<page>May it ease your sorrows, wish granter. May it cry for you when no tears are left!
original_zh_text: 临别赠礼。我们德鲁伊护符。或者，我的护符？似乎只剩我。<page>希望它能缓解你的哀伤，授愿者。眼泪干涸时，护符为你哭泣！
translated_text: 临别前，还有另一份礼物。我们德鲁伊的护身符。或者我是德鲁伊？我想没有其他人了。<page>愿它减轻你的悲伤，祝福者。当眼泪不剩时，愿它为你哭泣！
secondary_translated_text: Before parting, there was another gift. The amulet of our druids. Or am I a druid? I don't think there's anyone else.<page>May it ease your sorrow, well-wishers. When there are no tears left, may they cry for you!

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm! You carry a sweet, precious smell with you. A fruit! Will you trade it for rosaries?
original_zh_text: 嗯嗯！嗯！你身上的甜美气息。鲜果！用念珠交换？
translated_text: 嗯！嗯！你身上带着甜蜜而珍贵的气味。水果！你愿意把它换成念珠吗？
secondary_translated_text: Hmm! Hmm! You carry a sweet and precious smell. Fruit! Would you exchange it for rosary beads?

original_en_text: <hpage>I wonder, little pilgrim. What calls you and your fellows up to the Citadel? If the way is dangerous, why take the journey at all?<page>Strange question to be asking of a pilgrim. Our holy land calls on us. To journey up is our greatest task. Who are we to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climb through flaming fields, across rolling moors, and up great gilded steps. All to reach that eternal, shining Citadel.<page>Once I’m good and ready, I’ll make the climb myself...
original_zh_text: <hpage>小朝圣者，我有些好奇。是什么召唤你前往圣堡？既然道途凶险，为何仍要涉险？<page>问朝圣者这话可真怪。圣堡召唤，攀登就是我等天职。怎么能违抗？<page>凭着信仰穿越火野，踏过灰沼，登上金阶。只为抵达永恒辉煌的圣堡。<page>待准备妥当，我就会启程……
translated_text: <hpage>我想知道，小朝圣者。是什么让你和你的同伴来到城堡？如果道路很危险，为什么要走这一段路呢？<page>向朝圣者提出奇怪的问题。我们的圣地在召唤我们。向上旅行是我们最大的任务。我们有资格拒绝谁？<page>在信仰的指引下，我们爬过火红色的田野，翻过连绵起伏的沼泽，登上宏伟的镀金台阶。一切都是为了到达那座永恒、闪亮的城堡。<page>一旦我准备好了，我就会自己爬上去。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I want to know, little pilgrim. What brought you and your companions to the castle? If the road is dangerous, why take this stretch of road?<page>Asking strange questions to pilgrims. Our holy land calls us. Traveling upward is our biggest task. Who are we qualified to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climbed through fiery red fields, climbed rolling swamps, and climbed the majestic gilded steps. It's all about reaching that eternal, shining castle.<page>As soon as I'm ready, I'll climb up there myself.

original_en_text: Mmm. Mmm! The pain... my mind aches. Why? The berries, the nasty fruits. Oh the visions!<page>You, wish promiser. Wish granter. You brought me what I needed and stayed by my side. Companion through my ordeal. I could ask for nothing more.
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯！痛楚……心如火灼。为什么？莓果，秽果。啊，那些幻象！<page>你，应诺者，授愿者。你实现我愿，伴我受难。我再无所求。
translated_text: 嗯.嗯！痛苦...我的心很痛。为什么？浆果，烦人的水果。噢，幻象！<page>你，希望的承诺。许愿人你给了我所需要的，并在我身边。陪伴我度过了磨难。我不能要求更多了。
secondary_translated_text: hmm. Hmm! Pain... My heart hurts. Why? Berries, annoying fruit. Oh, visions!<page>You, the promise of hope. You gave me what I needed and were by my side. Accompanied me through my ordeal. I couldn't ask for more.

original_en_text: Ahhh! Ahhh-ohhhh! The smell is right! Like the others! But very young! Oh, voice of the woods! Oh, dance of the queen! Oh... oh! Beat harder, let us hear it! Oh! Ohhhhhhhh!
original_zh_text: 啊啊！啊——噢！气味对了！就像其他！但尚幼嫩！啊，林间之声！啊，女王之舞！啊……啊！搏动吧，让我聆听！啊！啊啊啊！
translated_text: 啊！啊！味道不错！像其他人一样！但年轻！哦，树林的声音！哦，女王之舞！哦...哦！用力推，让我们听到它！哦！哦哈哈哈哈！
secondary_translated_text: Ah! Ah! It tastes good! Like everyone else! But young! Oh, the sound of the woods! Oh, dance of the queen! Oh... Oh! Push hard so we can hear it! Oh! Oh hahahaha!

original_en_text: Sing, brothers and sisters! Sing, and drown out this burdensome sorrow! Sing out the name of this poor pilgrim, whose journey had nary begun!
original_zh_text: 唱吧，兄弟姐妹！用歌声淹没这沉痛哀伤！为这未启程便陨落的朝圣者高歌！
translated_text: 唱吧，兄弟姐妹们！歌唱并淹没这沉重的悲伤！唱起这位可怜的朝圣者的名字，他的旅程尚未开始！
secondary_translated_text: Sing, brothers and sisters! Sing and drown this heavy sadness! Sing the name of this poor pilgrim, whose journey has not yet begun!

original_en_text: Have you heard the talk of what waits just beyond this camp?<page>Brittle caverns of bone, the very base of Pharloom, filled with all manner of deadly creatures and jagged dangers.<page>It’s said ancient bugs once made their homes amidst it.<page>Who could believe! In such a hostile, unstable place! In all my time, I’ve never met a bug so brave.
original_zh_text: 你可曾听闻营地外的传闻？<page>骸骨脆岩构成纺络的基底，布满凶兽利齿。<page>据说古虫曾在此安家。<page>谁信啊！这种险恶之地！我这辈子没见过这么勇敢的虫。
translated_text: 您听说过这个营地外等待着您的是什么吗？<page>位于法鲁姆底部的脆弱骨头洞充满了各种致命生物和锯齿状的危险。<page>据说古代昆虫曾经栖息在这里。<page>谁能相信！在这样一个充满敌意，不稳定的地方！我一生中从未遇到过如此勇敢的昆虫。
secondary_translated_text: Have you heard what awaits you outside this camp?<page>The fragile bone hole at the bottom of Farum is full of deadly creatures and jagged dangers.<page>It is said that ancient insects once inhabited here.<page>Who can believe it! In such a hostile, unstable place! I have never encountered such a brave insect in my life.

original_en_text: Sister, sister! What is that long, gleaming tooth you carry with you? Is it a weapon?<hpage>It is indeed, though you need not fear. I will not raise it against you. Its edge is meant for predators and other foes.<hpage>I strongly suggest you arm yourself similarly before your own journey begins.<page>Alas... for a pilgrim, that’s sin you speak of, sister.<page>We arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 姐妹！你带的闪亮长牙是武器吗？<hpage>正是，但无需惧怕。此刃只与掠食者与敌手相向。<hpage>强烈建议你启程前也备件武器。<page>唉……姐妹此言对朝圣者实属亵渎。我等以祷言为刃，以信仰为盾，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: 姐姐，姐姐！你随身携带的那颗闪亮的牙齿是什么？这是武器吗？<hpage>这是真的，尽管你不必害怕。我不会向你提及这件事。它的优势是捕食者和其他敌人。<hpage>我强烈建议在踏上旅程之前以类似的方式武装自己。<page>唉...对于朝圣者来说，这就是你所说的罪恶，姐姐。<page>我们用祈祷来武装自己，用信仰来装扮自己，希望它们足以成就城堡的荣耀。我们就是这么做
secondary_translated_text: Sister, sister! What is that shining tooth you carry around? Is this a weapon?<hpage>This is true, although you don't have to be afraid. I won't mention this to you. Its advantages are predators and other enemies.<hpage>I strongly recommend arming yourself in a similar manner before embarking on a journey.<page>Alas... For pilgrims, this is what you call a sin, sister.<page>We arm ourselves with prayers and dress ourselves with beliefs, hoping that they will be enough to achieve the glory of the castle. that's how we do

original_en_text: Oh! Back again? The wishwall is up! Ready for all the poor souls who’ve been left behind down here.<page>In Pharloom, wishes are granted to those truly devout, or so they say. And there ain’t no harm in us dregs having wishes too.<page>Why, I even went and added a little wish of my own to the wishwall! Fair’s fair. I did build the thing. Seems like the kingdom should be granting my wish before anyone else’s.
original_zh_text: 哦！回来啦？祈愿墙完工了！就等底下这些可怜虫来许愿了。<page>纺络的愿望只赐给真正虔诚的虫，都这么说。但咱这些底层渣滓许个愿总不犯法吧？<page>嘿，我还在墙上偷偷加了自己的小愿望！公平嘛，墙是我造的，圣堡该先实现我的愿望才对。
translated_text: 噢！又回来了？愿望之墙已经升起！为留在这里的所有可怜的灵魂做好准备。<page>在法鲁，愿望被授予那些真正虔诚的人，或者他们说的。我们这些渣男有没有愿望并不重要。<page>为什么，我甚至在愿望墙上加了一个我自己的小愿望！公平就是公平。我做了这个东西。看来王国应该先满足我的愿望。
secondary_translated_text: Oh! Back again? The wall of wishes has risen! Prepare for all the poor souls who remain here.<page>In Faro, wishes are granted to those who are truly pious, or what they say. It doesn't matter whether we scumbags have wishes or not.<page>Why, I even added a little wish of my own on the wish wall! Fairness is fairness. I made this thing. It seems that the kingdom should satisfy my wish first.

original_en_text: <hpage>What’s this you’re building, sir? A sign of some kind?<page>Aye, aye. You’re a sharp bug! A wishwall. It’s past time this old camp had one. As the resident fixer, I’ve taken it upon myself to sort it out.<page>They’re a popular thing about Pharloom, wishwalls. Useful too. So many prayers left unanswered. Gives ‘em a place to go.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生这是在建造什么？某种标识？<page>啊，好眼力！这是祈愿墙。这老营地早该有一个。身为驻场维修师，自然该由我操办。<page>祈愿墙在纺络可流行了，很实用。那么多没回音的祈愿，总得有个归处。
translated_text: <hpage>先生，你在建造什么？一些迹象？<page>是啊是啊你是一只锋利的昆虫！愿望之墙。这个老营地应该有一个。作为一名常驻修复者，我承担了自己解决这个问题的责任。<page>它们是法鲁（Pharloom）“愿望墙”中很受欢迎的东西。它也很有用。太多的祈祷没有得到回应。给了他们一个地方去。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Sir, what are you building? Some signs?<page>Yes, yes, you are a sharp insect! Wall of wishes. This old camp should have one. As a resident restorer, I took on my own responsibility for solving this problem.<page>They are a popular item in Pharloom's "Wall of Wishes". It's also very useful. Too many prayers go unanswered. Gave them a place to go.

original_en_text: I must listen carefully... and pray with uninterrupted devotion. Only then will my faith be strong enough... to carry me upward...
original_zh_text: 必须专注聆听……虔心祷告。唯有如此，方能坚定信念，支撑我攀登……
translated_text: 我不得不仔细听...虔诚地祈祷，不要中断。只有这样，我的信念才能足够坚定。带我上去。
secondary_translated_text: I had to listen carefully... Pray devoutly and don't interrupt. Only in this way can my belief be firm enough. Take me up.

original_en_text: S’not a surprise it’s you rallying us to action, hunter. You had the sense about you, a bug bringing change’n all.<page>Course you’re more than just a bug, aint’cha! More than Weaver. Guess it’d take someone like you for my family to dare hope at success.<page>Go and prove our trust now, won’t you? We’ve spent our lifetimes wishing for another path. With a bit of luck, you might grant it.
original_zh_text: 果然是你来召集我们行动，猎手。我初见便知你是变革者。<page>当然，你并非寻常虫类，也不止是织者。看来只有你这般存在，才让我族敢奢望成功。<page>现在就去证明你值得我们托付吧？我们毕生渴求踏上另一条道路。如果运气眷顾，你或许能成全我们。
translated_text: 你号召我们采取行动并不奇怪，猎人。你对自己有一种感觉，一个带来改变的错误。<page>当然，你不仅仅是一个虫子，是吗？比韦弗还多。我想只有像你这样的人，我的家人才敢于希望成功。<page>我们现在就去证明我们的信任，好吗？我们一生都希望有另一条道路。如果你幸运，你可能会实现它。
secondary_translated_text: It's no surprise you called on us to take action, hunter. You have a feeling about yourself, a mistake that brings change.<page>Of course, you're not just a bug, are you? More than Weaver. I think only people like you, my family dares to hope for success.<page>Let's go and prove our trust now, okay? All our lives we have hoped for another path. If you are lucky, you may achieve it.

original_en_text: Well. Though this pilgrim’s name has been lost, still we sing.
original_zh_text: 罢了。虽名讳已失，歌声依旧。
translated_text: 好.尽管朝圣者的名字消失了，但我们仍然唱歌。
secondary_translated_text: good. Although the pilgrim's name disappeared, we still sang.

original_en_text: Been hearing awful whispers in camp, about pilgrims driven mad by the hardships of the climb, crying out and attacking their fellows.<page>You’ve been out there. Tell me, is it really so?<hpage>You’ve heard it true, sir. On the roads, both pilgrims and beasts alike are consumed, driven to violence by a haunted thread, the source of which I have yet to discover.<page>Ah... I’d feared it was so. I won’t be able to trust a single face out on the path, then.<page>The risk of death was daunting enough, but the loneliness of such a journey, that seems almost too much to bear... Ah well. Just another test of our devotion, I suppose.
original_zh_text: 营地里常听到些可怖的流言，说攀登艰辛逼疯朝圣者，使其癫狂嚎叫，袭击同伴。<page>你是从外面来的。告诉我，真有这种事？<hpage>传言非虚，先生。路上朝圣者与野兽皆遭丝咒侵蚀，陷入狂暴，其源未明。<page>唉……果然。看来路上谁都不能信了。<page>死亡已经足够可怕，但独行的寂寞……简直难以承受……也罢，这是我等信仰必经的试炼。
translated_text: 营地里传出可怕的低语声，说朝圣者对攀登的艰辛感到疯狂，哭泣并攻击同伴。<page>你去过那里。告诉我，真的是这样吗？<hpage>您已经听说这是真的，先生。在路上，朝圣者和野兽被闹鬼的丝线吞没，迫使他们陷入暴力，而我还没有发现它的根源。<page>啊...恐怕事情就是这样发展的。那么，我就不敢相信这条路上的任何面孔了。<page>死亡的风险已经够令人畏惧的了，但这样的旅程的孤独似乎几乎难以忍受……好吧，我想这只是对我们忠诚度的又一次考验。
secondary_translated_text: Terrifying whispers came from the camp, saying that the pilgrims were crazy about the hardships of the climb, cried and attacked their companions.<page>You've been there. Tell me, is this really the case?<hpage>You have heard that this is true, sir. Along the way, pilgrims and beasts are swallowed up by haunted threads, forcing them into violence, and I have not yet discovered its origin.<page>Ah... I'm afraid that's how things are going. I can't believe any of the faces on this road.<page>The risk of death is daunting enough, but the loneliness of such a journey seems almost unbearable... well, I guess this is just another test of our loyalty.

original_en_text: We pilgrims arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 朝圣者以祷言为刃，披信仰为甲，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: 我们朝圣者用祈祷武装自己，用信仰打扮自己，并希望它们足以实现城堡的荣耀。我们就是这么做
secondary_translated_text: We pilgrims arm ourselves with prayers, dress ourselves with beliefs, and hope that they will be enough to realize the glory of the castle. that's how we do

original_en_text: <hpage>What duty binds you to this old chapel, madam? The structure barely stands, and I see no signs of congregation.<page>Aye! Gone! The lot’o them, fled and hidden. But I’m not leaving till I’ve set this place right...<page>...It’s that Citadel above, you see. Even now, in Pharloom’s long decline, the simple bugs, they’re witless before it. Too grand. Too majestic. Too powerful.<page>This building’s state is a sad example of those who’d dare suggest another path...
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，是何职责将你束缚在这破败教堂？此处梁柱倾颓，更无信众踪影。<page>唉！都散了！逃的逃藏的藏。但我要留下……直到把这儿整顿妥当……<page>……你瞧，都是上头圣堡造的孽。即便纺络衰败至此，愚昧虫众仍对其俯首。太宏伟，太威严，太强大。<page>这座建筑的惨状，正是胆敢另辟蹊径者的下场……
translated_text: <hpage>女士，您对这座古老的教堂有什么义务？大楼几乎站不住了，我也没有看到聚集的迹象。<page>是的！走吧！他们中的许多人逃离并躲藏起来。但在我修复这个地方之前我不会离开.<page>...你看，就是上面的城堡。即使是现在，在法勒姆长期衰落的过程中，这些简单的错误在它之前也是愚蠢的。这太棒了。太雄伟了。它太强大了。<page>对于那些敢于建议另一条道路的人来说，这座建筑的状况是一个悲伤的例子。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Ma 'am, what obligations do you have to this ancient church? The building could hardly stand, and I saw no sign of gathering.<page>Yes! Let's go! Many of them fled and went into hiding. But I'm not leaving until I fix this place.<page>... You see, it's the castle above. Even now, in the course of Farham's long decline, these simple mistakes were foolish before it. This is great. It's so majestic. It's too powerful.<page>For those who dare suggest another path, the condition of the building is a sad example.

original_en_text: Eh? What fortune is this? Our wish answered, even in a moment so dark!<page>You’ve proved quite the saviour, miss, and you’ve certainly earned the appreciation of this whole sorry lot.<hpage>You are welcome, sir. For you few, I hope these supplies may aid.
original_zh_text: 哎呀！这什么好运？这么黑暗危险的时刻祈愿居然实现了。<page>您真是救星啊小姐，我们这群可怜虫都打心眼里感激您。<hpage>能帮上忙就好。希望这点补给对你们有用。
translated_text: 啊？这是什么财富？即使在这黑暗的时刻，我们的愿望也实现了！<page>小姐，你已经证明了自己是救世主，你当然赢得了这些穷人的钦佩。<hpage>不客气，先生。对于你们中的一些人来说，我希望这些用品能有所帮助。
secondary_translated_text: Huh? What wealth is this? Even in this dark moment, our wish has come true!<page>Miss, you have proven yourself to be the savior, and you have certainly won the admiration of these poor people.<hpage>You're welcome, sir. For some of you, I hope these supplies help.

original_en_text: You, in the cloak... pray tread softly. I am meditating, gathering my faith... before my pilgrimage begins.<hpage>My steps are soft enough, madam. If I have disturbed you, it was not my intent.<page>Ahh... even your speech... far too loud. I can scarcely hear my thoughts. Please, be away...
original_zh_text: 穿披风那位……脚步放轻。我在冥想聚神……为朝圣做准备。<hpage>脚步够轻了，女士。若打扰了你实非本意。<page>唉……连说话声……都太吵。静不下心。请快离开……
translated_text: 你，穿着斗篷。轻轻祈祷。我正在冥想，收集我的信仰。在我的朝圣之旅开始之前。<hpage>我的脚步足够轻柔，女士。如果我打扰你，那不是我的本意。<page>啊...甚至你的演讲。太吵了我几乎听不到自己的想法。请离开。
secondary_translated_text: You, wearing a cloak. Pray softly. I am meditating and gathering my beliefs. Before my pilgrimage began.<hpage>My steps are gentle enough, ma 'am. If I bother you, that's not my intention.<page>Ah... Even your speech. It was so noisy that I could hardly hear my thoughts. Please leave.

original_en_text: I see you’ve gone and opened up the great bone gate back there. And without even asking my permission! Feeling curious, were you?<hpage>There is a vast grave beyond. I’d assumed most bugs died climbing the path, but it seems many fell before their trek had barely commenced.<page>Aye! Lost their lives to beasts, or to luck turned rotten. Others were simply formed too frail.<page>At least those poor souls can rest together. Death and death and death, the eternal promise of our eternal kingdom. Eventually, it claims us all.
original_zh_text: 看来你擅自开了后头的巨大骨门，甚至问都不问我！不怕好奇害死虫？<hpage>门后是片巨冢。本以为众虫多是殒命在攀登途中，但似是有许多死于起步？<page>唉！有的死于猛兽，有的运气不好，也有天生孱弱的。<page>但至少这些可怜虫可以共眠。无止尽的死亡，永恒国度的永恒承诺，终将吞噬众生。
translated_text: 我看到你离开了，打开了那里的巨大骨门。甚至没有征求我的同意！你很好奇，不是吗？<hpage>远处有一座巨大的坟墓。我以为大多数虫子都是在攀登这条路时死去的，但似乎很多虫子在徒步开始前就掉了下来。<page>是的！他们的生命要么被野兽夺走，要么被运气腐蚀。其他人的形状太脆弱了。<page>至少那些可怜的灵魂可以一起安息。死亡是我们永恒王国的永恒承诺。最终，它夺走了我们所有人的生命。
secondary_translated_text: I saw you leave, opening the giant bone door there. Without even asking for my consent! You're curious, aren't you?<hpage>There is a huge tomb in the distance. I thought most of the bugs died while climbing this road, but it seems that many of the bugs fell off before the hike started.<page>Yes! Their lives were either taken away by wild beasts or corrupted by luck. Other people's shapes are too fragile.<page>At least those poor souls can rest in peace together. Death is the eternal promise of our eternal kingdom. In the end, it took all of our lives.

original_en_text: Hunter! I’m thinking it was you that cleared my basement?<hpage>On first arrival here, the nesting creatures didn’t take kindly to my passing.<page>Ohho. They’re cranky bugs, alright. And they made an awful mess down here with their hatching and breeding.<page>You’ve my many thanks for seeing them off!
original_zh_text: 猎手！地窖里的那些家伙是你清理的？<hpage>初到此地时，那些栖居者可不待见我路过。<page>哈哈，都是些坏脾气的虫子。他们孵卵繁衍把下面搞得一团糟。<page>多谢你赶走了它们！
translated_text: 亨特！我想你清理了我的地下室？<hpage>当我第一次到达这里时，筑巢的生物对我的去世并没有留下深刻的印象。<page>哦嗬。他们是脾气暴躁的虫子，好吧。它们的孵化和繁殖让这个地方变得一团糟。<page>非常感谢您为他们送行！
secondary_translated_text: Hunter! I think you cleaned out my basement?<hpage>When I first arrived here, the nesting creatures were not deeply impressed by my passing.<page>Oh ho. They're grumpy bugs, okay. Their incubation and reproduction have turned this place into a mess.<page>Thank you very much for seeing them off!

original_en_text: <hpage>The bugs of your land, I have watched them, climbing towards their absolution without the flicker of a thought to what it means.<page>Aye. But isn’t it always such for those snared to serve your higher caste?<page>Our mortal mob did once act some defiance, unawares maybe, but successful in part, goaded towards it by Weavers’ will’n all.<hpage>You speak of the Citadel? Its former function has failed, but I can still sense its purpose, some. It is church and cage both.<page>Aye. Devised by your ancestors that monstrosity, and their wicked, clever minds. A system, or a web they’d likely call it, a way to keep their mother sealed in slumber, and themselves free to lavish in their false rule.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我观察了这片土地的虫。他们一心爬向救赎，却不懂这意味着什么。<page>是啊，但被你们高等族群使唤的不都这样。<page>我们凡虫不是没反抗过。当年被织者忽悠着，居然还真成了点事。<hpage>你说圣堡？虽然荒废了，还是能感觉到它的用途：既是教堂又是牢笼。<page>是啊。你祖辈造的这怪物，用狡猾心思织成网，让母亲陷入沉眠，自己却在外面称王。
translated_text: <hpage>我亲眼目睹了你们土地上的昆虫，正在向它们的宽恕爬去，但我不知道这意味着什么。<page>是的，但是那些为你的高种姓服务的人不都是这样做的吗？<page>我们的凡人暴徒确实做出了一些抵抗行为，也许是在不知不觉中，但在韦弗的意志和所有的刺激下，他们部分成功了。<hpage>你是说城堡吗？它之前的功能已经失败了，但我仍然能感受到它的一些目的。它既是一座教堂，又是一个笼子。<page>是的，你们的祖先创造了这些怪物，以及他们邪恶、聪明的头脑。他们可能会称之为一个系统或网络，一种让母亲入睡并让自己在错误的规则中自由挥霍的方式。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I have witnessed with my own eyes the insects in your land crawling towards their forgiveness, but I don't know what that means.<page>Yes, but isn't that what all those who serve your high caste do?<page>Our mortal thugs did make some resistance, perhaps unknowingly, but with Weaver's will and all the stimulation, they partially succeeded.<hpage>You mean the castle? Its previous functions have failed, but I can still feel some of its purposes. It is both a church and a cage.<page>Yes, your ancestors created these monsters and their evil, intelligent minds. They might call it a system or network, a way to put mothers to sleep and let themselves squander freely among the wrong rules.

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work.<page>Ahh. Know you distort the order of things, Old One. It is a rare want of your caste to serve us mortal bugs.<hpage>I am not my kin, Maker. I have seen enough pain born of their dominion. As much as I may, I choose to stand apart.<page>If your blood allows it so... And my thanks still for the lacquer. Pharloom’s fresh faces will welcome its sheen.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>啊呀，古老者，这怎么合适。侍奉我们凡虫可不是你们族群的作风。<hpage>我和同族不一样。看够了他们统治下的苦难，自然不会同流合污。<page>不知您的同族会怎么想……但还是多谢漆料。纺络的新面孔会喜欢的。
translated_text: <hpage>制造商，我从下面的伯哈特运来了一批货物，为您的长期工作提供油漆。<page>啊，我知道你扭曲了事情的秩序，老头。为我们这些凡人的虫子服务是你这个种姓的罕见愿望。<hpage>我不是我的亲戚，制造者。我已经看到了足够多的他们的统治造成的痛苦。尽管我可能会，但我选择置身事外。<page>如果你的血液允许.我仍然很欣赏油漆。法鲁的新鲜面孔将迎来光明。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Manufacturer, I have shipped a shipment from Burhart below to provide paint for your long work.<page>Ah, I know you've twisted the order of things, old man. Serving us mortal bugs is a rare desire of your caste.<hpage>I am not my relative, the maker. I have seen enough of the suffering caused by their rule. Although I might, I chose to stay out of it.<page>If your blood allows it. I still appreciate the paint. Faro's fresh face will usher in the light.

original_en_text: Until cavern’s collapse, the masks must be made!
original_zh_text: 直到洞窟崩塌，雕刻都不能停！
translated_text: 面具必须在洞穴倒塌之前制作好！
secondary_translated_text: The mask must be made before the cave collapses!

original_en_text: Enough talk, Old One. My contract remains. I’ll work till caverns’ collapse.<hpage>Very well, Maker. If it is within my power to do so, I shall see your lands saved.
original_zh_text: 聊够了吧，古老者。契约还在，我要继续刻面甲，直到大地崩塌。<hpage>好吧，匠师。要是有办法，我会保护好这片土地。
translated_text: 够了，老头。我的合同仍然有效。我会工作到洞穴倒塌。<hpage>很好，制造者。如果我有能力做到这一点，我就会看到你的土地得到拯救。
secondary_translated_text: Enough, old man. My contract is still valid. I will work until the cave collapses.<hpage>Very good, maker. If I had the ability to do this, I would see your land saved.

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt the stirrings of our monarch, even all the way out here, the tremors of her kin brought close.<page>You’re planning a confrontation with her then? The one atop? Our great, frayed god?<hpage>Our meeting seems inevitable, though first I seek the strength to ensure a favourable outcome.<page>Ha! As I’d have guessed! Your ancient kind aren’t told to abide one another peaceably.<page>Well, assuming you prevail, I’ll ask only that my labour may continue. No matter the state of these lands, you should well know the necessity of my service.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。连我这都能感觉到那位的躁动，想必就是因为你。<page>所以你打算要去她算账？找我们伟大却又衰败的女王？<hpage>迟早要见，但我得先积蓄力量。<page>哈！早猜到了！你们古族从来都是窝里斗。<page>要是你赢了，我只求能继续刻面甲。无论王国结局如何，我的活都不能停。
translated_text: 啊老头，像你这样的人应该知道这样揭露我是不礼貌的。当面纱揭开时，任务就变得艰巨。<hpage>我渴望听到你清晰的声音，制造者，尽管你可能会抗议。<page>是的，有你在这里并不太令人震惊。我感受到了我们君主的兴奋，即使在这里，她亲戚的颤抖也近在咫尺。<page>那你要和她打架吗？上面的那个？我们伟大而疲惫的上帝？<hpage>我们的会面似乎不可避免，尽管我首先寻求力量来确保有利的结果。<page>哈！正如我猜的那样！你们古代的族人没有被告知要和平生活。<page>好吧，假设你赢了，我所要求的就是我的劳动能够继续下去。无论这片土地的状况如何，你都应该非常清楚我服务的必要性。
secondary_translated_text: Ah old man, people like you should know it's impolite to expose me like this. When the veil is lifted, the task becomes arduous.<hpage>I long to hear your clear voice, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Yes, it's not too shocking to have you here. I feel the excitement of our monarch, and even here, the tremors of her relatives are so close at hand.<page>So are you going to fight with her? The one above? Our great and tired God?<hpage>Our meeting seemed inevitable, although I first sought the strength to ensure a favorable outcome.<page>Ha! Just as I guessed! Your ancient people were not told to live in peace.<page>Well, assuming you win, all I ask is that my labor can continue. No matter what the state of this land is, you should be very aware of the need for my services.

original_en_text: Back again, Old One? The effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... those are plainly sensed. The fate for these caverns feels grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 又来了古老者？我感觉到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: 又回来了吗，老头？你的影响力。与苍白的母亲发生争执……这些都是显而易见的。这些洞穴的命运是严峻的。<page>我认为事情是否变得越来越复杂？或者这就是预料之中的结果吗？<hpage>在我们的会面中，我们受到了致命的打击，但君主死亡的绝望痛苦现在威胁着整个王国。<page>哈！我并不惊讶！总是这样，对吧？你们的古老物种正在争夺霸主地位，而我们的凡人昆虫则在下面被无形地压扁。<hpage>这就是我寻求的自由，创造者。这可能很天真，但这不是我想要的命运。
secondary_translated_text: Back again, old man? Your influence. Disputes with my pale mother... these are obvious. The fate of these caves is grim.<page>Do I think things are getting more and more complicated? Or is this the expected result?<hpage>During our meeting, we had suffered a fatal blow, but the desperate pain of the monarch's death now threatened the entire kingdom.<page>Ha! I'm not surprised! Always like this, right? Your ancient species are vying for supremacy, while our mortal insects are being squashed invisibly below.<hpage>This is the freedom I seek, creator. It may be naive, but it is not the fate I want.

original_en_text: All deserve a face. A chance to be! Until I wither, for the faceless I shall provide.
original_zh_text: 所有生灵都该有张脸，有机会存在！只要我还没倒下，就会给无面者造脸。
translated_text: 每个人都应该有一张脸。机会！我将养活那些没有面孔的人，直到我枯萎为止。
secondary_translated_text: Everyone should have a face. Opportunity! I will feed those who have no faces until I wither.

original_en_text: To exist, to die, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 不论死活，都得有一张脸。这是根本。
translated_text: 为了生存和死亡，需要一张脸。这是最重要的事情。
secondary_translated_text: In order to survive and die, a face is needed. This is the most important thing.

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work. <page>Good! Good! To seal. To protect. May Pharloom’s fresh faces gleam bright.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>好！好！用来封存，用来保护。让纺络的新面孔闪闪发亮。
translated_text: <hpage>制造商，我从下面的伯哈特运来了一批货物，为您的长期工作提供油漆。<page>好！好！印为了保护。五月法罗的新面孔闪闪发光。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Manufacturer, I have shipped a shipment from Burhart below to provide paint for your long work.<page>Good! Good! Seal for protection. May Farrow's new face shines.

original_en_text: Take reward for service made, visitor! Gift for you, to spend or treasure!
original_zh_text: 收下报酬吧客人！要用掉还是收着都行！
translated_text: 游客，因所提供的服务获得奖励！送给您的礼物可以花掉或珍惜！
secondary_translated_text: Tourists receive rewards for the services provided! Gifts for you can be spent or cherished!

original_en_text: A visitor! Grand you are. But you have already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 欢迎！尊贵的客人。可你已经有面甲了，已经有脸了。我的刻刀只为无面者服务。
translated_text: 访客！你太好了但你已经有口罩了。他已经有脸了。我必须为那些没有它的人雕刻。
secondary_translated_text: Visitors! That's so sweet of you, but you already have a mask. He already has face. I have to carve for those who don't have it.

original_en_text: To work! To work! The masks must be carved.
original_zh_text: 雕刻！雕刻！必须继续雕刻面甲。
translated_text: 去上班吧！去上班吧！面具必须雕刻。
secondary_translated_text: Go to work! Go to work! The mask must be carved.

original_en_text: Did you treat with the creature upon the summit?<page>Your legged ancestors once found her company compelling, enough to build their chambers and their calling device at the height of this perilous peak.<hpage>I have paid my respects, and been granted her favour. Her down now fills my cloak, and does much to ward against the frost of these heights.<page>To pass something so precious... That’s a mighty gift you’ve been given. Seems she’s thrown her lot in with you.<page>I’d not have guessed her so opposed to our threaded monarch, but then she too must have sensed the wretched state of things, and the harsher change to come.
original_zh_text: 见过山顶上那位了吗？<page>你那些多足的先祖对她十分信服，甚至在这么险的山峰上修了屋子打造机器。<hpage>我去拜访过了，也受到了她的青睐，得了这身御寒的绒毛。<page>连这个都送你……真是下了血本。她把宝押在你身上了。<page>没想到她这么反对苍白之主，恐怕她也看出纺络情况不对，有大事要发生了。
translated_text: 你和山顶上的生物打过交道吗？<page>你的腿祖先曾经发现她的陪伴很有吸引力，可以在这座危险山峰的山顶建造他们的房间和呼叫设备。<hpage>我表达了我的尊重并赢得了她的青睐。她的羽绒现在填满了我的斗篷，非常有助于抵抗这些高霜冻。<page>交付如此珍贵的东西。这是你得到的一份强大的礼物。看来她已经把命运交给你了<page>没想到她会如此反对我们的螺纹君主，但她一定也感受到了事情的悲惨处境和即将到来的更严重的变化。
secondary_translated_text: Have you ever interacted with creatures on mountain tops?<page>Your leg ancestor once found her company attractive and could build their rooms and calling equipment on the top of this dangerous mountain.<hpage>I expressed my respect and won her favor. Her down now fills my cloak and is very helpful in resisting these high frosts.<page>Delivery of something so precious. This is a powerful gift you get. Looks like she's given her destiny to you.<page>I didn't expect her to oppose our screw monarch so much, but she must also feel the tragic situation of things and the more serious changes that are coming.

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt, and heard, the effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... The fate for these caverns seems grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker, for myself and for you mortal few. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。我感觉到、听到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: 啊，老的。像你这样的人应该知道这样揭露我是不礼貌的。当面纱揭开时，任务就变得艰巨。<hpage>我渴望听到你清晰的声音，制造者，尽管你可能会抗议。<page>是的，有你在这里并不太令人震惊。我感受到并听到你的影响。与苍白的母亲发生争执……这些洞穴的命运似乎很严峻。<page>我认为事情是否变得越来越复杂？或者这就是预料之中的结果吗？<hpage>在我们的会面中，我们受到了致命的打击，但君主死亡的绝望痛苦现在威胁着整个王国。<page>哈！我并不惊讶！总是这样，对吧？你们的古老物种正在争夺霸主地位，而我们的凡人昆虫则在下面被无形地压扁。<hpage>造物主，我为我自己和你们这些凡人寻求自由。这可能很天真，但这不是我想要的命运。
secondary_translated_text: Ah, old one. People like you should know it's rude to expose me like this. When the veil is lifted, the task becomes arduous.<hpage>I long to hear your clear voice, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Yes, it's not too shocking to have you here. I feel and hear your influence. A dispute with the pale mother... the fate of these caves seems grim.<page>Do I think things are getting more and more complicated? Or is this the expected result?<hpage>During our meeting, we had suffered a fatal blow, but the desperate pain of the monarch's death now threatened the entire kingdom.<page>Ha! I'm not surprised! Always like this, right? Your ancient species are vying for supremacy, while our mortal insects are being squashed invisibly below.<hpage>Creator, I seek freedom for myself and you mortals. It may be naive, but it is not the fate I want.

original_en_text: Late! Late you are! And already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 迟了！太迟了！你已经有面甲了，已经有脸了。我的刻刀只为无面者服务。
translated_text: 迟到了！你迟到了！已经戴上口罩了。他已经有脸了。我必须为那些没有它的人雕刻。
secondary_translated_text: Late! You're late! Already put on a mask. He already has face. I have to carve for those who don't have it.

original_en_text: Have some small reward for your troubles, Old One. It’s no small thing to deliver that sloshing stuff safe, ‘specially all the way up here.
original_zh_text: 古老者，请收下这点酬劳。抱着晃荡的漆罐爬这么高不容易。
translated_text: 这是对老人的一点奖励，安全运输那些摇晃的东西不是一件小事，尤其是在这里。
secondary_translated_text: It's a little reward for the elderly. Safe transportation of shaking things is no small matter, especially here.

original_en_text: A fine face, yours. Not of my work. Not of this kingdom’s craft. Not now at least.<page>But the deeper form. Distant relationship. Some form of Pharloom and our old, legged, stewards. <page>Now! To work. To work! The masks are needed.
original_zh_text: 你这张脸不错。不是我的手艺，也不是纺络的手艺。至少现在不是。<page>但更深处，有渊源。和古时候那些多足管事的一样。<page>好了！干活！干活！需要更多面甲！
translated_text: 你的脸很漂亮。这不是我的工作。不是这个王国的手艺。至少现在不是。<page>但以更深层次的形式。疏远的关系。某种形式的法鲁和我们年长的、腿的管家。<page>现在！该上班了！需要一个面具。
secondary_translated_text: You have a beautiful face. This is not my job. Not the craft of this kingdom. At least not now.<page>But in a deeper form. Estranged relationship. Some form of Faro and our older, leggy housekeeper.<page>Now! Time to go to work! Need a mask.

original_en_text: <hpage>You have the sight, Maker. Tell me what you see in me?<page>Your mask... It reads clear enough, Old One. Watcher, hunter, monarch even, though you may reject that station.<page>A complex visage, perhaps, yet still to my sight it looks unresolved.<hpage>If you see a transitional state, it is one I have accepted. My mask has remained defined through lifetimes uncounted.<page>Aye. Rigid I’m sure, but your kind rarely develop evenly, and the lifetime of bugs are poor measure for one like you.<page>Could be there’s more growth awaiting you yet...
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师好眼力。在我身上看到什么了？<page>你的面甲……上面清清楚楚。守望者，猎手，甚至君主——就算你不认最后这个。<page>挺复杂的一张脸，但在我看来还没定型。<hpage>如果是过渡状态，那我早已接受。这面甲已陪我度过了不知多少辈子的时间。<page>是啊。不过你们古族生长发育不合常理，我们虫子的几辈子可没法衡量你的年纪。<page>说不定你还能再长大呢……
translated_text: <hpage>你很有远见，创造者。告诉我你在我身上看到了什么？<page>你的面具它读得很清楚，老人。守望者、猎人，甚至君主，尽管你可以拒绝那个站。<page>这可能是一张复杂的面孔，但在我看来，它似乎仍然没有解决。<hpage>如果你看到了转变，那就是我已经接受的转变。我的面具一生都保持着形状。<page>是的，我确信它们很僵硬，但你们这种人很少均匀发育，而且对于你们这样的人来说，蠕虫的寿命很糟糕。<page>可能还有更多的成长等着你。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>You have a vision, creator. Tell me what you see in me?<page>Your mask it can read clearly, old man. Watchers, hunters, even kings, although you can refuse that station.<page>It may be a complex face, but it still seems to me that it has not been resolved.<hpage>If you see a change, it's the change I have accepted. My mask has stayed in shape all his life.<page>Yes, I'm sure they're stiff, but people like you rarely develop evenly, and for people like you, worms have a terrible lifespan.<page>There may be more growth waiting for you.

original_en_text: Our world cries its end! But the masks must still be carved.
original_zh_text: 虽然世界在哀嚎！但面甲还得继续刻。
translated_text: 我们的世界宣告终结！但面具仍然需要雕刻。
secondary_translated_text: Our world comes to an end! But the mask still needs carving.

original_en_text: Enough talk, Old One. Mine is a calling that scant allows rest.<hpage>Very well, Maker. I shall take my leave.
original_zh_text: 聊够了吧，古老者。我的使命可不让休息。<hpage>好吧，匠师。告辞了。
translated_text: 够了，老头。我的职业生涯几乎没有中断。<hpage>很好，制造者。我要走了
secondary_translated_text: Enough, old man. My career has hardly been interrupted.<hpage>Very good, maker. I'm leaving

original_en_text: To exist, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 要存在，就得有张脸。这是根本。
translated_text: 为了生存，你需要一张脸。这是最重要的事情。
secondary_translated_text: To survive, you need a face. This is the most important thing.

original_en_text: Clever Nuu must know them all!
Wings that beat, legs that crawl...
original_zh_text: 振翅的飞者，爬行的走兽……

original_en_text: In waters deep and caverns tall...

secondary_translated_text: Let it shrink and catch the prey!
The blood of the world boiled...

original_en_text: Mark of circle, mark of death...
translated_text: 圆圈的印记，死亡的印记……
secondary_translated_text: The mark of the circle, the mark of death...

original_en_text: The road behind us, all dangers passed...
translated_text: 在我们身后的路上，一切危险都过去了……
secondary_translated_text: On the road behind us, all dangers are over...

original_en_text: Darn it. Stitch it. Make it whole...
translated_text: 该死的。缝合它。让它完整……
secondary_translated_text: Damn it. Suture it. Make it complete...

original_en_text: To hide... To nest... To live...
secondary_translated_text: Hide and build a nest. lifelong

translated_text: 爪子的触摸。温暖的低语
secondary_translated_text: The touch of the claw. Warm whispers

translated_text: 辉煌的时刻，短暂的，永恒的……

secondary_translated_text: We sing praises of your shackles...

original_en_text: None may die! None may die!
secondary_translated_text: No one can die! No one can die!

original_en_text: Chase the prey fled in fear...
translated_text: 追逐因恐惧而逃跑的猎物。
secondary_translated_text: Chasing prey that escapes out of fear.

translated_text: 我们的荣幸！我们的和平！

original_en_text: For order brought, by claw and blade!
translated_text: 为了秩序，请使用爪子和刀片！
secondary_translated_text: For order, please use claws and blades!

translated_text: 其他人涉足的地方。及超越。
secondary_translated_text: Places other people set foot in. and beyond.

translated_text: 这种生活是受到限制的。
一条破旧而曲折的道路。

secondary_translated_text: This is even more difficult. longer.

original_en_text: I remember you... My sisters passed...
original_zh_text: 我记得你们……逝去的姊妹……
translated_text: 我记得你我的姐妹们都去世了。
secondary_translated_text: I remember you and my sisters passed away.

original_en_text: The flea of fleas, oh yes!

secondary_translated_text: listen to me. Listen to me.

translated_text: 我们继续战斗。无所畏惧。

original_zh_text: 长久守望……清晰记录……铭记……
translated_text: 我已经看了很长时间了。记录清楚。记得...
secondary_translated_text: I've been watching it for a long time. Record clearly. Remember...

original_en_text: You were the finest... bravest... caste...
original_zh_text: 你们是最精锐……最勇毅的……
translated_text: 你是最好的。最勇敢的。种姓。
secondary_translated_text: You are the best. The bravest. caste.

original_en_text: Joy and merry till it all ends...
translated_text: 快乐，快乐，直到一切结束……
secondary_translated_text: Happy, happy, until everything is over...

original_en_text: How did it escape the Citadel’s sight?
translated_text: 它是如何逃离城堡的视线的？
secondary_translated_text: How did it escape the sight of the castle?

original_en_text: Seek the shine... find the ore...
secondary_translated_text: Look for the light. Find the ore.

translated_text: 所有跳蚤都必须找到我们。

original_en_text: A noble end is all we seek!
translated_text: 我们追求的是一个高尚的结局！
secondary_translated_text: We are pursuing a noble ending!

original_en_text: Soon... the ritual, bold, loud, strong!
translated_text: 很快...仪式大胆、响亮、有力！
secondary_translated_text: Soon... The ceremony is bold, loud and powerful!

translated_text: 在我们的主人面前颤抖吧！
打电话给我们，打电话给我们。

original_zh_text: 神圣的寂静……吞没我们的耻辱……
translated_text: 神圣的沉默。吞下我们的耻辱。
亲爱的朋友们，我们走吧！

secondary_translated_text: The fireplace was burning very hot.

translated_text: 所有的秘密，所有的知识……

original_en_text: What I take is what I got!
translated_text: 我得到的就是我得到的！
secondary_translated_text: What I get is what I get!

original_zh_text: 流淌的毒液……暗藏的利爪……

original_en_text: What I got is mine, my love!
translated_text: 我得到的是我的，我的爱！
secondary_translated_text: What I get is mine, my love!

original_en_text: The light! The heat! The glory!

translated_text: 圣母。这一切都是为了你。
secondary_translated_text: Holy Mother. This is all for you.
Sound! Wake up! The voice is calling.
The shell is still very strong.
Let us win! Let us lose!

original_en_text: Bring it now, bring it now!
translated_text: 现在就带来，现在就带来！
secondary_translated_text: Bring it now, bring it now!
Safe in the humidity and darkness.
What kingdom does not have you?

original_zh_text: 是否还有隐秘……在更深处？
translated_text: 是否有隐藏的东西。还远吗？
secondary_translated_text: If there is anything hidden. Is it far away?
I will solve it! It's me!

original_en_text: To leap, and run, and slay!

secondary_translated_text: ... Do we have to do this?
Let me take responsibility. forgive me. I

translated_text: 干渴的根悄悄地爬下来……
secondary_translated_text: The thirsty roots quietly climb down...

translated_text: 现在，这片土地是我们的了！

original_en_text: By our claws, none but us now!
translated_text: 在我们的爪子下，现在除了我们，没有任何人了！
secondary_translated_text: Under our claws, there is no one but us now!
The sacred call of the castle.

translated_text: 孩子们，孩子们，躲起来，罢工！

secondary_translated_text: The knitting person is on the phone.
Every beast, no matter how big or small.

original_en_text: Ho, traveller! With the lands outside fresh struck by fell events, it’s good to see someone still survivin’.<hpage>This new curse proves a threat even to my strengthened shell. For your own safety, barkeep, I strongly suggest you remain within your walls.<page>Aye, well, you’re welcome to do the same. Stay and wash the troubles away with a few bells of nectar... though, given the scale to them shakes, I’m thinkin’ it might take more’n just a few.
original_zh_text: 噢，旅行者！您没事吧？外头刚遭了灾，能见到还活着的虫子真让我宽心。<hpage>酒保先生，劝你最好待在屋内。这新的诅咒连我的甲壳都扛不住。<page>您说的对，您要乐意也可以留下。喝几盏蜜露压压惊……不过看这地动山摇的架势，怕得喝光我的存货才够压惊的。
translated_text: 嗬，旅行者！外面的土地刚刚被摔倒，很高兴看到有人还活着。<hpage>这个新诅咒甚至威胁到我强化的外壳。为了您自己的安全，酒吧老板，我强烈建议您呆在自己的围墙内。<page>是的，好吧，欢迎你这样做。留下来，用几声甘露冲走烦恼……然而，考虑到它们振动的规模，我认为可能需要更多的振动。
secondary_translated_text: Ho, traveler! The land outside had just been toppled, and it was nice to see someone alive.<hpage>This new curse threatens even my strengthened shell. For your own safety, bar owner, I strongly recommend that you stay within your own walls.<page>Yeah, well, you're welcome to do that. Stay and wash away the troubles with a few sounds of nectar... However, given the scale of their vibrations, I think more vibrations may be needed.

original_en_text: Phew. You’re lookin’ a bit raw there, miss. I’m thinkin’ it’ll take more than my nectar to fix you up.<hpage>A parasite of your land has twisted itself into my shell. Its writhing is causing some discomfort.<hpage>If not for my unique constitution, I suspect it would have already consumed me entirely.<page>Well, don’t be bringing such dangerous things in here! Head to the top of the moors. There’s an old doctor up there hiding in her bell.<page>Her remedies are said to often hurt more’n they help, but given your state, I’d say it’s worth the risk.
original_zh_text: 嚯，您看着不太对劲啊，小姐。光靠我的蜜露，可治不了您这毛病。<hpage>我的甲壳里钻入了寄生物，它的蠕动使我不太舒服。<hpage>若不是体质特殊，我可能早被啃噬干净了。<page>啊，别把这种危险的玩意带到我这来！赶紧去沼泽的顶部，那里有一位老医生！她躲在一口钟里。<page>虽说她开的药往往比疾病本身的危害还大，但您这状况值得赌一把。
translated_text: 哟小姐，你看起来有点原始。我想光靠我的甘露是治不好你的。<hpage>你土地上的寄生虫已经拧进了我的壳里。它的扭曲引起了一些不适。<hpage>如果不是我的特殊体质，我真的怀疑它会彻底吞没我。<page>好吧，别把这么危险的东西带进来！前往荒野之巅。她的钟里藏着一位老医生。<page>据说她的补救措施往往更有害，但考虑到你的情况，我想说值得冒这个险。
secondary_translated_text: Yo miss, you look a little primitive. I don't think my nectar alone will cure you.<hpage>The parasite on your land has been screwed into my shell. Its distortion caused some discomfort.<hpage>If it weren't for my special physique, I really suspected that it would completely swallow me up.<page>Well, don't bring anything so dangerous in here! Head to the top of the wilderness. There is an old doctor hidden in her clock.<page>Her remedies are said to be often more harmful, but considering your situation, I would say it's worth the risk.

original_en_text: <hpage>Bartender, I’ve been tasked to acquire a nectar of significant age. Would you retain any such drink?<page>After the finer stuff, eh? Sure, I might have a few vessels left, but I can’t be selling ‘em cheap.<page>The shells in my cellar are the last left in Pharloom. Once they’re gone, no bug’ll ever taste such sweetness again.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我在找储存多年的蜜露。你这儿可有存货？<page>嘴巴越来越刁了，小姐？我这应该还剩几瓶，但价钱可不便宜。<page>我地窖里的存货可是纺络最后的陈酿。喝完之后，再也没有虫子能享受到此等蜜酿咯。
translated_text: <hpage>酒保，我的任务是获得一个成熟的花蜜。你会保留这杯饮料吗？<page>在经历了更好的事情之后，嗯？当然，我可能还剩下几艘船，但我不能便宜地卖掉它们。<page>我地窖里的贝壳是法鲁仅存的最后一个。一旦它们消失了，就再也没有昆虫尝到这种甜味了。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Bartender, my task is to obtain a ripe nectar. Will you keep this drink?<page>After something better, huh? Of course, I may still have a few boats left, but I can't sell them cheaply.<page>The shell in my cellar is the last remaining one in Faro. Once they are gone, no insects will ever taste the sweetness again.

original_en_text: <hpage>Another time, perhaps. Among the few gifts of my birth, I find rare need for sustenance.<page>S’at so? Well the nectar’s always on tap if you find yourself feelin’ different.
original_zh_text: <hpage>改日吧。我这副躯壳生来特殊，少有饥渴之时。<page>这样吗？蜜露随时管够，想来一盏就招呼我一声。
translated_text: <hpage>下次吧在我与生俱来的为数不多的天赋中，我发现维持收支平衡所需要的很少。<page>是这样吗？如果您发现自己感觉不同，甘露随时可用。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Next time, among the few talents I was born with, I find that I need very little to make ends meet.<page>Is that so? If you find yourself feeling different, nectar is always available.

original_en_text: <page>Thinkin’ again on the Vintage Nectar?<page>My price might seem steep, but I assure you, the few finer bugs who passed used to pay a lot more.
original_zh_text: <page>还惦记着陈年蜜露？<page>别看我现在出的价高，之前路过的阔绰顾客给得更多呢！
translated_text: <page>又想复古甘露了？<page>我的价格可能看起来很高，但我向您保证，一些已经过去的更好的错误已经付出了更多。
secondary_translated_text: <page>Want to retro nectar again?<page>My price may seem high, but I assure you that some of the better mistakes that have passed have been paid more.

original_en_text: Any chance you’d reconsider dealing with my blasted craw problem? I’d offer fair reward for your efforts.
original_zh_text: 真不打算帮我收拾房顶上的麻烦？酬劳保证让您满意。
translated_text: 你能再想想我恶心的问题吗？我将为您的努力提供公平的奖励。
secondary_translated_text: Can you think about my disgusting question again? I will provide you with a fair reward for your efforts.

original_en_text: Traveller, I’m not wanting to impose, but I’ve a wish that one of your able sort could likely grant.<hpage>I’ve my own task to attend, good sir, but I’ll hear you out.<page>It’s those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have them slain? If so, your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task?<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above, and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，本不该劳烦您，但有件事非得您这样的利落角色才能办。<hpage>虽然我还有自己的事要去做，但请说吧，先生。<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的躯壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！
translated_text: 旅行者，我不想强加于人，但我有一个愿望，希望你们有能力的人能够实现。<hpage>先生，我有自己的任务要做，但我会听您说完。<page>上面那些该死的螃蟹。我的屋顶很快就变成了他们舒适的巢穴！现在他们变得如此大胆，以至于开始袭击路过的朝圣者。<hpage>你会简单地杀死他们吗？如果是这样，那么您坚固的外壳似乎足以完成这项任务吗？<page>我希望事情就这么简单。杀死上面的人，更多的人就会继续来。你看到的是这个家的温暖。直接吸引他们。<page>我正在寻找长期的解决方案。稻草人！我会建造有史以来最大的一个，如此可怕，它将永远远离那些螃蟹！
secondary_translated_text: Traveler, I don't want to impose it on others, but I have a wish that you capable people can realize.<hpage>Sir, I have my own task to do, but I will hear you out.<page>Those damn crabs up there. My roof quickly became their cozy nest! Now they have become so bold that they have begun attacking passing pilgrims.<hpage>Would you simply kill them? If so, does your sturdy shell seem to be enough for the task?<page>I wish it were that simple. Kill the people above, and more people will continue to come. What you see is the warmth of this home. Attract them directly.<page>I am looking for a long-term solution. Scarecrow! I will build the largest one ever built, so scary, it will always be far away from those crabs!

original_en_text: Tis a blessed bit of luck to find this place, eh, sister?<page>The climb’s proved harder than even my best guessin’, but there’s still some vigour left in these old limbs. Doubly so, now I have a belly full of nectar!
original_zh_text: 能找着这酒馆，真算撞大运了！<page>这段攀登比我预想的还要艰难，但我这副老甲壳里仍然残存着些许活力。如今，狠狠灌上几盏蜜露，更是精神倍增！
translated_text: 你很幸运能找到这个地方，不是吗，妹妹？<page>事实证明，这次攀登比我想象的要困难，但这些古老的肢体仍然留下了一些活力。双倍，现在我有一肚子的花蜜！
secondary_translated_text: You're lucky to find this place, aren't you, sister?<page>The climb proved more difficult than I thought, but these ancient limbs still left some vitality. Double, now I have a belly full of nectar!

original_en_text: Care for a drink, traveller? My nectar’s got a kick that’ll warm your shell in these sodden climes.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，来盏蜜露暖暖身子？这地方湿气重，而我的蜜露最能驱寒。
translated_text: 想喝一杯吗，旅行者？我的花蜜会让你在潮湿的地方感到温暖。
secondary_translated_text: Want a drink, traveler? My nectar will keep you warm in damp places.

original_en_text: Hoy... sister! I’m sat here all bent and bedraggled, but you look fresh as the day you was hatched!<page>How do you fare so well in these drenched and dangerous lands? Maybe you got a secret you could share?<hpage>None that would offer easy aid, good bug. Whatever luck or savvy brought you this far, may it continue on your journey.
original_zh_text: 嘿……小姐！我这破甲壳疼得我直不起腰，你的倒鲜亮得像是刚破卵而出！<page>在这种鬼地方你怎么保养的？有啥秘诀能透露不？<hpage>没有什么秘诀，在这种地方只能靠自己，无论靠的是运气还是智慧。
translated_text: 嘿。姐姐！我坐在这里，浑身是泥，但你看起来和孵化的那天一样新鲜！<page>如何在这些潮湿危险的土壤中如此顺利地相处？也许你有一个秘密要分享？<hpage>没有人能提供简单的帮助，好bug。无论是什么运气或理解让您来到这里，都希望它能继续您的旅程。
secondary_translated_text: Hey. Sister! I'm sitting here covered in mud, but you look as fresh as the day you incubated!<page>How to get along so smoothly in these humid and dangerous soil? Maybe you have a secret to share?<hpage>No one can provide simple help, good bugs. No matter what luck or understanding brought you here, hope it will continue your journey.

original_en_text: <hpage>For now, bartender, I cannot spare so many rosaries.<page>Suit yourself. Maybe you’d rather a pour of the cheap stuff? Give your shell a kick before you head out into our blighted lands.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，眼下我拿不出这么多念珠。<page>没关系，那来盏便宜货？出发前给自己壮壮胆。
translated_text: <hpage>现在，调酒师，我不能拿出这么多念珠。<page>随你便也许你宁愿倒一杯便宜的玻璃杯？在您前往我们遭受破坏的土地之前，请踢掉您的贝壳。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Now, bartender, I can't bring out so many rosary beads.<page>Suit yourself. Maybe you'd rather pour a cheap glass? Please kick off your shells before you head to our devastated land.
