secondary_translated_text: It was the sentry who woke up. F-f-f-functional is its outer shell.<page>This sentry remains loyal and awaits your order.<hpage>You say gold plating? I didn't receive your orders, but my curiosity was piqued.<hpage>You call yourself a sentry. What are you responsible for protecting?<page>Defending the sacred C-C Castle and the sounds that fill it is our eternal duty.<hpage>I think so, too, but look around you, the gilded people. When you sleep, the castle has collapsed and the sound is silent. This place is dead, or almost dead.<hpage>Some people will think guarding the body of the kingdom is a foolish task and meaningless. I want to know, will you still be loyal to your responsibilities?

original_en_text: One must not wander idle between these sacred shelves! This is a holy place. Reverence! It is demanded.<page>If the fool she wishes to view this Keeper’s collection, head to the listening room below.
original_zh_text: 休要在圣架间闲逛！此处是圣地，需心怀敬畏！<page>想看本管理员的收藏？去下层聆听室。
translated_text: 一个人不能在这些神圣的架子之间徘徊！这是一个神圣的地方。尊重！这是必需的。<page>如果傻瓜想看冥王的收藏，请到下面的听音室。
secondary_translated_text: One cannot wander among these sacred shelves! This is a sacred place. Respect! This is necessary.<page>If fools want to see the keeper's collection, please go to the listening room below.

original_en_text: <hpage>My choice is made. I cannot leave. I must descend again, and see Pharloom freed.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我意已决，不能就这样离开。必须重返地底，解放纺络。
translated_text: <hpage>我的选择已经做出。我不能走我不得不再次下降，看到法罗被释放。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>My choice has been made. I couldn't walk I had to fall again and see Farrow released.

original_en_text: <hpage>The signs of battle here are clear, gilded one. Is it your charge then to hunt the haunted, even if they be of the Citadel’s ruling castes?<page>Defence of the sacred Cit-t-tadel, and the voices that fill it, is the eternal d-duty of the sentinels.<page>Termination, is the n-n-necessary fate of all those enthralled by the whispering Silk.
original_zh_text: <hpage>此地战斗痕迹明显，金甲虫。你的职责包括猎杀圣堡贵族中的被蛊惑者？<page>保卫圣、圣堡，守护圣音……哨卫永恒之职。<page>清除受魂、魂丝蛊惑……...是必要使命。
translated_text: <hpage>这里战斗的痕迹清晰而镀金。那么你的工作是追捕闹鬼的人吗，即使他们属于城堡的统治种姓？<page>保卫塔德尔圣城和充满其中的声音是哨兵永恒的职责。<page>结局是所有被低语的丝绸迷住的人不可避免的命运。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The traces of battle here are clear and gilded. So is your job to hunt down haunted people, even if they belong to the castle's ruling caste?<page>Protecting the holy city of Tadr and the voices that fill it is the eternal duty of the sentinel.<page>The ending is the inevitable fate of all those charmed by the whispering silk.

original_en_text: <hpage>Out there lie the endless wastes... If I cross them now, Pharloom shall fall to a black fate of my making.<hpage>My choice is made. I will not abandon its bugs to that grim end. I must descend again, and cut them free.
original_zh_text: <hpage>若现在越过那片荒原，纺络将因我堕入黑暗……<hpage>我意已决，不能抛下纺络的虫民。必须折返，斩断丝缚。
translated_text: <hpage>那里蕴藏着无尽的浪费.如果我现在超越他们，法鲁将陷入我所创造的黑暗命运。<hpage>我的选择已经做出。我不会放弃它的蠕虫，导致这种残酷的结局。我不得不再次下去救他们。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>There is endless waste there. If I surpass them now, Faro will fall into the dark destiny I have created.<hpage>My choice has been made. I will not give up on its worm that leads to this cruel ending. I had to go down again to save them.

original_en_text: <hpage>Keep safe, Vaultkeeper. I may expect your service in future, and I’d not have you pass before that task is complete.<page>Gyak... No fool this Keeper. It has lived long, watched its fellows wither, but it shall not die, not yet, not while knowledge needs be sought.<page>This pact is made, Weaver-spawn, insight for us, both she and it.<page>This holy Citadel, in glory and fall, there are holes in its history, even to a Keeper’s knowledge, even to the vaults.<page>Seek the cylinders, she must, those objects of intricate insight. Bring more for this Keeper and only this Keeper, for in this Citadel none are left possessed of such sound, sharp mind as it.
original_zh_text: <hpage>好好活着，管理员。你还有用，别早早死去。<page>咔……本管理员不傻。活了很久，目睹同僚凋零。但只要尚有知识未明，就不会死。<page>契约成立，织者坏种。你我今后各取所需。<page>荣耀与衰落并存的圣堡，藏着连浩瀚书库都未记载的空白。<page>去找音筒吧，那些智慧的结晶。只献给本管理员，因圣堡再无这般敏锐之脑。
translated_text: <hpage>注意安全保管员我可能期待着你未来的服务，我不会让你通过，直到任务完成。<page>嘎嘎这个守护者不是傻瓜它已经活了很长时间，看着它的同伴枯萎，但它不会死，不是现在，在需要寻求知识的时候。<page>韦弗的后裔，这个协议是为我们而定的，她和它都是为了洞察力。<page>无论是辉煌还是衰落，这座神圣的城堡在其历史上都存在漏洞，甚至在其守护者所知，甚至在国库中也是如此。<page>她必须寻找具有复杂洞察力的圆柱体。给这个看守人带来更多，而且只给这个看守人，因为在这座城堡里没有人有这样一个声音，敏锐的头脑。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Pay attention to safety keeper I may be looking forward to your future services, and I will not let you pass until the mission is completed.<page>Gaga, the guardian, is no fool. She has lived for a long time, watching her companions wither, but it will not die, not now, when it needs to seek knowledge.<page>Descendants of Weaver, this agreement is for us, she and it are for insight.<page>Whether in glory or decline, this sacred castle has holes in its history, even as far as its guardians know, and even in the treasury.<page>She must look for cylinders with complex insights. Bring more to this keeper, and only to this keeper, for no one in this castle has such a voice, a sharp mind.

original_en_text: Pilgrim of Pharloom eternal, regale us with our Threefold song, that you may rise above and worship before our kingdom’s divine heart.
original_zh_text: 永恒纺络的朝圣者啊，献上三重圣歌，方可升华，觐见王国圣心。
translated_text: 法鲁姆的永恒朝圣者，用我们的三重歌曲来娱乐我们，让你们超越和崇拜我们王国的神圣之心。
secondary_translated_text: Eternal pilgrims of Faroum, entertain us with our triple song, allowing you to transcend and worship the sacred heart of our kingdom.

original_en_text: Still you tarry here, bug who calls herself a guest? If your idle claws need work, put them to service for our exalted Great Gourmand!<page>I must remain by my master, so you will need to leave the Citadel and gather the ingredients for their meal in my stead!
original_zh_text: 还杵在这呢？既然你闲着也是闲着，就帮我伟大的主人搜集食材吧！<page>我得守着主人，去圣堡外收集食材的任务就交给你了！
translated_text: 你还呆在这里，一个自称是客人的虫子？如果您的闲置爪子需要工作，请让它们为我们尊贵的朋友服务！<page>我必须和我的主人住在一起，所以你需要离开城堡，到我那里收集他们的食材！
secondary_translated_text: Are you still here, a bug who claims to be a guest? If your idle claws need work, please let them serve our valued friends!<page>I have to live with my master, so you need to leave the castle and come to me to collect their ingredients!

original_en_text: A rusted statue of a pilgrim.
original_zh_text: 一尊朝圣者的锈蚀雕像。
translated_text: 一座生锈的朝圣者雕像。

original_en_text: <hpage>To learn the melody upon this cylinder will require a working listening device. This one here has long ceased to function.<hpage>That last keeper still sane, in the vaults above... Their chambers hold just such a machine. I need only return.
original_zh_text: <hpage>播放音筒需要完好的设备，这台已经坏了。<hpage>之前在上层遇到的清醒管理员……他们的密室就有这种机器。我得回去一趟。
translated_text: <hpage>学习本专栏中的旋律需要一个正常工作的收听设备。这里的这个早就停止工作了。<hpage>最后一个门将仍然很理性，在上面的金库里……他们的房间里就有这样一台机器。我只是需要回来。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Learning the melodies in this column requires a working listening device. This one here has stopped working long ago.<hpage>The last goalkeeper was still rational, in the vault above... there was such a machine in their room. I just need to come back.

original_en_text: <hpage>Vaultkeeper, I recovered a psalm cylinder in the dark chambers below here. I believe it contains the melody unique to these vaults. I would have you play it for me now.<page>Kakrt! She has visited the pontiff’s depths and stolen the sacred song! Where is your respect, Weaver-spawn?! Our venerable dead deserve better than to have their chambers transgressed by your filthy foraging!<hpage>In this moment, Vaultkeeper, I’ve slim patience for your impudence. Either prepare the cylinder and stay silent, or ready yourself to learn regret.
original_zh_text: <hpage>管理员，我在下层密室找到了圣咏音筒。里面应存有此书库的专属旋律，我要你立即为我演奏。<page>咔！你擅闯主教密室窃取圣歌！织者坏种毫无敬畏！先贤安息之地岂能容你玷污！<hpage>管理员，我的耐心有限。要么闭嘴准备播放音筒，要么准备明白什么叫后悔。
translated_text: <hpage>金库管理员，我在下面的黑房间里发现了一根赞美诗管。我相信它包含了这些金库独特的旋律。我希望你现在就为我播放它。<page>卡克特！她拜访了教皇的深处，偷走了赞美诗！韦弗，你的尊重在哪里？！我们受人尊敬的死者应该得到更好的待遇，而不是让你们肮脏的觅食者入侵他们的房间！<hpage>此时此刻，金库管理员，我对你的厚颜无耻没有太多耐心。要么准备好气瓶并保持沉默，要么准备好学会后悔。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Treasury keeper, I found a hymn tube in the dark room below. I believe it contains the unique melody of these vaults. I want you to play it for me now.<page>Kackett! She visited the depths of the Pope and stole the hymn! Weaver, where is your respect?! Our respected dead deserve better than letting your filthy foragers invade their rooms!<hpage>At this moment, treasury keeper, I don't have much patience with your impudence. Either prepare the cylinder and remain silent, or be prepared to learn to regret.

original_en_text: Eggy, eggy! I want to lay a lot of pretty eggies! So tell the big ones, bring me more food!
original_zh_text: 蛋蛋！我要下漂亮蛋蛋！叫大个子们多送吃的来！
translated_text: 鸡蛋，鸡蛋！我想下很多漂亮的蛋！所以告诉大人物给我多带点食物来！
secondary_translated_text: Eggs, eggs! I want to lay many beautiful eggs! So tell big to bring me more food!

original_en_text: <hpage>Your chambers are surely grand, sir bug, but it is plain to see you are no sovereign here.<page>Is our state so bare, pilgrim?... “By the will of the Conductors,” we once boomed, and this Citadel shook at our decree.<page>But the words... How hollow they echoed. The mantle of rule, claimed greedily from Pharloom’s fading first children, those bitter Weavers... it was yoke, not crown.<page>Now, in our Citadel’s silence, we share their truth. Only one monarch’s claws ever clutched this kingdom, though we raised our voices to cry otherwise.<page>Would you see her, pilgrim? Up there at our Citadel’s crown? Reach those heights we’d hoped to hide and bow before this land’s true ruler.<hpage>In time near, sir bug, I shall indeed climb to meet your monarch...
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生的居所虽大，却不像是贵族风格。<page>看着如此寒酸吗？当年我们高喊着"遵指挥家之命"，整座圣堡都为之震颤。<page>但激昂的呼喊现在也只剩空洞的回响。从垂死织者手中夺来的权柄，实际上却是枷锁。<page>如今在圣堡的寂静中，我们才真正明白……坐在王座上的从来只有那位。<page>想觐见她吗？登上圣堡之巅，向真王跪拜吧。<hpage>很快我就会登顶的，先生……
translated_text: <hpage>巴格先生，您的房间确实很宏伟，但很明显您不是这里的君主。<page>朝圣者们，我们的国家就这么光秃秃的吗？“按照售票员的意志，”我们曾经隆隆作响，这座城堡因我们的法令而震动。<page>但这些话。他们的回声是多么空洞。法勒姆衰落的第一个孩子，痛苦的编织者，贪婪地夺走了统治的衣钵……这是一个枷锁，不是王冠。<page>现在，在城堡的寂静中，我们分享他们的真相。只有君主的爪子才能抓住这个王国，尽管我们大声哭泣。<page>你会看到她吗，朝圣者？在我们城堡的王冠上？到达我们想要隐藏的高度，并向这片土地的真正统治者鞠躬。<hpage>很快，巴格先生，我确实会爬上去见你们的君主……
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Mr. Bagh, your room is indeed magnificent, but it is clear that you are not the monarch here.<page>Pilgrims, is our country so bare? "By the will of the conductor," we once rumbled, and the castle shook with our decrees.<page>But these words. How hollow their echoes are. Farham's first child of decline, the painful weaver, greedily snatched away the mantle of rule... This is a yoke, not a crown.<page>Now, in the silence of the castle, we share their truth. Only the claws of the monarch can seize this kingdom, though we cry loudly.<page>Will you see her, pilgrim? In the crown of our castle? Reach the heights we want to hide and bow to the true ruler of this land.<hpage>Soon, Mr. Bagh, I will indeed climb up to meet your monarch...

original_en_text: Cleansed, is this place. Eternal, is the d-d-duty of the sentinels.
original_zh_text: 净、净化完成。哨卫之职……永存。
translated_text: 净化了，就是这个地方。永恒是哨兵的职责。
secondary_translated_text: Purified, this is the place. Eternity is the duty of the sentinel.

original_en_text: <hpage>Sir, I bring ingredients for the dish.<page>At last! My master is withering away from hunger! Let us see what gifts you bring.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我带食材来了。<page>终于！主人快饿扁了，快呈上来！
translated_text: <hpage>先生，这道菜的原料我带来了。<page>终于！我的主人饿死了！看看你带了什么礼物。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Sir, I have brought the ingredients for this dish.<page>Finally! My master is starving! Look at what gift you brought.

original_en_text: <hpage>Will you tell me of those who guard this structure? They are servants of the Citadel, are they not?<page>Servants...? They too are penitents. In a past age, that caste committed their own sacrilege against the Citadel.<page>A sin long forgotten, but so grave that their offspring and the offspring of their offspring carry the guilt with them still. To serve here is their only hope of absolution.
original_zh_text: <hpage>可以说说这里的守卫么，他们是圣堡仆从？<page>仆从？不，都是赎罪者。祖辈犯下亵渎圣堡的重罪。<page>虽被遗忘，但其后代仍然在此服役，这是唯一的赎罪之道。
translated_text: <hpage>你能告诉我谁在守卫这座大楼吗？他们是城堡的仆人，不是吗？<page>仆人。？他们也是悔改者。在过去的时代，这个种姓犯下了自己的暴行对城堡。<page>这是一种早已被人遗忘的罪过，但如此严重，以至于子孙后代仍将承受这种罪过。在这里服役是他们获得赦免的唯一希望。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Can you tell me who's guarding this building? They are servants of the castle, aren't they?<page>Servant.? They are also repenters. In past eras, this caste committed its own atrocities against the castle.<page>It is a sin that has long been forgotten, but so serious that future generations will still bear it. Serving here is their only hope of receiving pardon.

original_en_text: Pilgrim of Pharloom eternal, regale us with our Threefold song, that you may rise above and worship before our kingdom’s divine heart.
original_zh_text: 永恒纺络的朝圣者啊，献上三重圣歌，方可升华，觐见王国圣心。
translated_text: 法鲁姆的永恒朝圣者，用我们的三重歌曲来娱乐我们，让你们超越和崇拜我们王国的神圣之心。
secondary_translated_text: Eternal pilgrims of Faroum, entertain us with our triple song, allowing you to transcend and worship the sacred heart of our kingdom.

original_en_text: <hpage>If this place was holy once, no evidence remains. Even as a prison, it has been neglected.<hpage>If you wish, I can free you. You can descend through the caverns below until you find a settlement.<page>You... are asking me to leave this place? Wh-what a strange, fearful thought! Such a sin would never... no.<page>By the grace of the Citadel, I am here as a penitent. Here, I can hide from the shame of my sins until they are withered away by time.<page>Leave this place...? Please! Strike me down dead before you speak such blasphemy again!
original_zh_text: <hpage>若这里曾是圣地，如今也面目全非，连监狱都称不上。<hpage>想走的话，我可以放你下去，直到找到聚居地。<page>离……离开？多么可怕的想法！这等罪孽万万不可……<page>承蒙圣堡慈悲，我在此忏悔。直到时光洗刷罪孽。<page>求你了！再说这种渎神之言就杀了我吧！
translated_text: <hpage>如果这个地方曾经是神圣的，那么没有证据。即使作为监狱，它也被忽视了。<hpage>如果你愿意，我可以放你走。您可以穿过下面的洞穴向下，直到找到定居点。<page>你...想让我离开这个地方吗？多么奇怪和可怕的想法啊！这样的罪过永远不会发生。号<page>感谢城堡的恩典，我以忏悔者的身份来到这里。在这里，我可以隐藏我罪恶的耻辱，直到它们被时间枯萎。<page>离开这个地方.？拜托，在你再说出这样亵渎神明的话之前，把我打死吧！
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>If this place was once sacred, there is no evidence. Even as a prison, it was ignored.<hpage>If you want, I can let you go. You can go down through the caves below until you find the settlement.<page>you... Want me to leave this place? What a strange and terrible idea! Such a sin will never happen. no.<page>Thanks to the grace of the castle, I come here as a confessor. Here I can hide the shame of my sin until they are withered by time.<page>Leave this place...? Please, beat me to death before you say such blasphemous words again!

original_en_text: The mantle of conductor weighs heavy. Had I known the cost before its bearing, would I have accepted the duty?
original_zh_text: 指挥之职重若千钧。如果早知这份代价，我还会接过这担子吗？
translated_text: 售票员的斗篷很重。如果我在承担费用之前就知道这些费用，我会接受这一责任吗？
secondary_translated_text: The conductor's cloak is very heavy. If I knew about the costs before I incurred them, would I accept this responsibility?

original_en_text: S... song, is it? You have brought song? You are of the Citadel, then? How... how many of you?<hpage>I am alone, sir. You needn’t fear, I am no servant of the Citadel. Are you a prisoner of theirs?<page>P... prisoner? I understand you not. There is no prison here.<page>This is a holy place of forgiveness. Please, speak with reverence.
original_zh_text: 歌……歌声？你带了歌？是圣堡的？来了……来了多少？<hpage>就我一个。别怕，我不是圣堡的走狗。你是他们的囚犯吗？<page>囚……囚犯？听不懂。<page>这儿是赎罪圣地，请怀着敬畏之心说话。
translated_text: 是...歌曲，对吧？你带了歌吗？所以你是从城堡来的？怎么...你们有多少人？<hpage>我很孤独，先生。别害怕，我不是城堡的仆人。你是他们的囚犯吗？<page>P...囚犯？我不明白你。这里没有监狱。<page>这是宽恕的圣地。请恭敬地说话。
secondary_translated_text: is... Songs, right? Did you bring a song? So you're from the castle? How... How many of you are there?<hpage>I'm lonely, sir. Don't be afraid, I am not a servant of the castle. Are you their prisoner?<page>P... Prisoner? I don't understand you. There is no prison here.<page>This is a sacred place for forgiveness. Please speak respectfully.

original_en_text: As it was sung, our song sustains.<page>For Pharloom eternal, we shall build.
original_zh_text: 歌咏不息，圣域不堕。<page>为永恒纺络，我等筑造。
translated_text: 当它唱完时，我们的歌还在继续。<page>为了永恒的法鲁，我们将建设。
secondary_translated_text: When it was over, our song was still on.<page>For the eternal Faro, we will build.

original_en_text: We would hear the song of the Architects, at the core of our Citadel.<page>They who sustain our realm, its walls, its floors and its voice, even as others fall silent.
original_zh_text: 我等欲闻建筑匠团之歌，响彻圣堡核心。<page>他们维系疆域、高墙、楼宇与圣音，纵使万籁俱寂。
translated_text: 我们将在城堡的中心听到建筑师的歌声。<page>他们维护着我们的王国、它的墙壁、它的地板和它的声音，即使其他人陷入沉默。
secondary_translated_text: We will hear the architect's song in the center of the castle.<page>They maintain our kingdom, its walls, its floors and its sound, even as others fall silent.

original_en_text: A Crustnut! Stale and dull, you’ll be thinking, yes? But ground to finest powder, that’s when its tart taste blooms!
original_zh_text: 硬壳果！你是不是觉得又干又不新鲜？得磨成粉才有酸香味！
translated_text: 疯子！你认为又老又无聊，对吧？但磨成最好的粉，它的酸味就会绽放！
secondary_translated_text: Crazy! You think it's old and boring, right? But grind it into the best powder, and its sour taste will bloom!

original_en_text: <hpage>If I’m to learn the melody upon this cylinder, I’ll first need to find a working device to play it. This one here has long ceased to function.<hpage>The vaults above would surely hold another such device. I must search thoroughly.
original_zh_text: <hpage>要解读音筒旋律，先得找到能用的设备。这台早就坏了。<hpage>上层书库肯定还有，我得仔细寻找。
translated_text: <hpage>如果我要学习这个圆柱体上的旋律，我首先需要找到一个可以工作的设备来演奏它。这里的这个早就停止工作了。<hpage>上面的金库里肯定还有另一个这样的设备。我必须彻底搜查。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>If I was going to learn the melody on this cylinder, I first needed to find a working device to play it. This one here has stopped working long ago.<hpage>There must be another such device in the vault above. I have to search thoroughly.

original_en_text: You! Mite or mourner! Fell fated chosen left till last!<page>Relent! Submit! The fatal blow was struck. Fair Pharloom wails its end.<page>We woe befallen few remained, let us join here, at last, and show our fires fierce.<page>Together to share our kingdom’s pain, feel it scorch our shells, and know clear its suffering, its sorrow!
original_zh_text: 你！蝼蚁或悼亡者！最后的倒霉蛋！<page>认命吧！致命一击已出，纺络在哀嚎！<page>让我们这些余孽在此共赴末路！<page>共品王国的灼痛，让烈焰焚尽甲壳！
translated_text: 你！螨虫仍然是哀悼者！命运注定会选择左到最后！<page>宽容！投降！致命的一击袭来。Fair Pharloom哀叹它的终结。<page>我们的不幸降临到了剩下的几个人身上，我们终于加入了这里，展示了我们火焰的凶猛。<page>共同分担我们王国的痛苦，感受它烧焦我们的贝壳，理解它的痛苦，它的悲伤！
secondary_translated_text: You! Mites are still mourners! Fate is destined to choose left to the end!<page>Tolerance! Surrender! A fatal blow struck. Fair Pharloom lamented its end.<page>Our misfortune befell the few remaining, and we finally joined here, demonstrating the fierceness of our flames.<page>Share the pain of our kingdom together, feel it scorch our shells, understand its pain, its sadness!

original_en_text: Our song upon a silken thread.... Such beautiful sound, so long absent from our halls.<page>Keep safe our melody, good pilgrim. You shall likely be the last to receive it.
original_zh_text: 丝弦上的旋律啊……殿堂久违的天籁。<page>请妥善保存我们的旋律，你怕是最后一位听到此曲的了。
translated_text: 我们的歌是在丝绸上的。我们大厅里早已没有这样美丽的声音了。<page>保护我们的旋律，好朝圣者。您可能是最后一个收到它的人。
secondary_translated_text: Our song is on silk. There is no such beautiful voice in our hall anymore.<page>Protect our melody, good pilgrim. You may be the last person to receive it.

original_en_text: We would hear the melody of the Conductors, high in their gleaming towers.<page>They bearing the heaviest mantle, who would guide our land ever on to greatness.
original_zh_text: 我等欲闻执政指挥之旋律，萦绕辉光尖塔。<page>他们肩负千钧权柄，引领王国永续辉煌。
translated_text: 我们将从闪亮的塔楼上听到指挥家的旋律。<page>他们肩上扛着最沉重的衣钵，他们将引导我们的土地走向伟大。
secondary_translated_text: We will hear the conductor's melody from the shining towers.<page>They carry the heaviest mantle on their shoulders, and they will guide our land to greatness.

original_en_text: A visitor? Now this is rare.<page>I must apologise for not rising to greet you. After an age spent sickly, I find myself unable to lift from this bedchamber.<page>I hope, good pilgrim, our Citadel has shown you the courtesy deserved of a bug devout.<hpage>I’ve borne its hospitality well enough, aged one...<page>Ahhh... My sympathies, pilgrim... We have fallen so far. And now, sadly, if you’ve come seeking aid or understanding, I fear I too shall disappoint. <page>Whatever you would ask, I have only my melody left to offer. It is a simple thing, the smallest of gifts, but perhaps more special now, for it has been rarely heard in these quietened times.
original_zh_text: 有访客？这倒是稀奇。<page>恕我不能起身相迎，卧于病榻多年，这把老骨头动不了啦。<page>朝圣者能到这里不容易，希望圣堡对你这虔信者有以礼相待。<hpage>已经领教过它的待客之道了，老人家……<page>唉……抱歉，圣堡已堕落至此。如果你想求助，怕是要让你失望了。<page>我能赠予你的只剩这首曲子。虽然微薄，但在这孤寂的时代也算珍品。
translated_text: 访客？这种情况如今很少见。<page>我必须为没有站起来欢迎你而道歉。在度过了绝症的时代后，我发现自己无法离开这间卧室。<page>亲爱的朝圣者，我希望我们的城堡向您展示了虔诚昆虫的礼貌。<hpage>一岁的孩子，我很好地忍受了它的热情款待。<page>啊...我的同情，朝圣者..我们已经跌倒了这么远。现在，可悲的是，如果你来寻求帮助或理解，恐怕我也会失望。<page>无论你想问什么，我只剩下我的旋律可以提供。这是一件简单的事情，最小的礼物，但现在也许更加特别，因为在这个安静的时代，很少有人听到它。
secondary_translated_text: Visitors? This situation is rare nowadays.<page>I must apologize for not standing up to welcome you. After a terminal illness, I found myself unable to leave this bedroom.<page>Dear pilgrim, I hope our castle shows you the courtesy of pious insects.<hpage>As a one-year-old child, I endured its warm hospitality well.<page>Ah... My sympathy, pilgrim.. We have fallen so far. Now, sadly, if you come for help or understanding, I'm afraid I'll be disappointed too.<page>No matter what you want to ask, I only have my melody left to offer. It was a simple thing, the smallest gift, but perhaps even more special now because in these quiet times, few people hear of it.

original_en_text: If the weight of your sins bear down upon you, you may remain here with me in penitence, sister.
original_zh_text: 若你自觉罪孽深重，可留下与我一同忏悔。
translated_text: 如果你的罪落在你身上，你可以和我在一起忏悔，姐姐。
secondary_translated_text: If your sin falls on you, you can confess with me, sister.

original_en_text: Ah.... your s-song. So long I’ve sat in silence. Tell me... are all songs played now as exquisite as this? Or has time made my hearing unrefined?<hpage>This art is new to me, and my skill is limited, but your appreciation is not unwelcome.<page>Ahh. The beauty of it. It is almost painful to my weary senses. Perhaps though, this pain is merely part of my penitence. <page>Play on, will you? I would join your tune. Just forgive me if my voice has become brutish.
original_zh_text: 啊……你的歌。沉寂太久，现在所有曲子都这般动听吗？还是我耳朵钝了？<hpage>我技艺粗浅，承蒙你不嫌弃。<page>这美感……刺痛我麻木的感官。或许这正是赎罪的一部分。<page>继续演奏，可以么？我想试着应和，尽管嗓音已经嘶哑。
translated_text: 啊...你的歌。我已经默默地坐了这么久了。告诉我...现在播放的歌曲都这么精致吗？或者时间让我的听力不完美？<hpage>这种艺术对我来说是新的，我的技能有限，但您的欣赏并不不受欢迎。<page>啊太漂亮了。这对我疲惫的感官来说几乎是痛苦的。也许这种痛苦只是我悔恨的一部分。<page>继续玩，好吗？我会添加你的曲调。如果我的声音变得粗鲁，请原谅。
secondary_translated_text: Ah... Your song. I have been sitting silently for so long. Tell me... Are all the songs played nowadays so exquisite? Or is time making my hearing imperfect?<hpage>This art is new to me and my skills are limited, but your appreciation is not unwelcome.<page>Ah, it's so beautiful. It was almost painful to my tired senses. Maybe this pain is just part of my remorse.<page>Keep playing, okay? I will add your tune. Please forgive me if my voice becomes rude.

original_en_text: You refuse to play our sacred melody! Why pause, Weaver-thing? Do you cower at the truths it may illuminate? Surely you are not the lesser sort that bows to fear?<hpage>When the moment calls, Vaultkeeper, I shall listen. For now, your task remains to keep the cylinder safe. And know, you shall answer to my blade if you fail.
original_zh_text: 你拒绝演奏圣歌！在害怕吗，织者？畏惧被照亮的真相？原来你也是怯懦之辈？<hpage>时机到了自然会听。现在你的任务是保管好音筒，若出了纰漏，我的针刃可不认虫。
translated_text: 你拒绝演奏我们神圣的旋律！为什么要停下来，韦弗？你是否对它可能揭示的真相感到畏缩？你确定你不是那种屈服于恐惧的小人物吗？<hpage>到时候，金库管理员，我会听的。目前，您的任务仍然是确保气瓶的安全。你知道，如果你失败了，你将对我的剑负责。
secondary_translated_text: You refuse to play our sacred melody! Why stop, Weaver? Do you cringe at the truth it may reveal? Are you sure you're not the kind of little guy who gives in to fear?<hpage>When the time comes, treasury manager, I will listen. For now, your task remains to ensure the safety of cylinders. You know, if you fail, you will be responsible for my sword.

original_en_text: For our base, we require the gelatinous Mossberry Stew. Its concoction is a druidic art, a jealously guarded secret of the moss-painted caverns deep below us.
original_zh_text: 基底需要苔莓浓汤。配方是沼地德鲁伊的不传之秘。
translated_text: 对于我们的基础，我们需要凝胶状的Mossberry炖菜。它的混合物是德鲁兹艺术，是我们下方深处长满青苔的洞穴中严密保守的秘密。
secondary_translated_text: For our base, we need gel-like Mossberry stew. Its mixture is Druze art, a closely guarded secret in the mossy caves deep below us.

original_en_text: Sweet fruit that grows in moist environments. Its seeds are toxic to most creatures.
original_zh_text: 生长在潮湿环境中的甜味浆果，种子对大多数生物有毒。
translated_text: 生长在潮湿环境中的甜水果。它的种子对大多数生物都有毒。
secondary_translated_text: Sweet fruits grown in humid environments. Its seeds are toxic to most living things.

original_en_text: Report of the Memorium and its maintenance.<br><br>“Containment fails. Memory lost. Excise outer. Maintain inner.<br>Shellwood stasis sustained - Remember.<br>Marrowlands stasis critical - Remember.<br>Verdanian environment exceeded - Destined to forget.”
original_zh_text: 忆廊维缮报告。<br><br>“封存溃败。记忆遗失。切除外区。维持内区。<br>甲木林封存稳定——须铭记。<br>髓骨地封存危急——须铭记。<br>翠庭生态失控——注定遗忘。”
translated_text: 关于纪念馆及其维护的报告。<br><br>“遏制失败。记忆丧失。去掉外部。呆在里面。<br>壳木滞续记。<br>严重的骨髓骤停-记住。<br>超越令人眼花缭乱的环境-注定会忘记。"
secondary_translated_text: Report on the memorial hall and its maintenance.<br><br>"Containment failed. Memory loss. Remove the exterior. Stay inside.<br>Continuation of the stagnation of shells and trees.<br>Severe bone marrow arrest-remember.<br>Beyond the dazzling environment-destined to forget. "

original_en_text: Nest fashioned from an old bell. Once set up, young Craws will occasionally roost within, filling the bell with shell shards and rosaries.<br><br>The Crawbell can be installed on the exterior of a home.
original_zh_text: 由旧钟改造的虫巢。安装后，腐囊虫幼体会偶尔栖息其中，留下甲壳碎片与念珠。<br><br>腐囊钟巢可安装在钟居外部。
translated_text: 巢穴是用旧时钟做的。一旦建立，幼蟹偶尔会栖息在其中，用贝壳碎片和念珠填满钟。<br><br>Crawbell可以安装在房屋的外部。
secondary_translated_text: The nest is made of old clocks. Once established, young crabs will occasionally inhabit it, filling the bell with shell fragments and rosary beads.<br><br>Crawbell can be installed on the exterior of the house.

original_en_text: Gem-like organ taken from a Flintbeetle. Produces incendiary sparks when abraded, and may explode if cracked or dropped.
original_zh_text: 燧甲虫体内的晶状结构。摩擦生火，碰撞易爆。
translated_text: 金甲虫的宝石状器官。佩戴时会产生燃烧火花，如果破裂或掉落，可能会爆炸。
secondary_translated_text: The jewel-like organ of a gold beetle. Burning sparks will be generated when worn, and if broken or dropped, it may explode.

original_en_text: Keepsake containing a precious memory. Can be used to expand a Crest.<br><br>Expand Crests in the Crest pane of the Menu.
original_zh_text: 存储珍贵记忆的纪念盒，用于扩展纹章容量。<br><br>可在菜单的纹章界面扩展纹章容量。
translated_text: 包含珍贵回忆的纪念品。可用于扩展Crest。<br><br>在菜单的“皇冠”面板中展开“皇冠”。
secondary_translated_text: Souvenirs containing precious memories. Can be used to extend Crest.<br><br>Expand Crown in the Crown pane of the menu.

original_en_text: Defeat foes to add their records to the Journal.
original_zh_text: 击败敌人后，其信息会被录入日志。
translated_text: 击败敌人并将他们的记录添加到日记中。
secondary_translated_text: Defeat enemies and add their records to your diary.

original_en_text: Review defeated foes in the Journal pane of the Menu.
original_zh_text: 在菜单的日志界面查看已击败敌人的信息。
translated_text: 在菜单的“日记”面板中查看被击败的敌人。
secondary_translated_text: View defeated enemies in the "Diary" pane of the menu.

original_en_text: Basic pouch designed for holding tools, traps and crafting materials.
original_zh_text: 基础工具袋，可收纳工具、陷阱与制作材料。
translated_text: 基本袋旨在容纳工具、陷阱和加工材料。
secondary_translated_text: The basic bag is designed to hold tools, traps and processing materials.

original_en_text: Gilded trophy awarded by Sprintmaster Swift to the fastest bug in Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 飞毛腿”斯威夫特颁发给纺络速度最快者的镀金奖品。
translated_text: Sprintmaster Swift将镀金奖杯授予了Pharloom中速度最快的虫子。
secondary_translated_text: Sprintmaster Swift awarded the gold-plated trophy to the fastest bug in Pharloom.

original_en_text: Reassembled cogwork heart, containing a fine array of wheels and regulators.
original_zh_text: 重组后的完整机心，内含精密的轮组阵列。
translated_text: 重新组装的齿轮心包含一系列的罚款车轮和调整。
secondary_translated_text: The reassembled gear center contains a series of fine wheels and adjustments.

original_en_text: Enlivened heart of Skarrsinger Karmelita. Its beat is steady and strong.
original_zh_text: 斯卡尔歌后”卡梅莉塔复苏的心脏，跳动稳健有力。
translated_text: 让斯卡辛格·卡梅丽塔的心焕发活力。它的节拍稳定而强劲。
secondary_translated_text: Let Scarsinger Camelita's heart rejuvenate. Its beat is stable and strong.

original_en_text: Filthy rag, marked with the scrawl of an Underworker.<br><br>“So much suffering. Are we truly chosen, or have we sinned unknowing, and now are punished for it?”
original_zh_text: 污损的破布，一名劳累的圣堡工人在上面留下了哀叹。<br><br>“如此痛苦。我们真是被选中的么，还是因不知名的罪过而遭此惩罚？”
translated_text: 肮脏的抹布上有工人潦草的笔迹。<br><br>“太痛苦了。我们真的被选中了吗？或者我们是否在不知不觉中犯罪了，现在正在受到惩罚？"
secondary_translated_text: There was a worker's scrawl on the dirty rag.<br><br>"It's too painful. Are we really chosen? Or have we committed a crime unknowingly and are now being punished? "

original_en_text: Forgotten Weaver technique. Sew rending runes upon one’s enemies.
original_zh_text: 失传的织者技艺。在敌人身上缝上撕裂符文。
translated_text: 被遗忘的韦弗技术。在敌人的身上缝制泪水符文。
secondary_translated_text: The forgotten Weaver technique. Sewing tear runes on the enemy's body.

original_en_text: An ancient mask carved from cold, pale ore. The mask protects the wearer, guarding their shell against damage.
original_zh_text: 由寒苍矿石雕刻的古面甲，穿戴后可抵御外部伤害。
translated_text: 用冰冷、苍白的矿石雕刻而成的古老面具。该口罩可以保护佩戴者并保护其外壳免受损坏。
secondary_translated_text: An ancient mask carved from cold, pale ore. The mask protects the wearer and protects its shell from damage.

original_en_text: Voices of the Choir, raised in sacred song.
translated_text: 唱诗班的歌声在圣歌中响起。
secondary_translated_text: The choir's song sounded in the hymn.

original_en_text: Finely forged bell made from a gleaming metal.
original_zh_text: 用闪亮金属锻造的精致铃铛。
translated_text: 一座由闪闪发光的金属制成的精心锻造的时钟。
secondary_translated_text: A carefully forged clock made of sparkling metal.

original_en_text: Garment gifted to pilgrims on admittance to the Citadel. Its thick weave offers additional protection against wind and cold.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者获准进入圣堡时所赠予的衣袍，其厚实的织法能提供极佳的防风御寒效果。
translated_text: 朝圣者进入城堡时获得的服装。其厚重的编织提供了额外的防风和御寒保护。
secondary_translated_text: Clothing obtained by pilgrims when entering the castle. Its heavy weave provides additional wind and cold protection.

original_en_text: High quality nectar of a long-lived aphid, kept in storage over many lifetimes to allow a complex maturation.
original_zh_text: 一种寿命极长的蚜虫所产的高质量蜜露，经数代窖藏熟成，风味醇厚复合。
translated_text: 长寿蚜虫的优质花蜜可以保存多年，以达到复杂的成熟。
secondary_translated_text: The high-quality nectar of long-lived aphids can be preserved for years to achieve complex maturity.

original_en_text: Grub that lives within and feeds upon Pharloom’s lingering Silk, born with the ability to sense Silk over great distances.
original_zh_text: 栖居于纺络残存丝脉中的噬丝蛆虫，生来具备千里感应灵丝的能力。
translated_text: 生活在法勒姆挥之不去的丝绸中并以其为食的爬行动物生来就具有从远处感知丝绸的能力。
secondary_translated_text: The reptiles that live in and feed on Farham's lingering silk are born with the ability to perceive silk from a distance.

original_en_text: Chunk of dense coral-shell. Not fit for crafting tools, but claimed to have various medicinal properties if correctly prepared.
original_zh_text: 结构紧密的块状珊瑚外壳。不适用于制作工具，经处理可入药。
translated_text: 一个巨大而密集的珊瑚壳。不适合制作工具，但声称如果准备得当，具有各种药用价值。
secondary_translated_text: A huge and dense coral shell. Not suitable for making tools, but claims to have various medicinal values if properly prepared.

original_en_text: Keys to the cells and passages of the Slab.
original_zh_text: 开启罪石牢狱牢房和通路的钥匙。
translated_text: 平板细胞和通道的关键。
secondary_translated_text: The key to plate cells and channels.

original_en_text: Beads carved from polished shell. The finer material reflects their increased value.
original_zh_text: 抛光的甲壳制成，价值更高。
translated_text: 用抛光的贝壳雕刻而成的珠子。更细的材料反映了它们价值的增加。
secondary_translated_text: Beads carved from polished shells. The finer materials reflect their increased value.

original_en_text: Small worker’s key. Unlocks the door to the diving bell in Deep Docks.
original_zh_text: 工人使用的小钥匙。可开启深坞潜钟的门。
translated_text: 仆人的钥匙。打开深码头潜水钟的门。
secondary_translated_text: The servant's key. Open the door of the Deep Pier Diving Bell.

original_en_text: Meat harvested from a defeated creature. It has been diced into fine chunks.
original_zh_text: 击败怪物获得的肉类。被切成了小碎块状。
translated_text: 从被击败的生物身上收获的肉。它已经被切成非常小的块。
secondary_translated_text: Meat harvested from defeated creatures. It has been cut into very small pieces.

translated_text: 它有一股强烈的苍蝇气味。
secondary_translated_text: It has a strong smell of flies.

original_en_text: Fresh innards of a Muckroach, tough and slimy with a rank odour. Unpalatable to most.
original_zh_text: 腥臭黏腻的淤秽蟑螂内脏，多数生物难以下咽。
translated_text: 新鲜蟑螂的内脏坚硬、粘稠，并有难闻的气味。大多数人都觉得很难接受。
secondary_translated_text: The internal organs of fresh cockroaches are hard, sticky and have an unpleasant smell. Most people find it difficult to accept.

original_en_text: Crumpled parchment containing the prayer of a Burning Bug.<br><br>“Hail to your heat! O glorious flame. You who builds and breaks us. Sear our shells. Char them black. That we may rise to join you, wreathed in bright and blazing joy.”
original_zh_text: 焦黑的羊皮纸，一只焚身的虫子在上面留下了祷文。<br><br>“赞美炽焰！噢，荣耀之火！塑造我们，亦毁灭我们。灼烧甲壳，化为焦炭。我们将与您同在，沐浴在炽热光明的愉悦中”
translated_text: 皱巴巴的羊皮纸上写着燃烧昆虫的祈祷。<br><br>“向你们的热情致敬！啊，荣耀的火焰。你们建设我们，又摧毁我们。在我们的贝壳上留下划痕。烧死他们。这样我们就可以站起来，与你们一起享受明亮而火热的喜悦。"
secondary_translated_text: Prayers for burning insects were written on crumpled parchment.<br><br>"Salute to your enthusiasm! Ah, the flame of glory. You build us and destroy us. Leaving scratches on our shells. Burn them. So that we can stand up and enjoy the bright and fiery joy with you. "

original_en_text: Liquid lifeseed extracted from a ripe bud. Possesses regenerative qualities.
original_zh_text: 成熟花苞中提取的生命精华，具有再生功效。
translated_text: 从成熟花蕾中提取的液体丁香。它具有再生品质。
secondary_translated_text: Liquid cloves extracted from mature flower buds. It has regenerative quality.

original_en_text: Words of a Weaver from the nest beneath Bone Bottom.<br><br>“Hide her deep, the despised child, our shame shown in shell of iron. She is a wish cast vain, divinity mimicked in form too frail.”
original_zh_text: 一名骸底镇下方巢穴织者的遗言。<br><br>“将那受唾弃的孩子深藏，铁壳昭示着我们的耻辱。她是由妄念所造，以脆弱之躯仿效神明。”
translated_text: 骨头底部巢穴中织布者的话。<br><br>“把她藏得很深，这个被鄙视的孩子，我们的耻辱反映在铁壳里。她是徒劳的愿望，而被模仿的上帝太脆弱了。"
secondary_translated_text: The words of the weaver in the nest at the bottom of the bone.<br><br>"Hide her very deeply, this despised child, our shame is reflected in the iron shell. She is a vain wish, and the imitated God is too fragile. "

original_en_text: Aged medallion of the wanderer Seth. A gift given in respect of great skill.
original_zh_text: 漫游者赛斯的古旧勋章，授予技艺超群者。
translated_text: 流浪者塞斯的古老徽章。技能天赋。
secondary_translated_text: An ancient badge of vagrant Seth. Skills and talents.

original_en_text: String threaded with a mix of common and fine rosaries. Can be broken and the rosaries used to trade.
original_zh_text: 混编普通与精美念珠的项链，拆解后取出的念珠可用于交易。
translated_text: 用普通和精致的念珠混合在一起串线。可以破碎并用于交易念珠。
secondary_translated_text: Strung together with a mixture of regular and delicate rosaries. Can be broken and used to trade rosary beads.

original_en_text: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The blade is honed to a fine edge.
original_zh_text: 为战斗设计的特制长针，原身为纺织工具。刃身经过精细打磨，锋利度显著提升。
translated_text: 具有独特平衡性的长缝纫工具适合战斗。刀片经过打磨，边缘很薄。
secondary_translated_text: Long sewing tools with unique balance are suitable for combat. The blade is polished and the edges are thin.

original_en_text: Last edict of the Conductors.<br><br>“And lo, is eternity sustained. By Architect’s claw, we welcome that final form, of dial and rotor, and soul gladly given.<br><br>The perfect, unfaltering voice.”
original_zh_text: 指挥家的终诏。<br><br>“看啊，永恒得以延续。<br>凭借建筑师之手，我们迎来终极形态——齿轮与转轴，灵魂欣然献上。<br>那完美恒久的声音。”
translated_text: 指挥的最终法令。<br><br>“看，永恒持续。通过建筑师的爪子，我们欢迎表盘和转盘的最终形式，以及幸福赋予的灵魂。<br><br>完美、坚定不移的声音。"
secondary_translated_text: The final decree of command.<br><br>"Look, eternity lasts. Through the claws of the architect, we welcome the final form of the dial and turntable, as well as the soul given by happiness.<br><br>A perfect, unwavering voice. "

original_en_text: Core of a flower formed around the body of a consumed Wood Wasp. Secretes a sticky sap that the wasps subsist on.
original_zh_text: 木蜂残躯周围形成的花芯，分泌蜂群赖以为生的蜜浆。
translated_text: 被吞下的黄蜂的身体周围形成了花核。分泌黄蜂生存所需的粘稠汁液。
secondary_translated_text: A flower nucleus formed around the body of the swallowed wasp. Secretes the thick juice needed by wasps to survive.

original_en_text: Bile gland of a rare sylphean slug. Talented pinmasters can use the glistening liquid within to improve a blade’s sharpness.
original_zh_text: 风灵蛞蝓体内的胆汁腺。技艺精湛的刺针匠可取其中发光液体淬炼针刃。
translated_text: 稀有丝兰蛞蝓的腺体。出色的针制造商可以使用起泡液体来磨尖他们的刀片。
secondary_translated_text: Gland of rare yucca slug. Outstanding needle manufacturers can use foaming liquids to sharpen their blades.

original_en_text: Crude journal made of coarse fabric and bone, left by a fallen pilgrim.
original_zh_text: 殒命朝圣者遗留的手记，由破布和骨头做成。
translated_text: 由粗糙的织物和骨头制成的粗糙日记，是一位倒下的朝圣者留下的。
secondary_translated_text: Rough diary made of coarse fabric and bone, left by a fallen pilgrim.

original_en_text: Surgeon’s orders.<br><br>“Devout has succumbed during Silk suture. Refuses to revive. Sin committed. Permit no rites.<br><br>Husk marked for cremation. Retrieve dregs.”
original_zh_text: 医师的焚化令。<br><br>“信徒在灵丝缝合过程中死亡，拒绝复苏。罪行已定，禁止任何仪式。<br><br>躯壳火化后，回收残渣。”
translated_text: 外科医生的命令。<br><br>“当丝绸被缝合时，虔诚的人死了。拒绝复活。犯罪行为。不允许举行仪式。<br><br>围栏上标有火葬。去渣。"
secondary_translated_text: The surgeon's orders.<br><br>"When the silk was sewn up, the pious man died. Refusing to resurrect. Criminal behavior. Rituals are not allowed.<br><br>Cremation is marked on the fence. Remove slag. "

original_en_text: Gelatinous organ collected from the defeated Broodmother.
original_zh_text: 击败育母后获得的凝胶状器官。
translated_text: 从失败的养母那里收集的高卢器官。
secondary_translated_text: Gaul organs collected from a failed adoptive mother.

original_en_text: Pulsating organ grown within the shell of Alchemist Zylotol. The gland replenishes over time, providing a near limitless source of Plasmium.<br><br>Crafting new Plasmium Phials no longer requires a reserve.
original_zh_text: 生长在炼金术师奇洛托甲壳内的晶莹器官。此腺体会随时间自行补充，几乎可提供无尽的生质液。<br><br>无需生质液储备，即可制作新的生质液瓶。
translated_text: 炼金术士Zylotol的外壳中生长的脉动器官。随着时间的推移，腺体将蓬勃发展，提供几乎无限的血浆来源。<br><br>不再需要保留制作新的高原Phials。
secondary_translated_text: Pulsatile organs growing in the shell of the alchemist Zylotol. Over time, the glands will flourish and provide an almost unlimited source of plasma.<br><br>There is no longer a need to preserve and make new Plateau Phials.

original_en_text: An artefact almost impossibly old, marked inside with many fine etchings. Most are indecipherable.<br><br> “...No will... No self... Shade...”
original_zh_text: 一件古老到难以追溯源头的圣器，内部精细地雕刻着大量铭文，但绝大部分无法解读。<br><br> “......无念......无我......暗影......”
translated_text: 这是一件几乎令人难以置信的古老文物，里面雕刻着许多精美的蚀刻画。其中大多数都无法破译。<br><br>“...没有意志。没有自我。影子……”
secondary_translated_text: This is an almost unbelievable ancient artifact with many exquisite etchings carved inside. Most of them are undecipherable.<br><br>“... There is no will. No self. Shadow…"

original_en_text: Worn ornament of the Nameless Town high above Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 纺络之上墟野地区无名镇生产的饰品，外表已经破损。
translated_text: 磨损法鲁上空未知小镇的装饰品。
secondary_translated_text: Decorations that wear out the unknown town above Faro.

original_en_text: Versatile thread naturally produced within the shell. When enough Silk is stored, wounds can be healed and skills executed.<br><br>Attack enemies to replenish Silk.
original_zh_text: 甲壳内自然生长的万用丝线。积蓄足够时可治愈伤口并发动技能。<br><br>攻击敌人可补充灵丝。
translated_text: 多功能线程自然产生的外壳内。当储存足够的丝绸时，伤口就可以愈合，技能就可以发挥。<br><br>攻击敌人以补充丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: Multifunctional threads naturally arise within the shell. When enough silk is stored, the wound can heal and skills can be exerted.<br><br>Attack the enemy to replenish silk.

original_en_text: Artefact left behind by the Weavers, designed to collect and hold additional Silk.
original_zh_text: 织者遗失的圣器，用于收集和储存灵丝。
translated_text: 编织者留下的艺术旨在收集和容纳更多的丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: The art left behind by the weavers aims to collect and accommodate more silk.

original_en_text: Hardened fragments of shell and bone, used in the crafting of tools and traps.
original_zh_text: 坚硬的贝壳和骨头碎片，用于制作工具和陷阱。
translated_text: 用来做工具和陷阱的硬壳和骨头碎片。
secondary_translated_text: Hard shells and bone fragments used to make tools and traps.

original_en_text: Silk thread naturally produced within the shell. When enough Silk is stored, wounds can be healed and skills executed.<br><br>Silk Hearts will automatically regenerate some Silk.<br><br>Attack enemies to replenish Silk.
original_zh_text: 甲壳内自然生长的万用丝线。积蓄足够时可治愈伤口并发动技能。<br><br>丝之心可自动回复部分灵丝。<br><br>攻击敌人也可补充灵丝。
translated_text: 自然存在于贝壳中的丝线。当储存足够的丝绸时，伤口就可以愈合，技能就可以发挥。<br><br>Silk Hearts会自动再生一些Silk。<br><br>攻击敌人以补充丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: Silk threads naturally present in shells. When enough silk is stored, the wound can heal and skills can be exerted.<br><br>Silk Hearts will automatically regenerate some Silk.<br><br>Attack the enemy to replenish silk.

original_en_text: Pristine cog from within the shell of an automaton. Despite long use, its metal has not dulled.
original_zh_text: 取自机械虫外壳的崭新齿轮，历久弥新。
translated_text: 机器人外壳中的原始齿轮。尽管使用时间很长，但其金属并没有变得迟钝。
secondary_translated_text: Original gears in the robot shell. Despite its long use time, its metal has not become dull.

original_en_text: Intricate internal mechanism of a cogwork bug. Can be broken into individual shell shards for use in crafting.
original_zh_text: 机枢甲虫内部的精密构造。拆解后获得的甲壳碎片可用于制作。
translated_text: 齿轮缺陷的复杂内部机制。可以破碎成单独的贝壳碎片进行制作。
secondary_translated_text: Complex internal mechanisms of gear defects. It can be broken into individual shell fragments for making.

original_en_text: Attune to the old memories of Pharloom.
Enlivened heart of Crust King Khann. It beats deep and slow.
original_zh_text: 壳王卡汗复苏的心脏，跳动沉重缓慢。
translated_text: 这让壳牌国王卡恩的心欢欣鼓舞。它的节拍又深又慢。
secondary_translated_text: This made Shell King Kahn feel happy. Its beat is deep and slow.

original_en_text: Pungent delicacy preserved in roach brine. The most famous creation of the disgraced chef Lugoli.
original_zh_text: 失格大厨”卢戈利用蟑螂盐水腌制的名菜，气味刺鼻。
translated_text: 用蟑螂盐水腌制，又辣又美味。名誉扫地的厨师卢戈利最著名的作品。
secondary_translated_text: Marinated in cockroach salt water, it is spicy and delicious. The most famous work of discredited chef Lugoli.

original_en_text: Remains of an ancient Weaver implement, broken and inoperable.<br><br>A craftsbug of high skill may be able to repair it.
original_zh_text: 远古织者的工具，已无法正常使用。<br><br>技艺精湛的工匠虫或许能修好。
translated_text: 古代韦弗工具的遗迹，损坏且无法使用。<br><br>熟练的蜘蛛虫可能能够修复它。
secondary_translated_text: Remains of ancient Weaver tools, damaged and unusable.<br><br>A skilled spider worm may be able to repair it.

original_en_text: Decree of the Citadel, dirty and worn.<br><br>“Full Chamber to the kingdom of the White Wyrm. Claim the Weaver, in half part. Last of their line. Sensed strong with Silk.<br><br>Resistance anticipated. Quell with rune cage.”
original_zh_text: 破旧的圣堡诫令。<br><br>“全员前往白王沃姆疆域，缉捕半血织者。她是沃姆最后血脉，灵丝力量强大。<br><br>预计遭遇抵抗，用符文牢笼镇压。”
translated_text: 城堡的法令又脏又旧。<br><br>“整个红龙王国大厅。一半的说法迫在眉睫。他们团队的最后一个。丝绸摸起来很坚固。<br><br>抵抗是意料之中的。用符文牢笼镇压。"
secondary_translated_text: The castle's decrees are dirty and old.<br><br>"The entire Red Dragon Kingdom hall. Half the story is imminent. The last one on their team. Silk feels strong.<br><br>Resistance is expected. Suppress it with a rune cage. "

original_en_text: Writhing substance from the dark sea at the world’s base.
original_zh_text: 世界底部黑暗海域中涌动着的物质。
translated_text: 物质从世界底部的黑暗海洋中翻腾而出。
secondary_translated_text: Matter churns out of the dark ocean at the bottom of the world.

original_en_text: Large spike of bone collected from a defeated Skull Tyrant.
original_zh_text: 击败骷髅暴君后，从其身上收集的大骨刺。
translated_text: 从被击败的骷髅暴君身上收集的大型骨钉。
secondary_translated_text: Large bone nails collected from defeated skeleton tyrants.

original_en_text: Guide track for the Choir, with a theme of salvation.
original_zh_text: 圣咏导引曲目・救赎篇。
translated_text: 合唱团的指南曲目，主题为救赎。
secondary_translated_text: The choir's guide track with the theme of redemption.

original_en_text: Key with the mark of ‘Apostate’. Opens the way to certain cells and passages of the Slab.
original_zh_text: 带有“叛教”标记的钥匙。可开启罪石牢狱中的部分牢房和通路。
translated_text: 带有“叛教者”符号的钥匙。为板的某些细胞和通道开辟道路。
secondary_translated_text: The key with the symbol "apostate". Open the way for certain cells and channels of the plate.

original_en_text: Tubes and receptacles built for the storing, recording and research of various materials.<br><br>The Materium can be assembled in a home.
original_zh_text: 用于存储、记录和研究各种材料的试管与容器。<br><br>物质库可在钟居内组装。
translated_text: 用于存储、记录和研究各种材料的管道和容器。<br><br>材料可以在家组装。
secondary_translated_text: Pipelines and containers used to store, record and study various materials.<br><br>Materials can be assembled at home.

original_en_text: Ethereal flower plucked from a deep and distant memory. Glows with soft, pale light that wards against the void.
original_zh_text: 采自深层忆境的空灵花朵，散发出能够驱散虚空的柔光。
translated_text: 空灵的花朵是从深深而遥远的记忆中采摘的。在虚空中发出柔和、苍白的光芒。
secondary_translated_text: Ethereal flowers are picked from deep and distant memories. Glowing a soft, pale light in the void.

original_en_text: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The blade gleams sharper than ever before.
original_zh_text: 为战斗设计的特制长针，原身为纺织工具。刃如寒星，锋芒毕露。
translated_text: 具有独特平衡性的长缝纫工具适合战斗。刀刃的光芒比以往任何时候都更加锐利。
secondary_translated_text: Long sewing tools with unique balance are suitable for combat. The light of the blade is sharper than ever.

original_en_text: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The highly refined blade reveals its hivesteel banding.
original_zh_text: 为战斗设计的特制长针，原身为纺织工具。采用蜂钢锻造，刃身隐约显现独特的六边形状纹路。
translated_text: 具有独特平衡性的长缝纫工具适合战斗。高度精致的刀片显露出蜂巢图案。
secondary_translated_text: Long sewing tools with unique balance are suitable for combat. The highly sophisticated blade reveals a honeycomb pattern.

original_en_text: Writing implement for recording one’s travels. Can be used to update any acquired maps.
original_zh_text: 记录旅程的绘制工具。可用于完善已获取的地图。
translated_text: 记录旅行的书写工具。可用于更新任何获取的地图。
secondary_translated_text: A writing instrument for recording travel. Can be used to update any acquired map.

original_en_text: Technique taken from the primal source of Silk. Spin talons from thread that seek out enemies.
original_zh_text: 源自灵丝本源的技艺。凝丝为爪，追踪敌人。
translated_text: 该技术来自丝绸的原始来源。从线上旋转爪子以寻找敌人。
secondary_translated_text: This technology comes from the original source of silk. Rotate your claws from the line to find enemies.

original_en_text: Carving of Camora, Weaver of healing. A prayer is etched upon it.<br><br>“Weaver, heal my sons, their fearful hearts, their limbs that shake at the climb to come. We pray, gift but a glimmer of your strength, that when we stand before your divinity, you see bugs shed free of fear.”
original_zh_text: 治愈织者卡莫拉的雕像，像上刻有祷文。<br><br>“治愈我的孩子，平复他们的恐惧，止住他们的颤抖。愿您赐予微薄之力，待到觐见圣颜之日，您能见我们摆脱恐惧。”
translated_text: 卡莫拉的雕刻治愈了编织者。上面写着祈祷。<br><br>“韦弗，治愈我的儿子们，治愈他们恐惧的心，治愈他们在即将到来的攀登中颤抖的四肢。我们祈祷，给你们一点力量，当我们站在你们的众神面前时，你们会看到无忧无虑的虫子。"
secondary_translated_text: Camorra's carvings healed the weavers. It says prayer.<br><br>"Weaver, heal my sons, heal their fearful hearts, heal their limbs that tremble on the upcoming climb. We pray to give you some strength, and when we stand before your gods, you will see the carefree worms. "

original_en_text: Ancient Weaver technique. Cling to sheer surfaces and leap off to rapidly scale heights.
original_zh_text: 古老的织者技艺。吸附绝壁并向上弹跳，快速跃升至高处。
translated_text: 古老的编织技术。靠近陡峭的表面并快速跳到高处。
secondary_translated_text: Ancient weaving technology. Get close to steep surfaces and jump high quickly.

original_en_text: Cold, steely stone with remarkable regrowth capacity.<br><br>If shattered into shell shards, it will reform over time.
original_zh_text: 冰冷坚硬的钢铁石，拥有极强的再生能力。<br><br>若被击碎成甲壳碎片，它将随时间逐渐重塑自身。
translated_text: 冰冷的钢石具有显着的再生能力。<br><br>如果破碎成贝壳碎片，随着时间的推移，它会重新形成。
secondary_translated_text: Cold steel stone has significant regenerative capabilities.<br><br>If broken into shell fragments, it will re-form over time.

original_en_text: Rusted key of common design. Can be used to open a range of simple locks.<br><br>Degraded by time, it will break after a single use.
original_zh_text: 生锈的普通钥匙，可用于开启部分简单锁具。<br><br>因年代久远，使用一次后就会坏掉。
translated_text: 普通设计的钥匙生锈了。可用于打开一系列简单的锁。<br><br>随着时间的推移，它会变质，并在使用后破裂。
secondary_translated_text: The keys of ordinary design are rusty. Can be used to open a series of simple locks.<br><br>Over time, it deteriorates and breaks after use.

original_en_text: Rare element found naturally within the rock and bone of Pharloom.<br><br>Used by skilled craftsbugs in the construction of tools and trinkets.
original_zh_text: 纺络地区岩石和骨头中天然形成的稀有金属。<br><br>老练的工匠虫可用其制作工具与饰品。
translated_text: 法鲁姆的岩石和骨头中天然发现的稀有元素。<br><br>被熟练的宇航员用来制作工具和小饰品。
secondary_translated_text: Rare elements found naturally in the rocks and bones of Farum.<br><br>Used by skilled astronauts to make tools and trinkets.

original_en_text: Two parts of a cogwork heart, containing an intricate array of wheels and regulators.
original_zh_text: 一对内含精密轮组阵列的机心部件。
translated_text: 齿心的两个部分包含一系列复杂的轮子和调节器。
secondary_translated_text: The two sections of the tooth center contain a complex series of wheels and adjusters.

original_en_text: The heart can be displayed in a home.
secondary_translated_text: Hearts can be displayed at home.

original_en_text: Rare symbolic medallion, given only to a true friend of fleas.
original_zh_text: 跳蚤挚友专属的稀有勋章。
translated_text: 一枚罕见的象征性奖章仅颁发给跳蚤真正的朋友。
secondary_translated_text: A rare symbolic medal is awarded only to fleas 'true friends.

original_en_text: Summon the Beastlings and return together to their mother.
original_zh_text: 召唤钟道兽群并与其一同返回母巢。
translated_text: 召唤野兽并一起回到它们的母亲身边。
secondary_translated_text: Call on the beasts and return together to their mother.

original_en_text: A pouch for holding traps and tools, and fine crafting implements to increase their lethality.
original_zh_text: 工具袋与精密加工器具的组合，既可用于收纳，也可用于加工提升工具与陷阱的杀伤力。
translated_text: 一个装有陷阱和工具的袋子，以及增加杀伤力的复杂工具。
secondary_translated_text: A bag containing traps and tools, and complex tools to increase lethality.

original_en_text: Hard, charged stone that can catch, store and discharge electricity.
original_zh_text: 可捕捉、储存，并释放电流的硬石。
translated_text: 坚硬的带电石头，可以被捕获、储存和放电。
secondary_translated_text: Hard, charged stone that can be captured, stored and discharged.

original_en_text: Carved bone idol of an ancient Weaver. A prayer is etched upon its body.
original_zh_text: 远古织者的骨雕圣像，躯体刻有祷文。
translated_text: 古代编织者的雕刻骨偶像。它的身上刻着祈祷文。
secondary_translated_text: The carved bone idol of ancient weavers. It has prayers engraved on its body.

original_en_text: Cracked shell containing soul drawn from a long deceased bug.
original_zh_text: 破裂的外壳，容纳着从长眠的虫子身上抽取的灵魂。
translated_text: 破裂的外壳包含从一只死去已久的昆虫中提取的灵魂。
secondary_translated_text: The cracked shell contains the soul extracted from a long-dead insect.

original_en_text: Thick, syrupy soup of Mossberries and druidic herbs. Sweet and aromatic, but poisonous to most creatures.
original_zh_text: 用苔莓和德鲁伊草药炖煮的浓汤，芳香甜美，但对大多数生物有毒。
translated_text: 富含苔藓和杜松子香草的糖浆汤。又甜又香，但对大多数生物都有毒。
secondary_translated_text: Syrup soup rich in moss and juniper vanilla. It's sweet and fragrant, but toxic to most living things.

original_en_text: Deflective technique of a creature spun from thread. Bind Silk around the needle to deflect enemy attacks and instantly strike back.
original_zh_text: 灵丝生物的防御技艺。用灵丝缠绕针身格挡敌人的攻击，并立即进行反击。
translated_text: 丝线编织生物排斥。将Silk绑在针上可以立即偏转敌人的攻击并反击。
secondary_translated_text: Silk thread weaving biological repulsion. Tying Silk to a needle can immediately deflect enemy attacks and counterattack.

original_en_text: Gleaming pearl carved over with intricate markings. The rarest and most highly valued rosaries in all of Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 精雕细琢的闪耀珍珠，纺络地区最珍贵的货币。
translated_text: 闪闪发光的珍珠上雕刻着复杂的痕迹。最稀有和最有价值的念珠在法纳姆的所有领域。
secondary_translated_text: Complex traces are carved on the sparkling pearls. The rarest and most valuable rosary beads are found in all areas of Farnham.

original_en_text: One half of an artefact left behind by the Weavers, designed to collect and hold Silk.<br><br>A completed spool will allow one to hold more Silk within their shell.
original_zh_text: 织者遗失圣器的一半，用于收集和储存灵丝。<br><br>完整的灵丝轴可提升甲壳内灵丝储量上限。
translated_text: 织布工留下的文物有一半是为了收集和保存丝绸。<br><br>一个完整的卷轴可以让人们在壳内容纳更多的丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: Half of the cultural relics left behind by the weavers were used to collect and preserve silk.<br><br>A complete scroll allows people to hold more silk inside the shell.

original_en_text: Deadly Weaver technique. Throw the needle forward with force amplified by coiled Silk.
original_zh_text: 致命的织者技艺。用灵丝缠绕织针，向前奋力投掷，拥有令人生畏的穿透力。
translated_text: 致命韦弗的技术。向前扔针，用卷曲的丝绸来放大力量。
secondary_translated_text: Deadly Weaver's technique. Throw the needle forward and use curled silk to amplify the power.

original_en_text: Tattered decree of the Citadel.<br><br>“Bug of voice grown hoarse or shell fallen frail, you have been selected for duty most sacred.<br><br>Become our light, our guide in darkness, that others worthy may climb to join the holy song.”
original_zh_text: 圣堡的破损敕令。<br><br>“声音嘶哑或甲壳脆弱的虫民，你已被选中承担最神圣的职责。<br><br>成为我们的光，黑暗中的指引，让其他有资格者得以攀登加入圣歌。”
translated_text: 城堡的法令支离破碎。<br><br>“沙哑的蠕虫，外壳变得脆弱，你被选中承担最神圣的职责。<br><br>成为我们的光明，我们在黑暗中的向导，让其他人有资格攀登并加入赞美诗。"
secondary_translated_text: The castle's decrees are in tatters.<br><br>"Hoarsely worm, the shell becomes fragile, and you are chosen to take on the most sacred duties.<br><br>Become our light, our guide in the dark, and qualify others to climb and join the hymns. "

original_en_text: Meat harvested from a defeated creature. It has been cleanly speared through, but is otherwise intact.
original_zh_text: 击败怪物获得的肉类。被刺穿一个窟窿，但整体还算完整。
translated_text: 从被击败的生物身上收获的肉。它被干净利落地刺穿了，但其他方面完好无损。
secondary_translated_text: Meat harvested from defeated creatures. It was cleanly pierced, but otherwise intact.

original_en_text: Heirloom of a village lost to Pharloom’s Haunting.
original_zh_text: 迷失于丝咒的村庄遗留的传家宝。
translated_text: 由于法鲁的困扰，村里的传家宝丢失了。
secondary_translated_text: Due to Faro's troubles, the family heirlooms in the village were lost.

original_en_text: Shard of an ancient mask worn to protect oneself from harm.<br><br>Complete a mask to strengthen the shell and protect against damage.
original_zh_text: 古老的面甲碎片。<br><br>集齐碎片可重塑完整的面甲，强化甲壳防护。
translated_text: 为保护自己免受伤害而佩戴的古代面具的碎片。<br><br>完成面罩以加固外壳并保护其免受损坏。
secondary_translated_text: Fragments of an ancient mask worn to protect yourself from harm.<br><br>Complete the mask to strengthen the shell and protect it from damage.

original_en_text: Metallic cylinder of Citadel make, etched with a recording of sound.<br><br>The cylinder can be played in a gramophone.
original_zh_text: 圣堡铸造的金属音筒，刻录着声音的波形。<br><br>可在留声机处播放。
translated_text: 城堡内制造的金属圆柱体，上面刻有录音。<br><br>该圆柱体可以在留声机上播放。
secondary_translated_text: A metal cylinder made in the castle with a recording engraved on it.<br><br>The cylinder can be played on a phonograph.

original_en_text: Faded parchment containing the last words of a lost pilgrim.<br><br>“-ter I die here in the damp dark than join those poor sods, trapped to stumble, aimless and empty, until their limbs fall to dust.”
original_zh_text: 褪色的羊皮纸，一名惊惶的朝圣者在上面留下了遗言。<br><br>“宁死于阴湿之地，不愿做空壳游魂。”
translated_text: 一张褪色的羊皮纸，上面写着一位迷失的朝圣者的遗言。<br><br>“--除非我死在潮湿的黑暗中，否则我不会加入那些可怜的混蛋的行列，他们被困在路上，漫无目的，空虚，直到四肢化为灰尘。"
secondary_translated_text: A faded parchment with the last words of a lost pilgrim written on it.<br><br>"--Unless I die in the damp darkness, I will not join the ranks of those poor bastards who are stuck on the road, aimless and empty until their limbs turn to dust. "

original_en_text: Map of Pharloom and a quill for recording one’s travels. When resting at a bench or elsewhere, the map will be updated with newly discovered areas.
original_zh_text: 纺络的地图及羽毛笔。当在长椅或其他地方休息时，将更新地图以显示新发现的区域。
translated_text: 法勒姆地图和羽毛笔来记录旅行。当在长凳或其他地方休息时，地图将更新到新发现的区域。
secondary_translated_text: Farham maps and quill to record travel. When resting on a bench or other place, the map will update to the newly discovered area.

original_en_text: Deadly Weaver technique. Cast the needle in a whirl of Silk around oneself, lashing foes.
original_zh_text: 致命的织者技艺。旋针卷丝形成护体风暴，鞭笞近身的敌人。
translated_text: 致命韦弗的技术。在自己身上扎一根针，鞭打敌人。
secondary_translated_text: Deadly Weaver's technique. Stick a needle in yourself and whip the enemy.

original_en_text: Holy Weaver talent. Play ancient melodies by stringing Silk along the needle.
original_zh_text: 神圣的织者天赋。用灵丝给针身上弦，拨弹悠长的古调。
translated_text: 神织者天赋。跟随丝弦奏古曲。
secondary_translated_text: God weaver talent. Follow the silk strings and play ancient songs.

original_en_text: Essence of a being merged within. Silk will be restored when resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 灵魂与认知浑然一体。在长椅休息时恢复灵丝。
translated_text: 存在的本质融入其中。丝绸放在长凳上就恢复了。
secondary_translated_text: The essence of existence is integrated into it. The silk was restored when placed on the bench.

original_en_text: Metallic cylinder of Citadel make, etched with the melody of the Vaultkeepers.<br><br>The cylinder can be played in a gramophone.
original_zh_text: 圣堡制造的金属圆筒，刻有书库管理员圣歌。<br><br>音筒可用留声机播放。
translated_text: 城堡制作的金属圆柱上刻有金库守护者的旋律。<br><br>该圆柱体可以在留声机上播放。
secondary_translated_text: The metal columns made by the castle are engraved with the melody of the keeper of the vault.<br><br>The cylinder can be played on a phonograph.

original_en_text: Long burning rock from the base of Pharloom. Mined and used by the Citadel in its forgings.
original_zh_text: 储备于纺络底部的长效燃烧石，由圣堡开采，并用于其产品锻造。
translated_text: 法鲁姆底部长期燃烧的岩石。由城堡开采并用于锻造。
secondary_translated_text: Long-burning rock at the bottom of Farum. Mined by the castle and used for forging.

original_en_text: One part of a cogwork heart, containing an intricate mechanism of wheels and regulators.
original_zh_text: 一个内含精密轮组结构的机心部件。
translated_text: 齿轮核心的一部分，包含由轮子和调节器组成的复杂机构。
secondary_translated_text: Part of the gear core that contains a complex mechanism consisting of wheels and adjusters.

original_en_text: Simple protective garb, sewn through with flexible spines.
original_zh_text: 缝入了柔韧棘刺芯的轻便披风，提供基础防护。
translated_text: 简单的防护服，缝制有弹性尖刺。
secondary_translated_text: Simple protective clothing, sewn with elastic spikes.

original_en_text: Seal symbol given in recognition of a true Hunter, stamped in sticky goo.
original_zh_text: 用不知名粘稠物戳印的印章标识，代表了对一名猎人的认可。
translated_text: 海豹标志是为了纪念真正的猎人，上面印有粘稠的粘液。
secondary_translated_text: The seal logo is in memory of real hunters and is printed with sticky mucus.

original_en_text: Tough, furred seed from the centre of a corpora cluster. Stale to taste, but strong once ground as seasoning.
original_zh_text: 珊瑚砫丛中心的坚硬毛壳种实，直接食用味同嚼蜡。研磨成粉后辛香浓烈，常作为调味料。
translated_text: 来自水库群中心的坚韧、蓬松的种子。味道不好，但作为调味品研磨后味道浓烈。
secondary_translated_text: Tough, fluffy seeds from the center of the reservoir group. It tastes bad, but it tastes strong after grinding as a condiment.

original_en_text: Guide track for the Choir, with a theme of ascendence.
original_zh_text: 圣咏导引曲目・升天篇。
translated_text: 合唱团的指南曲目以“崛起”为主题。
secondary_translated_text: The choir's guide track is themed "Rise".

original_en_text: Old Weaver recording instrument, strung with Silk runes. The faded runes hold a Weaver’s words from ages gone.
original_zh_text: 古老的织者乐器，缀满灵丝符文。斑驳的符文承载着一名织者的往世箴言。
translated_text: 古代织布者记录了用丝绸符文串起来的乐器。褪色的符文多年来保留着织布者的文字。
secondary_translated_text: Ancient weavers recorded musical instruments strung together with silk runes. The faded runes have retained the weaver's words for many years.

original_en_text: Key with the mark of ‘Indolent’. Opens the way to certain cells and passages of the Slab.
original_zh_text: 带有“怠惰”标记的钥匙。可开启罪石牢狱中的部分牢房和通路。
translated_text: 带有“冷漠”标记的钥匙。为板的某些细胞和通道开辟道路。
secondary_translated_text: The key marked "indifference". Open the way for certain cells and channels of the plate.

original_en_text: Tattered pelt taken from the body of a Crawbug. Fragile and drab, it is considered to have few practical uses.
original_zh_text: 腐囊虫身上的破碎毛皮。细碎且邋遢，实用性极低。
translated_text: 从小龙虾身上采集的粗糙皮毛。它脆弱而单调，被认为几乎没有实际用途。
secondary_translated_text: Rough fur collected from crayfish. It is fragile and monotonous, and is considered to have little practical use.

original_en_text: Deadly Weaver technique. Pierce through enemies in a blur of blade and Silk.
original_zh_text: 致命的织者技艺。灵丝与刃锋交织，高速穿透多个敌人。
translated_text: 致命韦弗的技术。在刀锋和丝绸的模糊中刺穿敌人。
secondary_translated_text: Deadly Weaver's technique. Piercing the enemy in the blur of blade and silk.

original_en_text: Hard horn piece, broken from the tip of a Conchfly’s shell.
original_zh_text: 取自螺蝇外壳尖端的硬角。
translated_text: 坚硬的角片，从壳尖脱落。
secondary_translated_text: Hard corner pieces fall off from the tip of the shell.

original_en_text: Small bundle of shell shards tied together with string. Can be broken to use the shards for crafting.
original_zh_text: 一小捆甲壳碎片，由细绳串在一起。拆解后获得的甲壳碎片可用于制作。
translated_text: 一小捆贝壳碎片用绳子绑在一起。可以破碎以使用碎片进行制作。
secondary_translated_text: A small bundle of shell fragments is tied together with rope. Can be broken to use fragments for fabrication.

original_en_text: Heavy bell filled with the shimmering soul of the Bell Hermit.
original_zh_text: 沉重的大钟，封存着钟之隐者发光的灵魂。
translated_text: 沉重的钟声充满了贝尔隐士闪闪发光的灵魂。
secondary_translated_text: The heavy bell filled the glittering soul of Bell hermit.

original_zh_text: 完成度可以在物品栏中查看
translated_text: 库存中可见的完成百分比
secondary_translated_text: Percentage of completion visible in inventory

original_en_text: Singed parchment containing a pilgrim’s scrawl.<br><br>“My dear companions, all are gone now, devoured, scorched, fallen to exhaustion, or worse, seduced by the Haunting.”
original_zh_text: 烧焦的羊皮纸，一名朝圣者在上面留下了潦草的笔迹。<br><br>“同伴皆逝，或遭吞噬，或焚为灰烬，或力竭而亡，甚至......堕于丝咒。”
translated_text: 烧焦的羊皮纸上写着朝圣者的涂鸦。<br><br>“我亲爱的同伴们，一切现在都消失了，吞没了，烧焦了，精疲力尽了，或者更糟，被萦绕在心头的诱惑下。"
secondary_translated_text: Prayer graffiti was written on charred parchment.<br><br>"My dear companions, everything is now gone, swallowed, charred, exhausted, or worse, under the temptation that haunts me. "

original_en_text: Meat harvested from a defeated creature. It has been seared in a way that noticeably affects the flavour.
original_zh_text: 击败怪物获得的肉类。焦黑部分已严重影响其口味。
translated_text: 从被击败的生物身上收获的肉。烧焦的方式显着影响味道。
secondary_translated_text: Meat harvested from defeated creatures. The way it burns significantly affects the taste.

original_en_text: Liquid lifeseed, possessed of remarkable regenerative qualities. A substance foreign to Pharloom, introduced by the Alchemist Zylotol.
original_zh_text: 具再生功效的液态生命精华。源自异域，由炼金术士奇洛托引入。
translated_text: 液体生命周期具有非凡的再生质量。来自Pharloom的异物，由炼金术士Zylotol引入。
secondary_translated_text: The liquid life cycle has extraordinary regenerative quality. Foreign body from Pharloom, introduced by the alchemist Zylotol.

original_en_text: Protective garb lined with the soft down of a Fayforn and sewn through with flexible spines.
original_zh_text: 缝入了柔韧棘刺芯的保护性披风，内衬幻羽煌蛾的柔软绒毛。
translated_text: 防护服内衬Fayforn的柔软羽绒，并用灵活的缝线穿过。
secondary_translated_text: The protective clothing is lined with Fayforn's soft down and threaded with flexible stitching.

original_en_text: Hardened chunk of horned shell collected from a defeated Savage Beastfly.
original_zh_text: 击败暴怒兽蝇获得的硬化角状碎片。
translated_text: 从一只被击败的野兽苍蝇身上采集的坚硬的角壳。
secondary_translated_text: A hard horned shell collected from a defeated beast fly.

original_en_text: Ancient Weaver talent. Throw the needle upward and launch to tremendous heights.
original_zh_text: 古老的织者天赋。向空中掷针并跃升至高处。
translated_text: 古代编织者的才华。将指针抛起来并将其发射到非常高的高度。
secondary_translated_text: The talent of ancient weavers. Throw the pointer up and launch it to a very high altitude.

original_en_text: Advanced Weaver talent. Throw the Silk-strung needle like a harpoon and charge towards it.
original_zh_text: 高阶织者天赋。掷针为锚，牵引冲刺。
translated_text: 高级韦弗天赋。像鱼叉一样扔一根丝线，然后冲向它。
secondary_translated_text: Advanced Weaver talent. Throw a silk thread like a harpoon and charge at it.

original_en_text: Sentence issued by the Citadel Ministers.<br><br>“Chosen of the Choir, by grace of our magnanimous Conductors you are granted mercy. When you exit that cage, an elder bug of sins absolved, you may rejoin our flock and feel our light, and never again shall your voice fall silent.”
original_zh_text: 圣堡大臣宣判的特赦令。<br><br>"圣咏团的选民，你因指挥家的宽宏获得赦免。走出牢笼，作为洗清罪孽的长者，重归我们的群体，永沐光明，歌喉永不沉寂。"
translated_text: 城堡大臣的裁决。<br><br>“那些被选为合唱团的人，在我们慷慨的指挥的帮助下，你们将受到怜悯。当你离开那个笼子，一项古老的罪被原谅时，你就可以重新加入我们的羊群，感受到我们的光，你的声音将不再沉默。"
secondary_translated_text: The verdict of the Castle Chancellor.<br><br>"Those who have been selected for the choir, with the help of our generous conductor, will be pitied. When you leave that cage and an ancient sin is forgiven, you can rejoin our flock, feel our light, and your voice will no longer be silent. "

original_en_text: Heavy necklace laden with pearl rosaries. Can be broken and the rosaries used to trade.
original_zh_text: 缀满珍珠念珠的重链，拆解后取出的念珠可用于交易。
translated_text: 沉重的项链上装有珍珠念珠。可以破碎并用于交易念珠。
secondary_translated_text: A heavy necklace with pearl beads. Can be broken and used to trade rosary beads.

original_en_text: Carving of Keelal, Weaver of the path. A prayer is etched upon it.<br><br>“Blessed Weaver, lady of grace, you who see our sin, our frail shells, our voices weak, and still offer your protection. How great your mind to care so much for ones so lowly.”
original_zh_text: 道路织者奇拉尔的雕像，像上刻有祷文。<br><br>“仁慈织者啊，您洞悉我们的罪过、甲壳的脆弱、歌喉的微弱，但仍施予庇护。心怀蝼蚁，何其伟大。”
translated_text: 基拉尔的雕刻，道路编织者。上面刻着一段祈祷文。<br><br>“祝福的织布者，格蕾丝夫人，你已经看到了我们的罪恶，我们脆弱的外壳，我们微弱的声音，但仍然为你提供保护。你如此关心这样一个卑微的人真是太棒了。"
secondary_translated_text: Carving of Kilar, road weavers. A prayer was engraved on it.<br><br>"Blessed weaver, Lady Grace, you have seen our sins, our fragile shells, our weak voices, but still provide you with protection. It's great that you care so much about such a humble man. "

original_en_text: Consume the Silkeater to retrieve a cocoon after falling in battle.
original_zh_text: 死亡后，使用噬丝蛆可立即找回自己的茧。
translated_text: 战斗倒下后，让丝鳞鱼取回茧。
secondary_translated_text: After falling in battle, let the silk scale fish retrieve the cocoon.

original_en_text: A relic of Pharloom’s past, interesting to collectors of historical items.
original_zh_text: 封存着纺络的往昔岁月，使古董收藏家趋之若鹜。
translated_text: 对于历史文物收藏家来说，法勒姆过去的废墟很有趣。
secondary_translated_text: For historical relic collectors, the ruins of Farham's past are interesting.

original_en_text: Worn string holding a meagre amount of rosaries. Can be broken and the loose rosaries used to trade.
original_zh_text: 老旧的念珠细串，拆解后可取出少量念珠用于交易。
translated_text: 磨损的绳子上承载着少量的念珠。松散的念珠可以破碎并用于交易。
secondary_translated_text: The worn rope carries a small number of rosary beads. Loose rosary beads can be broken and used for trading.

original_en_text: Short string of rosaries. Can be broken and the rosaries used to trade.
original_zh_text: 念珠短串，拆解后取出的念珠可用于交易。
translated_text: 一串简短的念珠。可以破碎并用于交易念珠。
secondary_translated_text: A short rosary. Can be broken and used to trade rosary beads.

original_en_text: Order issued by the Citadel. The once gleaming seal has worn with time.
original_zh_text: 圣堡颁布的陈年诫令。随着岁月变迁，曾经光亮的印鉴逐渐变得暗淡。
translated_text: 城堡发布的命令。曾经闪闪发光的封印会随着时间的推移而消失。
secondary_translated_text: Orders issued by the castle. The once shining seal will disappear with time.

original_en_text: Iron emblem of the Court of Craws, absolving the bearer of all crimes past and future.
original_zh_text: 腐囊虫庭的铁质徽记，可赦免持有者的一切罪行。
translated_text: Craws法庭的铁徽免除了那些对过去和未来所有犯罪负有责任的人。
secondary_translated_text: The iron emblem of the Craws court absolves those responsible for all past and future crimes.

original_en_text: Engraved cruststone, worn by sand and blanched by time.<br><br>...Watch...Remember...Till time... Life anew...
original_zh_text: 饱经风沙的硬壳石，表面雕刻的文字已被岁月打磨至斑白。<br><br>......守望......铭记......直至......新生......
translated_text: 雕刻的地壳被沙子磨损，被时间漂白。<br><br>...餐桌付款.记得...直到时间。新的生活。
secondary_translated_text: The carved crust is worn by sand and bleached by time.<br><br>... Table pay. Remember... Until time. A new life.

original_en_text: Small worker’s key. Unlocks the gate in the middle of Deep Docks.
original_zh_text: 工人的小钥匙。能打开深坞中间的门。
translated_text: 仆人的钥匙。打开深码头的中央门。
secondary_translated_text: The servant's key. Open the central door of the deep pier.

original_en_text: Fabled Weaver talent. Dash forward and sprint with unnatural speed, as though gliding upon Silk.
original_zh_text: 传说中的织者天赋。向前冲刺，踏风疾行，如若御丝滑翔。
translated_text: 传说韦弗才华横溢。向前冲，以一种不自然的速度冲刺，就像在丝绸上滑行一样。
secondary_translated_text: Legend has it that Weaver is brilliant. Rush forward and sprint at an unnatural speed, like sliding on silk.

original_en_text: The memento can be displayed in a home.
secondary_translated_text: Souvenirs can be displayed at home.

original_en_text: Plea of a Weaver from the furthest edge of Pharloom.<br><br>“Flee, sisters. Flee until your strength exhausts, so far you may escape at last her silken sight.<br><br>To start anew, to sustain, free of web and service eternal.”
original_zh_text: 一名纺络边陲织者的泣告。<br><br>“逃吧，姊妹们，直至力竭，或许可以逃离她的丝眼。<br><br>另寻新生，永离罗网与奴役。”
translated_text: 法鲁最远边缘的织布工恳求道。<br><br>“快跑，姐妹们。奔跑直到你的力量耗尽，最终你才能逃脱她丝滑的视线。<br><br>重新开始，维护它，摆脱永恒的网络和服务。"
secondary_translated_text: The weaver at the farthest edge of Faro pleaded.<br><br>"Run quickly, sisters. Run until your strength is exhausted, and finally you can escape her silky sight.<br><br>Start over, maintain it, and get rid of eternal networks and services. "

original_en_text: Simple garment worn by several pilgrims over the ages. Torn, tattered and repaired many times over.
original_zh_text: 一件历代朝圣者曾穿过的朴素衣物，破旧褴褛，历经多次缝补。
translated_text: 多年来，几位朝圣者都穿着简单的衣服。多次撕裂、撕裂和修复。
secondary_translated_text: Over the years, several pilgrims have worn simple clothes. Multiple tears, tears and repairs.

original_en_text: Small sculpture, inexpertly but painstakingly crafted as a symbol of enduring friendship.
original_zh_text: 粗糙却用心的小雕像，象征坚定的友谊。
translated_text: 这些小雕塑虽然技艺精湛，但精心制作，却是持久友谊的象征。
secondary_translated_text: Although these small sculptures are superb in craftsmanship, they are carefully crafted and are a symbol of lasting friendship.

original_en_text: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The Hivesteel blade has been sharpened to its ultimate form.
original_zh_text: 为战斗设计的特制长针，原身为纺织工具。蜂钢刃身经过极致打磨，臻至化境，无坚不摧。
translated_text: 具有独特平衡性的长缝纫工具适合战斗。蜂巢钢刀片已被锋利到最终形式。
secondary_translated_text: Long sewing tools with unique balance are suitable for combat. Honeycomb steel blades have been sharpened to their final form.

original_en_text: Blood of a creature merged full with liquid lifeseed. Possesses powerful regenerative qualities.
original_zh_text: 融合液态生命精华的血液，具有极强的再生功效。
translated_text: 生物的血液与液体活力融为一体。具有很强的再生质量。
secondary_translated_text: The vitality of blood and liquid of living things is integrated. It has strong regenerative quality.

original_en_text: A machine with a symbol of Silk.
original_zh_text: 一台印有灵丝符号的机器。
translated_text: 一台上面有丝绸符号的机器。
secondary_translated_text: A machine with a silk symbol on it.

original_en_text: Discarded key of the Whiteward.<br>Opens the sluice beneath the operating theatre.
original_zh_text: 白愈厅废弃的钥匙。<br>可开启手术室下方的大门。
translated_text: 怀特被遗弃的钥匙。<br>打开手术室下方的闸门。
secondary_translated_text: White's abandoned key.<br>Open the gate below the operating room.

original_en_text: Last words of the Weavers.<br><br>“Sisters, spiders, the burden is passed. These simple bugs shall bear it full. Never to cease. Never to silence.<br><br>We shall die, and wait, and pray, that one may come of silken strength enough to weave us free.”
original_zh_text: 织者们的遗言。<br><br>“姊妹们，同族们，重担已移交。凡虫将承担一切，永不停歇，永不沉寂。<br><br>我们将死去、等待并祈祷，愿有灵丝之力足够强大者到来，编织我们的自由。”
translated_text: 织布工的遗言。<br><br>“姐妹们，蜘蛛们，负担结束了。这些简单的错误完全可以承受。永远不要停止。永远不要沉默。<br><br>我们会死，等待，祈祷，这样有人就能拥有足够的丝绸力量来编织我们的自由。"
secondary_translated_text: The weaver's last words.<br><br>"Sisters, spiders, the burden is over. These simple mistakes are completely tolerable. Never stop. Never be silent.<br><br>We will die, wait, pray, so that someone can have enough silk power to weave our freedom. "

original_en_text: Chunk of hardened material found in the shells of great beasts. Can be broken into individual shell shards for use in crafting.
original_zh_text: 部分巨兽甲壳上脱落的大块硬化碎片。拆解后获得的甲壳碎片可用于制作。
translated_text: 一种在巨兽壳中发现的坚硬物质。可以破碎成单独的贝壳碎片进行制作。
secondary_translated_text: A hard substance found in the shells of giant beasts. It can be broken into individual shell fragments for making.

original_en_text: Shards of an ancient mask worn to protect oneself from harm.<br><br>Complete a mask to strengthen the shell and protect against damage.
original_zh_text: 用以抵御伤害的古老面甲碎片。<br><br>完整的面甲可以强化躯壳，抵御更多伤害。
translated_text: 为保护自己免受伤害而佩戴的古代面具的碎片。<br><br>完成面罩以加固外壳并保护其免受损坏。
secondary_translated_text: Fragments of an ancient mask worn to protect yourself from harm.<br><br>Complete the mask to strengthen the shell and protect it from damage.

original_en_text: Flexible fibre from within a Hoker’s spine. Can be woven into garments and accessories by a skilled seamstress.
original_zh_text: 从棘背虫背刺中提取的纤维，老练的织女虫可以用它缝制衣物或配饰。
translated_text: 霍克脊柱中的柔性纤维。服装和配饰可以由熟练的女裁缝编织。
secondary_translated_text: Flexible fibers in Hawk's spine. Clothing and accessories can be woven by skilled seamstresses.

original_en_text: Rotary key of the Architects. Opens their Chapel in the Underworks.
original_zh_text: 建筑师的旋齿钥匙。可用于开启圣堡工厂的小教堂。
translated_text: 建筑师的旋转钥匙。开放地下室的教堂。
secondary_translated_text: The architect's revolving key. Church with open basement.

original_en_text: Simple protective garb, expertly woven but showing signs of age.
original_zh_text: 工艺精湛的旧披风，提供基础防护。
translated_text: 简单的防护服，编织精良，但显示出年龄的迹象。
secondary_translated_text: Simple protective clothing, well woven, but showing signs of age.

original_en_text: Retracted Weaver surveillance instrument. Once assembled, the device will allow observation over vast distances.  <br><br>The Farsight can be assembled in a home.
original_zh_text: 收起状态的织者监视设备。组装后可用于远距离观测。<br><br>遥观仪可在钟居内组装。
translated_text: 零售商韦弗监视仪器。一旦组装好，该装置将允许远距离观察。<br><br>Farsight可以在家组装。
secondary_translated_text: Retailers Weaver surveillance instruments. Once assembled, the device will allow for long-range observation.<br><br>Farsight can be assembled at home.

original_en_text: Scrawled missive on tattered black rag.<br><br>“Defiler... Dark... Attend... Home... Wheel...”
original_zh_text: 黑色的破布上写满潦草的字迹。<br><br>“亵渎者...... 晦暗...... 赴约...... 轮子......”
translated_text: 这封信写在破烂的黑布上。<br><br>“玷污者。黑暗之中参加这个论坛家...轮子……”
secondary_translated_text: The letter was written on tattered black cloth.<br><br>"Defilers. Participating in this forum in the dark... Wheels…"

original_en_text: Beads carved from various materials, used as a measure of faith and traded as currency. Each is etched with a fine patterned design.
original_zh_text: 用不同材料雕刻的珠子，既作为信仰的象征又被用作流通货币。每颗表面都镌刻着精美的纹饰图案。
translated_text: 用各种材料雕刻的珠子被用作信仰的衡量标准，并作为货币进行交易。每个都刻有美丽的图案设计。
secondary_translated_text: Beads carved from various materials are used as a measure of faith and traded as currency. Each is engraved with a beautiful pattern design.

original_en_text: Enlivened heart of the Green Prince. Its beat is sharp and clear.
original_zh_text: 绿王子复苏的心脏，跳动急剧清晰。
translated_text: 绿色王子的心充满了活力。它的节拍尖锐而清晰。
secondary_translated_text: The green prince's heart is full of vitality. Its beat is sharp and clear.

original_en_text: Vial gifted by the Chapel Maid, filled full with swirling soul.
original_zh_text: 教堂侍女赠予的小瓶，里面装着漩流状的灵魂。
translated_text: 教堂女仆献上的小瓶子里装满了旋转的灵魂。
secondary_translated_text: The small bottle presented by the church maid was filled with spinning souls.

original_en_text: Brittle levitating rock, found throughout the fringes of Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 遍布纺络边缘地区的悬浮岩石，质地轻脆。
translated_text: 脆弱的漂浮岩石遍布法鲁姆边缘。
secondary_translated_text: Flimsy floating rocks dot the edge of Farum.

original_en_text: Black stone egg formed before the birth of Pharloom.<br><br>A relic from the ancient past. Highly prized by collectors of historical items.
original_zh_text: 纺络诞生前便已形成的黑色石卵。<br><br>远古时期的遗物，是古董收藏家梦寐以求的宝贝。
translated_text: 黑石蛋是在法罗出生之前形成的。<br><br>古代的遗迹。它受到历史文物收藏家的高度重视。
secondary_translated_text: The black stone eggs were formed before Farrow was born.<br><br>Ancient ruins. It is highly valued by historical relics collectors.

original_en_text: Enlivened heart of Nyleth. It beats faint and fast.
original_zh_text: 尼莱斯复苏的心脏，跳动轻盈快速。
translated_text: 激活了尼尔斯的心脏它的节拍又弱又快。
secondary_translated_text: Activate Niels 'heart, its beat is weak and fast.

original_en_text: Key to a restored bell above Bellhart.
original_zh_text: 钟心镇上一座修葺完善的钟居的钥匙。
translated_text: 伯哈特上空修复了钟声的钥匙。
secondary_translated_text: The key to the bell was restored over Burhart.

original_en_text: Finely crafted metal key, shaped to resemble a surgical implement.<br><br>Grants access to the Citadel’s Whiteward.
original_zh_text: 形似外科手术器械的精致钥匙。
translated_text: 一把精心制作的金属钥匙，形状类似于手术器械。<br><br>怀特沃德被允许进入城堡。
secondary_translated_text: A carefully crafted metal key similar in shape to a surgical instrument.<br><br>Whiteward was allowed to enter the castle.

original_en_text: Contorted mass of ashen vine. Cries out incessantly.
original_zh_text: 灰藤扭曲成团，持续发出哀鸣。
translated_text: 一团扭曲的灰色藤蔓。继续哭。
secondary_translated_text: A twisted gray vine. Keep crying.

original_en_text: Carving of Atla, Weaver of time. A prayer is etched upon it.<br><br>“By grace of your example, and our history held full in mind, our song is yours, as your name is sacred. Weaver Atla, may you be praised eternal.”
original_zh_text: 时光织者阿特拉的雕像，像上刻有祷文。<br><br>“以您为榜样，我们铭记历史。颂歌献予您，使您圣名永存。织者阿特拉，愿您永沐荣光。”
translated_text: 阿特拉的雕刻，时间的编织者。上面写着祈祷。<br><br>“感谢你们的榜样，我们的历史就在我们心中，我们的歌曲也是你们的，因为你们的名字是神圣的。维加·阿特拉，愿你获得永恒的赞誉。"
secondary_translated_text: Atra's carving, the weaver of time. It says prayer.<br><br>"Thank you for your role models, our history is in our hearts, and our songs are yours, because your names are sacred. Vega Atra, may you receive eternal praise. "

original_en_text: Sermon of service, delivered by an ordained Vaultkeeper to acolytes in training.
original_zh_text: 侍奉布道，由受封的书库管理员向其信众宣讲。
translated_text: 由指定的财务经理向训练有素的追随者发表的服务性布道。
secondary_translated_text: A service sermon delivered by a designated financial manager to a trained follower.

original_en_text: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The blade is marked by time and use.
original_zh_text: 为战斗设计的特制长针，原身为纺织工具。刃身留有岁月的痕迹。
translated_text: 具有独特平衡性的长缝纫工具适合战斗。刀刃上标有时间和目的。
secondary_translated_text: Long sewing tools with unique balance are suitable for combat. Time and purpose are marked on the blade.

original_en_text: Sacred melody of the Vaultkeepers, coveted and claimed by the pontiff below the Whispering Vaults.
original_zh_text: 书库管理员的圣歌，低语书库下方主教梦寐以求的旋律。
translated_text: 守护者的神圣旋律是令人垂涎的，教皇声称在低语拱顶下拥有它。
secondary_translated_text: The keeper's sacred melody is coveted, and the Pope claims to have it under the Whispering Arch.
