translated_text: 用空心树干盘旋的害虫可以喷出嘶嘶作响的胆汁。
secondary_translated_text: Pests circling through hollow tree trunks can spit out hissing bile.

original_en_text: This surface dweller is free of Silk. Its nature remains its own. The monarch’s influence must only have stretched below it.
original_zh_text: 这地表生物未被丝咒侵蚀，看来圣堡君主的控制尚未延伸至此。
translated_text: 这样的地表居民没有丝绸。它的本质仍然是它自己的。君主的影响力只能在它之下。
secondary_translated_text: Such surface dwellers had no silk. Its essence is still its own. The monarch's influence can only be below it.

original_en_text: Did they ever truly understand those inscrutable scrolls? Or is it all merely pretence, an endless act to maintain their order’s station within the Citadel?
original_zh_text: 他们是否真的理解那些晦涩的经文？还是说，这一切不过是伪装，一场无休止的表演，只为维持他们在城堡中的地位？
translated_text: 他们真的了解了那些神秘的卷轴吗？还是说，这一切都只是为了维持城堡的秩序和地位而假装的，无休止的表演？
secondary_translated_text: Did they really understand those mysterious scrolls? Or is all this just a feigned and endless performance to maintain the order and status of the castle?

original_en_text: Its assault... like a young bug’s toy turned deadly. Could I, in time, fashion a spinning tool to match?
original_zh_text: 其攻击如同将孩童的玩具变成致命武器，或许我能制作类似原理的纺织工具？
translated_text: 它在攻击。这就像一个小虫子的玩具变得致命。能否及时制作配套的旋转工具？
secondary_translated_text: It's attacking. It's like a little bug's toy becoming deadly. Can supporting rotating tools be made in time?

original_en_text: Though grey with age, their frayed form suggested a being strung from Silk, one who welcomed a decisive end in combat over a slow decline.
original_zh_text: 苍老的躯壳布满灵丝束痕。比起缓慢凋零，它更渴求战死的终局。
translated_text: 尽管随着年龄的增长，他们破旧的外表表明一个丝绸制成的人，一个在一场缓慢消退的战斗中面临决定性结局的人。
secondary_translated_text: Although with age, their worn appearance suggests a man made of silk, a man facing a decisive end in a slowly fading battle.

original_en_text: Infant form of the more formidable Craggler.
original_zh_text: 酸蚀巨螯的幼年形态，通过同类相残争夺成长机会。
translated_text: 更强大的克拉格勒婴儿形态。
secondary_translated_text: The more powerful Kragler baby form.

original_en_text: Either its size has made it fearless or the Haunting has removed its sense of self-preservation.
original_zh_text: 要么是巨大的体型给了它勇气，要么是丝咒把它怕死的本性麻痹了。
translated_text: 要么是它的大小让它无所畏惧，要么是它的困扰消除了它的自我保护感。
secondary_translated_text: Either its size makes it fearless, or its obsession eliminates its sense of self-protection.

original_en_text: Barely a bug, and possessing only basic thought, yet instinct alone proved enough to turn it deadly.
original_zh_text: 几乎算不上虫子，只有最基本的思维。然而，其攻击的本能已足够致命。
translated_text: 它几乎不是一个错误，只有基本的想法，但事实证明，仅靠本能就足以使其致命。
secondary_translated_text: It was hardly a mistake, just basic ideas, but it turns out that instinct alone was enough to make it fatal.

original_en_text: Bursts forth at movement sensed close, and will consume any object or bug careless enough to fall into its maw.
original_zh_text: 当流沙开始诡谲涌动时，你只剩半次心跳的时间逃离那张深渊巨口。
translated_text: 当感觉到近距离运动时，它会爆炸，并不小心吃掉任何物体或昆虫，落入它的胃中。
secondary_translated_text: When it senses close motion, it explodes and accidentally eats any object or insect, falling into its stomach.

original_en_text: Pointed scurrier posing as plant life.
original_zh_text: 伪装成植物的带刺疾行者。

original_en_text: Verminous pest, common throughout the dark corners of Greymoor.
original_zh_text: 灰沼阴暗角落滋生的害虫。
translated_text: 害虫在格雷穆尔的黑暗角落很常见。
secondary_translated_text: Pests are common in the dark corners of Greymore.

original_en_text: Its fur is thick and silky. Sadly, lost to its Haunting, I shall never safely be able to touch it.
original_zh_text: 厚实丝绒般的皮毛令人神往，可惜其受丝咒侵蚀，再难安全抚触。
translated_text: 它的皮毛厚实而丝滑。可悲的是，迷失在它的萦绕中，我永远无法安全地触摸它。
secondary_translated_text: Its fur is thick and silky. Sadly, lost in its haunting, I will never be able to touch it safely.

original_en_text: Her body seemed a Weaver’s, but her mask had been forcibly removed, and her own Silk was bound useless by heavy pins lodged through her spine.
original_zh_text: 她身形似织者，但面甲被强行剥离，脊背打入的重钉也使其灵丝失效。
translated_text: 她的身体看起来像韦弗的，但她的面具被强行摘下，她自己的丝绸被插入脊柱的沉重别针束缚。
secondary_translated_text: Her body looked like Weaver's, but her mask was forcibly removed and her own silk was bound by heavy pins inserted into her spine.

original_en_text: Fierce and fast, and defending their lands even from birth. These are children to be proud of.
original_zh_text: 凶猛迅捷，自出生起就守卫故土，是值得骄傲的后裔。
translated_text: 顽强而迅速，甚至从出生起就保卫着他们的土地。这些都是值得骄傲的孩子。
secondary_translated_text: Tenaciously and quickly, defending their land even from birth. These are children to be proud of.

original_en_text: Like fabric somehow sprung to life. Its pelt is perfectly matched to the rags it infests.
original_zh_text: 外色颜色与寄居的布料完美融合，就像被赋予生命的织物。
translated_text: 就像面料以某种方式焕发活力一样。它的皮毛与它感染的抹布完美匹配。
secondary_translated_text: It's like fabric rejuvenates in some way. Its coat matched perfectly with the rag it infected.

original_en_text: Its wings are quite small compared to its bulk. Perhaps it uses the warm air of these fiery lands to help stay airborne. Clever, if so.
original_zh_text: 翅膀小身体胖，估计是利用这片炽热地带的热气流飞起来的——还挺聪明。
translated_text: 与它的大小相比，它的翅膀相当小。也许它利用这些炽热土地的温暖空气来帮助留在空气中。聪明，如果是的话。
secondary_translated_text: Compared to its size, its wings are quite small. Maybe it uses the warm air of these red-hot lands to help stay in the air. Smart, if so.

original_en_text: Gold ranked disciple of the Choir and direct servant to the Citadel’s Conductors.
original_zh_text: 圣咏团的高阶信徒，圣堡指挥家的直系仆从。
translated_text: 合唱团的黄金弟子，城堡指挥的直接仆人。
secondary_translated_text: Golden disciple of the choir, direct servant of the castle commander.

original_en_text: The large bell seems to signify them as once leader of a climbing troupe, though the Haunting has erased that former authority.
original_zh_text: 那柄铭刻朝圣路线的钟杖曾是领袖象征，如今却成了敲碎追随者颅骨的凶器。
translated_text: 巨大的钟声似乎表明他们曾经是一个攀岩团体的领导者，尽管这种困扰已经抹去了之前的权威。
secondary_translated_text: The huge bell seemed to indicate that they were once leaders of a rock climbing group, although the obsession had erased previous authority.

original_en_text: Avoiding their ambush is a good test of my senses, and my ability to rapidly retaliate.
original_zh_text: 规避其伏击是对感知力的考验，快速反击能力同样关键。
translated_text: 避免他们的伏击是对我的感官和快速反击能力的一次很好的考验。
secondary_translated_text: Avoiding their ambush was a good test of my senses and ability to fight back quickly.

original_en_text: To quell the mother’s rage, and see this kingdom saved, I will claim her back. This one... the dark shall not take.
original_zh_text: 为了平息苍白之母的暴怒、拯救这个王国，我必夺回这个孩子的本心——绝不容许虚空将她吞噬。
translated_text: 为了平息母亲的愤怒，拯救这个王国，我会找到她回来。这个...黑暗不会带走。
secondary_translated_text: In order to calm my mother's anger and save this kingdom, I will find her back. this... The darkness will not take away.

original_en_text: Cogwork knight of Pharloom, once protector of its pilgrims, and master of the scissor blade.
original_zh_text: 曾护卫朝圣者的机械骑士，如今双刃剪成为致命凶器。
translated_text: 法鲁的装备骑士曾经是朝圣者的守护者和宝剑大师。
secondary_translated_text: Faro's armed knights were once guardians of pilgrims and masters of swords.

original_en_text: <page>No. Not their enemy, and their prisoner not through malice. I am Eva, a thing... difficult to describe, a child of Weavers, yet not quite their kin...<hpage>How strange. That description could fit me as well as yourself. <page>Child of Weavers?... And not? I can detect your Weaver strain, yet you are different from them, and from me, a shifting, blended thing? What are you creature?<page>Step closer, lady, that my senses would better understand your nature.
original_zh_text: <page>不是，也并非因为罪行囚禁。我叫伊娃，是……有点复杂，是织者后裔但又不完全是……<hpage>真奇妙。这番描述同样适用于我。<page>你也是织者后裔？……但又不是？我能感知你的织者血统，但你既不同于他们，也不同于我，一个流动的混合体？你究竟是什么？<page>请靠近些，女士，方便我感知你的本质。
translated_text: <page>不，不是他们的敌人，不是他们的俘虏。首先，我是伊娃。很难描述，韦弗的孩子，但不完全是他们的亲戚……<hpage>多么奇怪啊。这个描述适合我和你。<page>韦弗的孩子们？而不是？我可以检测到你的织女变种，但你和他们不同，和我不同，一个不断变化的，混合的东西？你是什么样的生物？<page>女士，走近一点，我的感官就会更好地理解你的本性。
secondary_translated_text: <page>No, not their enemies, not their prisoners. First of all, I am Eva. Hard to describe, Weaver's children, but not exactly their relatives...<hpage>How strange. This description suits you and me.<page>Weaver's children? Instead of? I can detect your Vega variants, but you are different from them, different from me, a constantly changing, mixed thing? What kind of creature are you?<page>Ma 'am, come closer and my senses will better understand your nature.

original_en_text: Lady, still my senses resound. You seem so far beyond the bounds of a bug.<page>Permit me to gaze again upon your nature, that I may offer clarity.
original_zh_text: 女士，我的感知再度震颤。您已远远超过凡虫界限。<page>请允许我再次深入感知，才好仔细说明
translated_text: 女士，我的感受仍然在回响。您似乎远远超出了错误的范围。<page>请允许我再次审视你的本性，我可以给出明确的答案。
secondary_translated_text: Ma 'am, my feelings still echo. You seem to be far beyond the scope of the error.<page>Please allow me to examine your nature again, and I can give a clear answer.

original_en_text: Lady? So you live, still. This is good... I had felt the conflict commence, pale hearts ablaze, and the sudden well of darkness after.<hpage>I am sorry, Eva. I had hoped to slay the monarch, and was near achieving that goal, but the situation has become... complicated. Now, all of Pharloom threatens to fall.<page>But I can sense it in you, lady. You have not yielded to despair, so some hope must still remain?<hpage>...Slim hope, I suspect. But true, there may yet be a way through this disaster. I shall pursue that goal with whatever strength remains.<page>Then allow me to continue to aid you as I can... Mine might be a small contribution, but I shall provide it eagerly.
original_zh_text: 女士？你还活着，真是太好了……我早已感受到冲突的爆发，苍白之心熊熊燃烧，而后是突如其来的黑暗深渊。<hpage>抱歉，伊娃。我本希望斩杀君主，几乎就要达成目标，但情况变得……复杂了。如今整个纺络都濒临倾覆。<page>但我能从你身上感受到，女士。你仍未屈服于绝望，是否意味着尚存一线希望？<hpage>……希望渺茫。但确实，或许仍有办法化解这场灾难。我将用残存之力追寻这个目标。<page>那么请允许我继续尽力协助你……虽只是微薄之力，但我必倾心奉献。
translated_text: 女士？所以你还活着。很好我感觉到冲突开始了，苍白的心在燃烧，然后是突然的黑暗之井。<hpage>对不起伊娃我本来希望杀死君主，即将实现这个目标，但情况变得……事情变得复杂，现在整个法勒姆都面临着崩溃的危险。<page>但我能从你身上感觉到，女士。你还没有屈服于绝望，所以一定还有希望吗？<hpage>...我怀疑希望是否渺茫。但事实上，也许有办法度过这场灾难。我将尽我所能来实现这个目标。<page>那么请允许我继续尽我所能帮助您。我的贡献可能很小，但我会热情地提供它。
secondary_translated_text: Lady? So you're still alive. Good. I felt the conflict beginning, the pale heart burning, and then suddenly the well of darkness.<hpage>I'm sorry, Eva. I had hoped to kill the monarch and was about to achieve that goal, but the situation became... things became complicated, and now the whole of Farham is in danger of collapse.<page>But I can feel it in you, ma 'am. You haven't given in to despair, so there must be hope?<hpage>... I wonder if the hope is slim. But in fact, there may be a way to survive this disaster. I will do my best to achieve this goal.<page>Then please allow me to continue to help you as much as I can. My contribution may be small, but I will enthusiastically provide it.

original_en_text: Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bug’s. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing, worth my long life to behold.<page>With what power I possess, I may still be able to aid you further.
original_zh_text: 不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>以我的力量，或许可以助你更上一层。
translated_text: 令人难以置信的...你的本性与凡人蠕虫的本性是如此不同。你的是可塑性且短暂的。这是一件值得我用漫长的生命去观察的美妙的事情。<page>以我的实力，也许可以进一步帮助你。
secondary_translated_text: Incredible... Your nature is so different from the nature of mortal worms. Yours is malleable and short-lived. This is a wonderful thing worth observing with my long life.<page>With my strength, I may be able to help you further.

original_en_text: <hpage>Eva, I am seeking a tool, told to be somewhere in this structure. It is a snare device of Weaver make. Do you know of it?<page>I may, lady. Search over from here, on side where the moss meets the nest. There, my mothers built their tools, all traps and bindings. Small things, but tests for larger forms.<page>I still remember their thoughts as they worked, their desperation, and their hunger. Another hopeless attempt to wrest their freedom. All ended in failure, of course.
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，我在寻找织者制造的陷阱装置。你知道在哪么？<page>有点印象。您可以去青苔与巢穴交界处搜寻，母亲们曾在那制造工具。虽是些小玩意，却是为了更大的图谋。<page>我还记得她们制作时的思绪，那份绝望与饥渴，又一次争夺自由的徒劳尝试。当然，终归失败。
translated_text: <hpage>伊娃，我正在寻找一个被告知位于这个结构中的某个地方的工具。这是韦弗制造的陷阱装置。你知道吗？<page>我可以，女士。看这里，在苔藓和鸟巢的交界处。在那里，我的母亲制作了她们的工具，所有的陷阱和限制。小事，但要以更大的形式进行测试。<page>我仍然记得他们在工作中的想法、他们的绝望和饥饿。又一次徒劳的尝试夺取他们的自由。当然，一切都以失败告终。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Eva, I'm looking for a tool that was told was located somewhere in this structure. This is a trap device Weaver built. You know what?<page>I can, ma 'am. Look here, at the junction of moss and nest. There, my mother made their tools, all the traps and limitations. Small matter, but test in a larger form.<page>I still remember their thoughts at work, their despair and hunger. Another futile attempt to seize their freedom. Of course, everything ended in failure.

original_en_text: Ain’t you come a long way, bellringer! Granting wishes, saving bugs, even rousing my sullen family to act!<page>The snare is set above, our power bound along its thread. To your sight it may seem a crude thing, but there’s fair strength to it... enough to quell a god.<hpage>You and your family have done me well, sir. I shall prove your faith in the meeting ahead.<page>Aye. Bring your best, bellringer. Call forth our great pale god. Cut her weak, then drive the beast down atop the snare.<page>Contact made will stir the snare alight, but only your needle’s song will awaken the spell in full. When that moment arrives, you’ll see it clear.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者，你这一路可够折腾！祈愿、救虫，连我那些沉默的同族都让你说动了！<page>陷阱已在上方布好，我们的力量都缠在丝线上。看着简陋，但威力足够……连神都能制住。<hpage>你们一族对我多次相助，我必将不负所托。<page>那就好，敲钟者，拿出真本事。把那苍白之神引出来，先削弱她，再逼到陷阱上方。<page>触碰陷阱就会激活丝线，但只有你的织针之乐能彻底唤醒术式。时机一到，你自然明白。
translated_text: 你已经走了很长的路，敲钟人！实现愿望，拯救错误，甚至唤醒我不幸的家人采取行动！<page>陷阱就在上面，我们的力量也被它束缚着。这对你来说可能看起来是一件粗鲁的事情，但它具有相当大的力量。足以压制神。<hpage>先生，您和您的家人对我非常好。我将在未来的会议中证明您的信心。<page>是的，带上你最好的东西，敲钟人。呼唤我们伟大的苍白上帝。削弱她的力量，把野兽赶进陷阱。<page>接触会点燃陷阱，但只有你的针的歌声才能完全唤醒咒语。当那一刻到来时，你就会看得清楚。
secondary_translated_text: You have come a long way, bell ringer! Fulfill wishes, save mistakes, and even wake up my unfortunate family to take action!<page>The trap is above it, and our strength is bound by it. This may seem like a rude thing to you, but it has considerable power. Enough to suppress God.<hpage>Sir, you and your family have been very kind to me. I will prove your confidence in future meetings.<page>Yes, bring your best thing, bell ringer. Call on our great pale God. Weaken her power and drive the beast into a trap.<page>Contact ignites the trap, but only the song of your needle can fully awaken the spell. When that moment comes, you will see clearly.

original_en_text: <page>Lady, please. Permit me to look upon your nature, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: <page>女士，请允许我深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: <page>女士，请。请允许我审视你的本性，以便我澄清它。
secondary_translated_text: <page>Ma 'am, please. Please allow me to examine your nature so that I can clarify it.

original_en_text: Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bug’s. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing, worth my long life to behold.<page>If in your travels you are able to further evolve, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>如果旅途中你再度进化，请回来找我。以我的力量，或许可以助你更上一层。<hpage>多谢，伊娃。若我本质确实再度进化，我会回来找你。
translated_text: 令人难以置信的...你的本性与凡人蠕虫的本性是如此不同。你的是可塑性且短暂的。这是一件值得我用漫长的生命去观察的美妙的事情。<page>如果您在旅行中能够取得进一步的进步，请回到我身边。以我的实力，也许可以帮助您进一步。<hpage>谢谢你，伊娃。如果我的本性像你说的那样扩展，我就会回来。
secondary_translated_text: Incredible... Your nature is so different from the nature of mortal worms. Yours is malleable and short-lived. This is a wonderful thing worth observing with my long life.<page>If you can make further progress while traveling, please come back to me. With my strength, I may be able to help you further.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I will come back.

original_en_text: <hpage>I have known your kind before, sir. Yours is a tribe that works and trades in power, and I am about to extinguish its prime source.<hpage>Once this is done, will you truly delight in a land so bereft?<page>Aye, well... My family’s marks are all over that trap. And we’ve spent a hard age avoiding the gaze of our god.<page>If we earned it now, after such open opposition... that’s a bleak conclusion none of us’d care for.<page>Now! My job’s done. S’time your grand business began! We’ll be wishin’ victory to you, bellringer, for all our sakes!
original_zh_text: <hpage>我曾见过你的同族。你们一族专门兜售力量，而我正要掐灭这力量的源头。<hpage>事成之后，这力量真空的世界真能让你们感到高兴？<page>哈……陷阱上现在全是家族徽记，我们也躲那苍白之神半辈子了。<page>要是现在因为公然反抗栽了……这种憋屈结局谁受得了？<page>好了！我活儿干完了。该你大显身手了！敲钟者，你可一定要赢啊，都指望着你呢！
translated_text: <hpage>我以前认识过像您这样的人，先生。你们的部落是一个充满工作和权力讨价还价的部落，我即将消除它的主要根源。<hpage>一旦这件事完成，你真的会为这片失去亲人的土地感到高兴吗？<page>嗯，我家的印记就在那个陷阱上。我们很难避开上帝的凝视。<page>如果我们现在赢了，在如此公众的反对之后.这是一个我们都不关心的惨淡结论。<page>现在！我的工作完成了。是时候开始你宏伟的职业生涯了！对于我们所有人来说，敲钟人，我们祝愿你胜利！
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I've known people like you before, sir. Your tribe is a tribe full of work and power bargaining, and I am about to eliminate its main source.<hpage>Once this is done, will you really be happy for this land of lost loved ones?<page>Well, my home's mark is on that trap. It is difficult to avoid God's gaze.<page>If we win now, after all this public opposition. This is a bleak conclusion that none of us care about.<page>Now! My work is done. It's time to start your grand career! For all of us, bell ringer, we wish you victory!

original_en_text: <hpage>You see one’s nature, Eva? It is a skill far beyond bugs.<page>One not without cost. My sight perceives a bug only through the imprint upon their soul. <hpage>You speak of their crest? That signifier of a bug’s essence and their invisible yoke born through a lifetime.<page>Crest? Yes, the old Weaver term. A simple word to attempt description of something so profound.<page>But wait. Your own nature... Is it?...<page>Lady, permit me to look deeper still, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，你能洞见本质？这等技艺远超虫类。<page>自然是有代价的。我需透过灵魂印记窥视生灵。<hpage>你是指纹章？那象征虫民全部存在与无形枷锁的标记？<page>纹章？对，织者用的古称，试图以简单词汇描述深邃之物。<page>等等，你的本质……莫非……<page>女士，请允许我深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: <hpage>伊娃，你见过一个人的本性吗？这是一项远远超出错误的技能。<page>并非没有成本。我的视力只能通过昆虫灵魂上的印记来感知它们。<hpage>你是在说他们的徽章吗？昆虫本质的象征以及它们在生命中诞生的无形枷锁。<page>佳士得？是的，韦弗的旧术语。用一个简单的词来描述如此深刻的事情。<page>愿意等待自己的本性。真的吗？..<page>女士，请允许我更深入地了解，我可以提供明确的.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Eva, have you ever seen the nature of a person? This is a skill that goes far beyond mistakes.<page>It is not without cost. My vision can only perceive insects through the imprint on their souls.<hpage>Are you talking about their badges? A symbol of the nature of insects and the invisible shackles they are born in life.<page>Christie's? Yes, Weaver's old terminology. Use a simple word to describe something so profound.<page>Willing to wait for your nature. Really?..<page>Ma 'am, please allow me to understand more deeply, and I can provide clarity.

original_en_text: Lady, Pharloom’s time grows short. If you are able to further expand your nature, I urge you return to me.<page>Any power I possess, I shall grant it for your aid.<hpage>My thanks, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 女士，纺络时日无多。若你能进一步突破自身极限，请务必回到我身边。<page>我拥有的任何力量，都将为你所用。<hpage>感激不尽，伊娃。若真如你所言突破极限，我定会回来。
translated_text: 女士，法罗的时间越来越短了。如果你能进一步扩展你的本性，我建议你回到我身边。<page>无论我拥有什么力量，我都会赐予它来帮助你。<hpage>谢谢你，伊娃。如果我的本性像你说的那样扩展，我就会回来。
secondary_translated_text: Ma 'am, Farrow's time is getting shorter and shorter. If you can further expand your nature, I suggest you come back to me.<page>Whatever power I have, I will give it to help you.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I will come back.

original_en_text: Stay back, twisted leech! Even lodged within another’s shell, your ravenous nature shines clear.<page>You shall not defoul this chamber, nor claim my soul. Begone!
original_zh_text: 退后，扭曲的寄生物！即便寄居他者躯壳也藏不住贪婪本性。<page>休想玷污此地，更别妄图吞噬我的灵魂。滚开！
translated_text: 退后，扭曲的韭菜！即使在另一个人的壳里，你贪婪的本性也会清晰地闪耀。<page>你不能摧毁这个房间，也不能夺走我的灵魂。走开！
secondary_translated_text: Stand back, twisted leeks! Even in the shell of another person, your greedy nature shines clearly.<page>You can't destroy this room, or take away my soul. Go away!

original_en_text: Lady... Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bugs. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing. Worth my long life to behold.<page>Unbound one, though we know each other little, permit me to ask a selfish request.<hpage>Your talent has provided a great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 女士……不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>无羁者啊，虽然相交尚浅，但我仍想提出一个自私请求。<hpage>你帮了我很多，伊娃。你想要什么？<page>请您将我的灵魂与记忆缚于您的壳中，就像您其他生物所做的那样。<page>虽然称不上是纹章，但或许能为您献上最后一份微薄馈赠。<hpage>你想被我吞噬？你要知道，那意味着独立意识将不复存在。<page>我明白，但自愿如此。能与无羁者合而为一……是我昔日渴求的解脱，尽管岁月让我几乎遗忘。<page>亲爱的女士，您愿意成全我吗？
translated_text: 夫人...令人难以置信的...你的本性与凡人的昆虫是如此不同。你的是可塑性且短暂的。这是一件令人惊奇的事情。值得我用漫长的生命去欣赏。<page>自由的人们，虽然我们彼此不太了解，但请允许我提出一个自私的请求。<hpage>你的才能给我们带来了巨大的利益，伊娃。你想从我身上得到什么？<page>只是为了拥有我自己的灵魂，我自己的记忆，被束缚在你的壳里……就像你对这些土地上的其他人所做的那样。<page>我不会将其定义为你心灵的徽章，但我的一点点力量仍然可以带来最后的祝福。<hpage>你要求加入？要知道你的思想将不再存在，在任何独立的意义上。<page>与不受约束的人联手。这是我曾经祈祷的逃避，尽管时间的重量几乎让我忘记。<page>女士，您能同意这个请求吗？
secondary_translated_text: Madam... Incredible... Your nature is so different from mortal insects. Yours is malleable and short-lived. This is an amazing thing. Worth my long life to appreciate.<page>Free people, although we don't know each other very well, please allow me to make a selfish request.<hpage>Your talents have brought us great benefits, Eva. What do you want from me?<page>Just to have my own soul, my own memories, bound in your shell... just like you do to other people in these lands.<page>I would not define it as a badge of your soul, but a little bit of my strength can still bring the final blessing.<hpage>You asked to join? Know that your thoughts will no longer exist, in any independent sense.<page>Join forces with people who are not bound. This was the escape I once prayed for, even though the weight of time almost made me forget.<page>Ma 'am, can you agree to this request?

original_en_text: Lady, you are a multitude within a single shell. A being truly unbound. To aid your growth has proved a grand task, even for one as limited as me.<page>As my last act, permit me to ask a final, selfish request.<hpage>Your talents have provided great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>I know. And still I seek it, gladly. To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Dear Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 女士，您这具躯壳中存在万千可能，是真正无拘无束的存在。能助您成长，是我的荣幸。<page>最后，请允许我提出自私的请求。<hpage>你帮了我很多，伊娃。你想要什么？<page>请您将我的灵魂与记忆缚于您的壳中，就像您其他生物所做的那样。<page>虽然称不上是纹章，但或许能为您献上最后一份微薄馈赠。<hpage>你想被我吞噬？你要知道，那意味着独立意识将不复存在。<page>我明白，但自愿如此。能与无羁者合而为一……是我昔日渴求的解脱，尽管岁月让我几乎遗忘。<page>亲爱的女士，您愿意成全我吗？
translated_text: 女士，你是一个壳里有很多人。真正自由的人。事实证明，帮助您成长是一项艰巨的任务，即使对于像我这样有限的人来说也是如此。<page>作为最后一幕，请允许我提出最后一个自私的请求。<hpage>伊娃，你的才华带来了巨大的好处。你想从我身上得到什么？<page>只是为了拥有我自己的灵魂，我自己的记忆，被束缚在你的壳里……就像你对这些土地上的其他人所做的那样。<page>我不会将其定义为你心灵的徽章，但我的一点点力量仍然可以带来最后的祝福。<hpage>你要求加入？要知道你的思想将不再存在，在任何独立的意义上。<page>我知道我仍然很高兴寻求它。与不受约束的人联手。这是我曾经祈祷的逃避，尽管时间的重量几乎让我忘记。<page>亲爱的女士，您能同意这个请求吗？
secondary_translated_text: Ma 'am, you have many people in one shell. A truly free person. Helping you grow has proven to be a daunting task, even for a limited person like me.<page>As the final scene, please allow me to make one last selfish request.<hpage>Eva, your talent has brought great benefits. What do you want from me?<page>Just to have my own soul, my own memories, bound in your shell... just like you do to other people in these lands.<page>I would not define it as a badge of your soul, but a little bit of my strength can still bring the final blessing.<hpage>You asked to join? Know that your thoughts will no longer exist, in any independent sense.<page>I know I am still happy to seek it. Join forces with people who are not bound. This was the escape I once prayed for, even though the weight of time almost made me forget.<page>Dear lady, can you agree to this request?

original_en_text: Who’s there? Has someone come to free me? Or are you here to bring my end? <hpage>I am Hornet, prisoner, only a traveller and not here to slay you.<hpage>What cause sees you caged in these ruins of Weavers past? Were you their enemy?
original_zh_text: 谁在那儿？是来解救我的？还是来取我性命的？<hpage>我名为大黄蜂，只是一名旅者，无意取你性命。<hpage>你为何被囚于织者遗迹？你曾是他们的敌人？
translated_text: 谁在那里？有人来救我了吗？还是你来终结我<hpage>我是一只大黄蜂，一个囚犯，只是一个旅行者，不是来杀你的。<hpage>是什么把你关在韦弗的废墟里？你是他们的敌人吗？
secondary_translated_text: Who is there? Has someone come to save me? Or are you gonna end me?<hpage>I am a bumblebee, a prisoner, just a traveler, not here to kill you.<hpage>What kept you in the ruins of Weaver? Are you their enemy?

original_en_text: Lady, my senses resound. You have grown further beyond the bounds of a bug.<page>Permit me to gaze again upon your nature, that I may offer clarity.
original_zh_text: 女士，我的感知在震颤。你已远超凡虫界限。<page>请允许我再次深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: 女士，我的感官回响。你的成长超越了错误的界限。<page>请允许我再次审视你的本性，我可以给出明确的答案。
secondary_translated_text: Ma 'am, my senses echo. Your growth transcends the wrong boundaries.<page>Please allow me to examine your nature again, and I can give a clear answer.

original_en_text: <hpage>How did you come to be sealed here, Eva? <page>Lady, you mistake. What seems a cage is as much my shell as the form inside.<page>I was born within this space. To leave would be my death, an uninspired end, though one I’ve sometimes wished would come.<page>I am unique, you see. My mothers shared the curse of their tribe, to conceive a child is a painful, near impossible task. <hpage>I know the curse well, Eva, for I am also its victim, and spawn of one who managed to overcome its limits. <hpage>Are you too an attempt to defy that cruel constraint?<page>A flawed attempt. A life spun from rune and shell, sustained only by its cage. My thoughts may mimic a Weavers, but my senses are my own.<page>Over time, that difference brought only distance between us.
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，你为何会被困在这里？<page>女士误会了。这囚笼也是我的躯壳，与其中的形体并无差异。<page>我诞生于这里，离开意味着消亡，虽然有时也渴求这平淡结局。<page>我很特殊，母亲们承受着族群诅咒，生育子嗣近乎不可能。<hpage>我很了解这诅咒，伊娃。因为我也是受害者，更是突破禁忌的产物。<hpage>想必你也是对抗这残酷枷锁的尝试？<page>是失败的尝试。符文与甲壳铸就的生命，只能靠囚笼维系。我虽能模仿织者，但终究不是织者。<page>久而久之，这份差异使我们渐行渐远。
translated_text: <hpage>伊娃，你是怎么被封印在这里的？<page>女士，你错了。看起来像笼子的东西既是我的外壳，也是里面的形体。<page>我出生在这个空间。离开将是我的死亡，一个毫无灵感的结局，尽管有时我希望它会到来。<page>我是独一无二的，你看。我的母亲和她的部落一样诅咒怀孕是一项痛苦的、几乎不可能的任务。<hpage>我很了解这个诅咒，伊娃，因为我也是它的受害者，也是一个设法克服它的限制的人的后代。<hpage>你是否也在试图反抗这种残酷的限制？<page>一次有缺陷的尝试。一个由符文和贝壳组成的生命，只能靠笼子来维持。我的思想可能模仿织布工，但我的感情却是我自己的。<page>随着时间的推移，这种差异只会拉近我们之间的距离。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Eva, how did you get sealed here?<page>Ma 'am, you are wrong. What looks like a cage is both my outer shell and the shape inside.<page>I was born in this space. Leaving would be my death, an uninspired ending, although sometimes I wish it would come.<page>I am unique, you see. My mother, like her tribe, cursed that pregnancy was a painful and almost impossible task.<hpage>I know this curse well, Eva, because I was also a victim of it and the descendant of a man who managed to overcome its limitations.<hpage>Are you also trying to resist this cruel restriction?<page>A flawed attempt. A life composed of runes and shells can only be maintained by cages. My thoughts may imitate the weaver, but my feelings are my own.<page>Over time, this difference will only bring us closer.

original_en_text: By your grace, I am at last broken from my fate.<hpage>Gladly I accept your union, Eva. No longer shall you suffer eternity alone.
original_zh_text: 蒙您恩典，我终于能挣脱宿命。<hpage>我欣然接受与你的联结，伊娃。你不必再承受永恒的孤寂。
translated_text: 感谢您的恩典，我终于摆脱了命运。<hpage>我很高兴接受你的婚姻，伊娃。你将不再独自忍受永恒。
secondary_translated_text: Thank you for your grace, I have finally escaped my destiny.<hpage>I'm happy to accept your marriage, Eva. You will no longer endure eternity alone.

original_en_text: Come no closer! I sense the forbidden blood coursing through you, that which grows and reshapes the world in its own vulgar image.<page>Whether it was imbibed willingly or not, none shall be allowed into this chamber while so afflicted. Begone!
original_zh_text: 站住！我能感知到你体内流淌的禁忌之血，那以粗鄙之形生长并重塑世界的秽物。<page>无论你是否自愿沾染此血，凡受其侵蚀者皆不得踏入这里。速速离开！
translated_text: 走开！我感觉到禁忌的血液流经你的身体，它以粗俗的形象成长并重塑了世界。<page>无论是自愿还是非自愿，在这种痛苦期间，任何人都不允许进入这个房间。走开！
secondary_translated_text: Go away! I feel the blood of taboo flowing through your body, it grows in a vulgar image and reshapes the world.<page>Whether voluntarily or involuntarily, no one is allowed to enter this room during this painful period. Go away!

original_en_text: Lady, if in your travels you are able to further expand your nature, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>If my nature expands as you say, Eva, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 女士，如果你的本质再度进化，请回来找我。以我的力量，或许能助你更上一层。<hpage>若我本质确实再度进化，我会回来找你。
translated_text: 女士，如果您在旅行中能够进一步拓展本性，请回到我身边。以我的实力，也许可以进一步帮助您。<hpage>伊娃，如果我的本性像你说的那样扩展，我就会回来。
secondary_translated_text: Ma 'am, if you can further expand your nature while traveling, please come back to me. With my strength, I may be able to help you further.<hpage>Eva, if my nature expands as you say, I will come back.

original_en_text: Lady, would you think again upon my last request? To be bound amidst your shimmering soul?<page>I understand it is a selfish thing to ask, and I will hold no ill will if you reject.
original_zh_text: 女士，可愿重新考虑我的请求？让我融入你璀璨魂灵？<page>我明白这是个自私的请求，若您拒绝我也绝无怨言。
translated_text: 女士，您能重新考虑我最后的请求吗？被困在你闪亮的灵魂里？<page>我明白这是一件自私的事情，如果你拒绝，我不会怀有恶意。
secondary_translated_text: Ma 'am, could you reconsider my final request? Trapped in your shining soul?<page>I understand that this is a selfish thing to do, and if you refuse, I will not harbor ill intentions.

original_en_text: <hpage>I am sorry, Eva. I cannot grant you this. At least, not yet.<hpage>Yours is a mind strong and strange. That union could prove dangerous to my identity.<page>I understand, Lady. I will be here, if ever you reconsider.
original_zh_text: <hpage>抱歉，伊娃。我不能答应你，至少现在不行。<hpage>你的心智强大而奇异，联结恐怕会危及我的存在。<page>我明白，女士。希望您能改变心意，我会永远在此等候。
translated_text: <hpage>对不起伊娃我不能向你保证这一点。至少，还没有。<hpage>你的思想很强大而且很奇怪。这个结合可能会对我的身份构成危险。<page>我明白，女士。如果你重新考虑，我会在这里。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I'm sorry Eva, I can't promise you that. At least, not yet.<hpage>Your mind is powerful and strange. This union could pose a danger to my identity.<page>I understand, ma 'am. If you reconsider, I'll be here.

original_en_text: Thank you for playing the demo.
original_zh_text: 试玩版体验结束，感谢您的游玩！
secondary_translated_text: Thank you for playing the presentation.

original_en_text: They see your peace, woven of faith and toil,
original_zh_text: 赞美你以信仰与劳役编织的片刻安宁，
translated_text: 他们看到你们的和平是由信仰和努力编织的，
secondary_translated_text: They see that your peace is woven by faith and hard work,

original_en_text: use of a controller is highly recommended
original_zh_text: 强烈建议使用游戏手柄

original_en_text: - From ‘Pharloom’s Folly’ by the Conductor Romino
original_zh_text: ——摘自《纺络谬世录》 指挥家罗米诺 著
translated_text: - 摘自指挥家罗米诺的《法罗的愚蠢》

original_en_text: They forget your heart, bound in slumber and servitude,
original_zh_text: 谁又记得你沉睡于桎梏中的野兽之心？
translated_text: 他们忘记了你的心，被束缚在睡眠和奴役中，
secondary_translated_text: They forget your heart, are bound to sleep and slavery,

original_en_text: They see your beauty, so frail and fine,
original_zh_text: 虫豸皆敬仰你纤弱的神迹之美，
translated_text: 他们看到了你的美丽，如此脆弱和美丽，
secondary_translated_text: They see your beauty, so fragile and beautiful,

original_en_text: When you wake they shall see your truth,
original_zh_text: 待你醒来，挣裂千丝缠茧——
translated_text: 当你醒来时，他们会看到你的真相，
secondary_translated_text: When you wake up, they will see the truth about you,

original_en_text: A beast’s nature bare to all.
translated_text: 野兽的本性对每个人来说都是赤裸裸的。
secondary_translated_text: The nature of the beast is naked to everyone.

original_en_text: Lift your voices. Know our grace.
translated_text: 提高你的声音。了解我们的恩典。
secondary_translated_text: Raise your voice. Understand our grace.

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 纺络的虫民，你们已被选中，<br>愿圣堡的鎏金淬硬你们的软壳。<page>作为审判官永远伫立，使罪孽之徒永不得踏入圣殿。
translated_text: 一种出生于法鲁的细菌。你被选中了。<br>愿我们城堡神圣的镀金使您柔软的外壳变得坚硬。<page>作为我们永恒的仲裁者，任何罪恶的昆虫都不会踏足我们的神圣殿堂。
secondary_translated_text: A bacterium born in Faro. You were chosen.<br>May the sacred gilding of our castle harden your soft shell.<page>As our eternal arbiter, no evil insect will set foot in our sacred halls.

original_en_text: A rune-scroll depicting void given form.
original_zh_text: 描绘虚空化形的符文卷轴
secondary_translated_text: A rune scroll depicting the void.

original_en_text: Sisters, spiders, watch these waters flow,<br>Cleansing, Binding, as Silk from shell,<br>Memories of our kingdom calm.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，观此净水长流。<br>涤荡，缠缚，如壳中抽丝，<br>抚平王国的记忆褶皱。
translated_text: 姐妹们，蜘蛛们，看着水流，<br>干净，束缚，就像从壳里取出的丝绸一样，<br>我们王国的记忆是平静的。
secondary_translated_text: Sisters, spiders, look at the water,<br>Clean, bound, like silk taken out of a shell,<br>The memories of our kingdom are peaceful.

original_en_text: At the seventh bell toll, send:<br>Thirty measures, four beats Smokerock,<br>Eight beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>At the ninth bell toll, send:<br>Twenty measures, two beats Smokerock,<br>Seven beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 七钟响时运送：<br>三十节又四奏烟岩，<br>及八奏甜熔渣。<br>全体劳工需示忠诚。<page>九钟响时运送：<br>二十节又两奏烟岩，<br>及七奏甜熔渣。<br>全体劳工需示忠诚。<page>
translated_text: 第七击，发送：<br>三十项措施，四项击败了斯莫克洛克，<br>殴打勒八次，<br>所有工人忠诚的象征。<page>第九击时，发送：<br>二十项措施，两项击败了斯莫克洛克，<br>七人击败甜西瓜，<br>所有工人忠诚的象征。<page>
secondary_translated_text: Seventh strike, send:<br>Thirty measures, four defeated Smoklock,<br>Beating strangler eight times,<br>A symbol of loyalty for all workers.<page>During the ninth strike, send:<br>Twenty measures, two defeated Smoklock,<br>Seven people defeated Sweet Watermelon,<br>A symbol of loyalty for all workers.<page>

original_en_text: When three fonts weep, our sacred shrine shall rise.
original_zh_text: 三眼泪泉涌流，圣坛自当升起。
translated_text: 当三个字哭泣时，我们的神圣寺庙就会升起。
secondary_translated_text: When three words cry, our sacred temple will rise.

original_en_text: Damned are we! The lingered few bound still to suffer. Cursed thrice by Pharloom, to wait, to watch, to cry our anguish.<page>No more! We say! No more! We cry! We all have wailed and wept. Fair Pharloom’s fall has come at last. Its end we now accept.
original_zh_text: 万众受难！幸存者仍受折磨。纺络三度诅咒加身——苦候，守望，哀哭不休，<page>到此为止！我在此宣言！到此为止！我在此高呼！我们已流尽血泪。荣光纺络终将陨落，我们应接受终局。
translated_text: 我们该死！剩下的少数人仍然注定要受苦。被法鲁诅咒了三次，等待着，看着，为我们的痛苦哭泣。<page>不再！我们谈谈吧！不再！我们哭了！我们都哭了又哭。Fair Pharloom的垮台终于到来了。我们现在接受它的结局。
secondary_translated_text: We deserve to die! The few remaining are still doomed to suffer. Cursed three times by Faro, waiting, watching, crying for our pain.<page>No more! Let's talk! No more! We cried! We all cried and cried. Fair Pharloom's downfall has finally arrived. We now accept its ending.

original_en_text: Litany of the Worker<br>May we catch the dregs and never tire,<br>May we clean the dregs and never hunger,<br>May we spool the dregs and never falter.
original_zh_text: 劳工祷词<br>愿我们滤渣不倦。<br>愿我们清秽不饥。<br>愿我们纺线不怠。
translated_text: 工人的持续阅读<br>愿我们抓住糟粕永不厌倦，<br>愿我们除去渣滓，永不挨饿，<br>愿我们卷起糟粕，永不动摇。
secondary_translated_text: Continuous reading by workers<br>May we seize the dross and never get tired of it,<br>May we get rid of the dregs and never starve,<br>May we roll up the dross and never waver.

original_en_text: Oath of the Whiteward<br>While song must be sung, none may falter.<br>Infirmity. Sickness. Death.<br>All are banished from our Citadel.
original_zh_text: 白愈厅誓言<br>歌不可辍，虫不可怠。<br>孱弱、病痛、死亡——皆逐出圣堡。
translated_text: 白色誓言<br>歌曲必须唱，但任何人都不能动摇。<br>弱.疾病死亡<br>所有人都被赶出了我们的城堡。
secondary_translated_text: White oath<br>Songs must be sung, but no one can waver.<br>weak. disease death<br>Everyone was kicked out of our castle.

original_en_text: Penitent, Fourth of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sins of infirmity, sickness.<br>Penance by swallowing.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Twelfth of the First.<br>Guilty of an unnamed sin.<br>Penance by casting.<br>Absolution not granted.
original_zh_text: 罪者，第四组第四号。<br>犯孱弱、病痛之罪。<br>处以吞刑。<br>死后得赦。<page>罪人，第一组第十二号。<br>犯未名之罪。<br>处以流放。<br>不予赦免。
translated_text: 忏悔者，第四。<br>因软弱和疾病而有罪。<br>通过吞咽来认罪。<br>死后获得赦免。<page>忏悔者，第十二。<br>发生了一起未透露姓名的犯罪行为。<br>通过选角认罪。<br>没有赦免。
secondary_translated_text: Confessor, fourth.<br>Guilty due to weakness and disease.<br>Confession by swallowing.<br>Received pardon after death.<page>Confessor, twelfth.<br>An unnamed criminal act occurred.<br>Pledge guilty through casting.<br>There is no pardon.

original_en_text: Penitent, Eighth of the Twelfth.<br>Guilty of the sin of irreverence.<br>Penance by chaining.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Second of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sin of dissonance.<br>Penance by silencing.<br>Absolution granted after death.
original_zh_text: 罪者，第十二组第八号。<br>犯不敬之罪。<br>处以锁刑。<br>死后得赦。<page>罪者，第四组第二号。<br>犯杂音之罪。<br>处以禁言。<br>死后得赦。
translated_text: 忏悔者，12月8日。<br>犯了不尊重他人的罪行。<br>用链子表白。<br>死后获得赦免。<page>忏悔者，第4节第2节。<br>犯了不和谐罪。<br>通过沉默认罪。<br>死后获得赦免。
secondary_translated_text: Confessor, December 8.<br>Commit the crime of disrespecting others.<br>Use a chain to confess.<br>Received pardon after death.<page>Confessor, verse 4, verse 2.<br>committed the crime of disharmony.<br>Confession through silence.<br>Received pardon after death.

original_en_text: Remains of a Muckroach crushed by falling rock.
original_zh_text: 蟑螂被落石碾压后的残渣。
translated_text: 一只蟑螂的遗骸被落石压碎。
secondary_translated_text: The remains of a cockroach were crushed by falling rocks.

original_en_text: Anguished Aura<br>Eight masks hard, swirled soul enraged.<br>Twelve aknids flat, all juices strained.<page>Six pilgrims living, hung long to drain.
original_zh_text: 苦痛灵氛<br>八具硬质旋魂怒面。<br>十二只阿克尼，榨尽汁液。<page>六名活祭朝圣者，悬吊沥干。
translated_text: 痛苦的光环<br>八个面具坚硬，灵魂愤怒。<br>将十二个aknids压平，所有的汁液都过滤。<page>六名朝圣者还活着，等待着被榨干。
secondary_translated_text: The aura of pain<br>The eight masks are hard and the soul is angry.<br>Press the twelve aknids flat and strain all the juice.<page>Six pilgrims are still alive, waiting to be drained dry.

original_en_text: A white lock bearing a surgical symbol.
original_zh_text: 带有外科标志的苍白锁具。
translated_text: 一把白色锁，上面有手术标记。
secondary_translated_text: A white lock with surgical markings on it.

translated_text: 描绘最多织造织物的符号。
secondary_translated_text: Symbol depicting the most woven fabrics.

original_en_text: Their shells are ours. Their souls are ours.<br>Our hate is forever.
original_zh_text: 他们的躯壳是我们的，他们的灵魂是我们的。<br>我们的恨意永世不灭。
translated_text: 他们的壳是我们的。他们的灵魂是我们的。<br>我们的仇恨是永恒的。
secondary_translated_text: Their shells are ours. Their souls are ours.<br>Our hatred is eternal.

original_en_text: Containment fails. Memory lost. Excise outer. Maintain inner.<br>Shellwood stasis sustained - Remember.<br>Marrowlands stasis critical - Remember.<br>Verdanian environment exceeded - Destined to forget.
original_zh_text: 封存溃败。记忆遗失。切除外区。维持内区。<br>甲木林封存稳定——须铭记。<br>髓骨地封存危急——须铭记。<br>翠庭生态失控——注定遗忘。
translated_text: 遏制失败。记忆丧失。去掉外部。呆在里面。<br>壳木滞续记。<br>严重的骨髓骤停-记住。<br>超越令人眼花缭乱的环境-注定会忘记。
secondary_translated_text: Containment failure. Memory loss. Remove the exterior. Stay inside.<br>Continuation of the stagnation of shells and trees.<br>Severe bone marrow arrest-remember.<br>Beyond the dazzling environment-destined to forget.

original_en_text: Here is established, by holy consent of the Conductors,<br>The Memorium of Pharloom.<br><br>What Is Remembered Is Never Lost.
original_zh_text: 经指挥家神圣授权，<br>于此建立纺络忆廊。<br><br>铭记者永存不灭。
translated_text: 在这里，经过售票员的神圣同意，<br>法鲁姆纪念馆<br><br>你记住的永远不会丢失。
secondary_translated_text: Here, with the sacred consent of the conductor,<br>Farum Memorial Hall<br><br>What you remember will never be lost.

original_en_text: A rune depicting paths away from Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 描绘离开纺络通路的符文。
translated_text: 描绘离开法鲁之路的符文。
secondary_translated_text: Runes depicting the road out of Faro.

original_en_text: Due to unacceptably high injury and unsanctioned deaths, Ventrica travel shall henceforth be denied to all.<br> For Pharloom eternal, a bug who serves must never die.
original_zh_text: 鉴于伤亡过甚并且非授命死亡，即日起禁止所有虫民使用圣脉枢管。<br>永恒纺络需要活着的仆从。
translated_text: 由于受伤人数和未经授权的死亡人数高得令人无法接受，此后所有人都将被拒绝前往马达加斯加。<br>对于Faro来说，永恒的服务错误永远不会消失。
secondary_translated_text: Because the number of injuries and unauthorized deaths is unacceptably high, everyone will be refused travel to Madagascar thereafter.<br>For Faro, eternal service errors will never go away.

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Spare a song for those who lay here silent.<br>By strength abandoned, they fell before the final ascent.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>为长眠于此的无声者歌一曲罢。<br>力竭而堕，未竟登攀。
translated_text: 朝圣者<br>为那些静静躺在这里的人留下一首歌。<br>失去力量，他们在最后一次攀登之前摔倒了。
secondary_translated_text: pilgrims<br>Leave a song for those lying here quietly.<br>Losing strength, they fell before making their final climb.

original_en_text: <hpage>I understand now... The steel child’s servant grew bold...<hpage>I know what the fleeing bug seeks to call, and their etchings here suggest clear clues to where. <hpage>What they attempt is dangerous, stupid. It can only end badly. I must hurry if I’m to stop this.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我现在明白了……钢铁之子的手下越来越大胆……<hpage>也知道那只逃亡的虫子想召唤什么，这些刻痕明确指出了地点。<hpage>愚蠢又危险的做法，不会有好下场。得赶紧阻止。
translated_text: <hpage>我现在明白了。钢铁男孩的仆人变得大胆起来……<hpage>我知道逃跑的虫子想叫什么，它们在这里的蚀刻提供了明确的线索。<hpage>他们的企图是危险且愚蠢的。结果只会很糟糕。如果我要阻止这一切，我就必须快点。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I understand now. Steel Boy's servant became bold...<hpage>I know what the escaping bugs want to call, and their etching here provides a clear clue.<hpage>Their attempts are dangerous and foolish. The results will only be bad. If I'm going to stop this, I have to hurry.

original_en_text: An old rune displaying the design for a Weaver weapon.
original_zh_text: 残破的织者武器设计图。
translated_text: 一个古老的符文，显示了织布者武器的设计。
secondary_translated_text: An ancient rune showing the design of the weaver's weapon.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, sat between salt and stone,<br>Build those tools of brilliant mind imagined,<br>Aid us when our Silk has waned.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，坐于盐石之间，<br>铸造智械奇器，<br>助我们于灵丝枯竭之时。
translated_text: 蜘蛛妹妹坐在盐和石头之间，<br>为了建造想象大脑的工具，<br>当我们的丝绸衰落时，请帮助我们。
secondary_translated_text: Sister Spider sat between salt and stone,<br>To build tools for imaginary brains,<br>Please help us when our silk declines.

original_en_text: An old stone gate with a simple keyhole.
original_zh_text: 带有简易锁孔的古石门。
translated_text: 一扇古老的石门，上面有一个简单的钥匙孔。
secondary_translated_text: An ancient stone door with a simple keyhole on it.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to branch,<br>Watch over these bugs, passing safe,<br>Warded by fear,<br>No longer your meal.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，缚枝之壳，<br>庇佑这些过客安然。<br>以恐惧为甲，<br>不再化作食粮。
translated_text: 姐妹，蜘蛛，绑在树枝上的贝壳，<br>注意这些虫子，安全通过，<br>以恐惧来守护，<br>它不再是你的食物。
secondary_translated_text: Sisters, spiders, shells tied to branches,<br>Pay attention to these bugs, pass safely,<br>Guard with fear,<br>It is no longer your food.

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall ever step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 纺络的虫民，你们已被选中，<br>愿圣堡的鎏金淬硬你们的软壳。<page>作为审判官永远伫立，使罪孽之徒永不得踏入圣殿。
translated_text: 一种出生于法鲁的细菌。你被选中了。<br>愿我们城堡神圣的镀金使您柔软的外壳变得坚硬。<page>作为我们的仲裁者，我们将永远站在我们神圣的寺庙没有任何昆虫与罪。
secondary_translated_text: A bacterium born in Faro. You were chosen.<br>May the sacred gilding of our castle harden your soft shell.<page>As our arbiters, we will always stand in our sacred temple without any insects or sin.

original_en_text: I have departed to pay my respects at the graves within the great wood.<br>- Pinmaster Plinney
original_zh_text: 我去密林深处的墓园祭拜先灵<br>——针匠普林尼
translated_text: 我已经出发去拜祭森林中的坟墓了。<br>- 品马斯特·普林尼
secondary_translated_text: I have set off to pay homage to the tomb in the forest.<br>- Pinmaster Pliny

original_en_text: Penitent, First of the First.<br>Guilty of the sin of apostasy.<br>Penance by constriction.<br>Absolution denied.
original_zh_text: 罪人，第一组第一号。<br>犯背信之罪。<br>处以束刑。<br>永不赦免。
translated_text: 忏悔者，第一。<br>不服从罪。<br>承认有局限性。<br>赦免被拒绝。
secondary_translated_text: Confessor, first.<br>Crime of disobedience.<br>Acknowledging limitations.<br>Pardon was denied.

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, frail with age.<br>Tracked and taken in Sandsea Waste.<br>Seven Choristors, nine Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第八代织者，末裔，年迈体衰。<br>于沙海荒原追捕擒获。<br>折损七名圣咏使徒，九名特使。
translated_text: 在第八部分中，韦弗是他们家庭的最后一个成员，随着年龄的增长，他的身体变得越来越虚弱。<br>沙溪荒原追踪拍摄。<br>七戒九特使因使命而失败。
secondary_translated_text: In Part Eight, Weaver is the last member of their family, and his body becomes increasingly frail as he gets older.<br>Tracking and filming of Shaxi Wilderness.<br>The seven precepts and nine envoys failed because of their mission.

original_en_text: Cloth and materials that could be fashioned into additional pockets.
original_zh_text: 可缝制附加口袋的布料。
translated_text: 可以制成额外口袋的面料和材料。
secondary_translated_text: Fabrics and materials that can be made into additional pockets.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to moss,<br>Watch over these bugs born low,<br>Raised up by fervour fostered,<br>Born and caught within our web unknowing.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，缚苔之壳。<br>庇佑这些卑微生物。<br>养育于狂热之中，<br>生于罗网而不自知。
translated_text: 姐妹，蜘蛛，束缚在苔藓上的贝壳，<br>注意这些卑微的昆虫，<br>在热情中长大，<br>不知不觉中诞生并被困在我们的网络中。
secondary_translated_text: Sisters, spiders, shells bound to moss,<br>Pay attention to these humble insects,<br>Growing up with enthusiasm,<br>Unconsciously born and trapped in our network.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, if seeking commune with the creature atop this mount, take the climb above as test, a challenge beyond even our setting.<page>Upon that summit gained, and creature hailed, know it shall choose what gift to grant, with death as likely as insight.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，若欲觐见此山巅之物，须攀登试炼之径，其险犹胜我等所设。<page>登顶谒见之时，须知其所赐或为顿悟，或为死期。
translated_text: 姐姐，蜘蛛，如果你们想和这座山上的生物交流，请用攀爬上面的生物作为测试。这是一个超越我们环境的挑战。<page>当它达到顶峰，生物受到欢呼，知道它会选择给予什么礼物时，死亡就像洞察一样可能。
secondary_translated_text: Sister, spiders, if you want to communicate with the creatures on this mountain, please use the creatures climbing on it as a test. This is a challenge that transcends our environment.<page>When it reaches its peak and the creature is cheered and knows what gift it will choose to give, death is as possible as insight.

original_en_text: Hate for their light. Hate for their pins. For their waste poured thick and endless.<page>Fill your hearts with hate, for power has now been claimed, and with it we shall punish.
original_zh_text: 憎其光辉，恨其刺针。怒其秽流无尽<br>以恨意填膺，因权柄已夺，吾等将施以惩戒。
translated_text: 我讨厌他们的光。我讨厌他们的别针。因为他们的粪便不断涌出。<page>让仇恨充满你们的心中，因为权力现在已经被剥夺了，我们将用它来惩罚。
secondary_translated_text: I hate their light. I hate their pins. Because their feces keep gushing out.<page>Let hatred fill your hearts, for power is now taken away and we will use it to punish.

original_en_text: Here we honour the seed that sprung the wood. <page>By her grace may all bugs pass safe to join us and our song.
original_zh_text: 此地敬奉孕育森林的种子。<page>承其恩泽，万虫皆可安然穿行，共奏圣歌。
translated_text: 在这里，我们向发芽的种子致敬。<page>感谢她的恩典，愿所有虫子安全返回并加入我们和我们的歌曲。
secondary_translated_text: Here, we pay tribute to the sprouting seeds.<page>Thank you for her grace and may all bugs return safely and join us and our songs.
A hardened outcrop of volcanic rock.

original_en_text: Daughter of a distant land...<br>We who remained have waited long...<br>Bind our strength to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our haunted kingdom...
original_zh_text: 远疆之女啊……<br>我们残存者久候……<br>愿以残力附汝身……<br>夺回这缠魂国度的未来……
translated_text: 遥远土地的女儿。<br>我们这些留下来的人已经等了很长时间了..<br>将我们的力量与您的力量结合起来。<br>夺回我们闹鬼王国的未来...
secondary_translated_text: Daughter of a distant land.<br>Those of us who have stayed have been waiting for a long time..<br>Combine our strength with yours.<br>Retake the future of our haunted kingdom...

original_en_text: If the haunted continue their work, leave them be! Only those who frustrate production shall be removed.
original_zh_text: 受丝咒侵蚀者若仍旧劳作，勿扰！唯怠工者当除。
translated_text: 如果闹鬼的人继续工作，就让他们走吧！只有那些阻碍生产的人才能被淘汰。
secondary_translated_text: If the haunted people keep working, let them go! Only those who hinder production can be eliminated.

original_en_text: An inert automaton with an empty chest.
original_zh_text: 胸腔空置的休眠自动机。
translated_text: 空盒子里的闲置自动机。
secondary_translated_text: Idle automaton in an empty box.

original_en_text: On the eighth harvest, send:<br>Fifty measures, nine beats dregthread, spooled,<br>Fourteen measures dregthread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>On the twelfth harvest, send:<br>Forty measures dregthread, spooled,<br>Two beats fine thread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 第八次收成时运送：<br>五十节又九奏卷线渣，<br>十四节编线渣。<br>全体劳工需立忠誓。<page>第十二次收成时运送：<br>四十节卷线渣，<br>两奏精编丝线。<br>全体劳工需立忠誓。<page>
translated_text: 在第八次收获时，发送：<br>五十小节，九拍dregthread，蜿蜒，<br>十四项措施dregthread、tem、<br>所有工人都宣誓忠诚。<page>在第十二个收获季节，发送：<br>40措施线程，线轴，<br>两拍细线，<br>所有工人都宣誓忠诚。<page>
secondary_translated_text: At the eighth harvest, send:<br>Fifty bars, nine beats dregthread<br>Fourteen measures dregthread, tem,<br>All workers swore an oath of loyalty.<page>During the twelfth harvest season, send:<br>40 measures threads, spools,<br>Two beats of thin lines,<br>All workers swore an oath of loyalty.<page>

original_en_text: In the air. The water. Everywhere.<br>Inside their shells. Twisted inside. Guts.<page>Tightest around heart. Pulsing rhythm.<br>Sick. Alive. Dead?<br>Something worse.<page>Deeper. Must look deeper.
original_zh_text: 空气中，水流中，无处不在。<br>甲壳内，脏器间，扭曲盘踞。<page>紧缚心脏，搏动如歌。<br>病态，鲜活，死寂？<br>某种更糟的存在。<page>需深究……再深究……
translated_text: 空气中到处都是水<br>在它们的壳里。内部是扭曲的。勇气.<page>心脏周围有蒂华纳。脉动的节奏。<br>是病了还是死了？<br>更糟糕的事情。<page>必须进行深入研究。
secondary_translated_text: There is water everywhere in the air<br>In their shells. The inside is distorted. courage.<page>There is Tijuana around the heart. Pulsing rhythm.<br>Is he sick or dead?<br>Something worse.<page>In-depth research is necessary.

original_en_text: A bucket overflowing with smouldering Flintstone.
secondary_translated_text: A bucket of Flint primitive people

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>This settlement welcomes all who step the holy path.<br>May you ease your shell within, that your strength renewed can carry you higher.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>此镇欢迎任何踏入圣途者。<br>愿您在此养精蓄锐，登攀更高处。
translated_text: 朝圣者<br>该解决方案欢迎所有踏上神圣道路的人。<br>愿你放松你的内心，你更新的力量可以让你走得更高。
secondary_translated_text: pilgrims<br>The solution welcomes all who embark on the sacred path.<br>May you relax your heart, and your renewed power can allow you to go higher.

original_en_text: Weaver of Pharloom.<br>By grace you warded. By thread you healed.<br>For your favour, eternal, we offer our song.
original_zh_text: 纺络的织者啊<br>您以恩赐庇护，以丝线疗愈。我们献永恒之歌，报答您的垂青。
translated_text: 法鲁的编织者。<br>上帝保佑你通过这条线，你就被治愈了。<br>为了您的青睐和永恒，我们献上我们的歌曲。
secondary_translated_text: Faro's Weaver.<br>God bless you to cross this thread and you will be cured.<br>For your favor and eternity, we present our songs.

original_en_text: A crude map of the Underworks.

O, great land whose flame doth falter!<br>Whose choir, conductors, all doth fail,<page>Observe! Take heart! That spark still burning,<br>Yon butterfly of crimson grace,<page>All bells shall peal, and voices raise,<br>When brave Trobbio steps, at last, upon the stage!
original_zh_text: 啊，辽阔疆土，其焰渐熄！<br>圣咏团与指挥皆已倾颓。<page>且看！且振作！星火犹存——<br>那优雅的绯红蝶影，<page>万钟齐鸣，众声高亢。<br>待勇者特罗比奥终登台！
translated_text: 啊，伟大的土地，它的火焰正在颤抖！<br>他们的合唱团和指挥失败了，<page>观察！振作起来！火花仍在燃烧，<br>深红色优雅的蝴蝶，<page>所有的钟声都会响起，所有的声音都会响起，<br>当勇敢的特罗比奥终于登上舞台！
secondary_translated_text: O great land, its flames are trembling!<br>Their choir and conductor failed,<page>Observe! Cheer up! Sparks are still burning,<br>Dark red elegant butterfly,<page>All the bells will ring, all the sounds will ring,<br>When the brave Trobio finally took the stage!

original_en_text: Erase our fear,<br>Eliminate our desire,<page>To suffer no more,<br>Void, cleanse us.
original_zh_text: 抹除恐惧，<br>涤净欲念，<page>苦难终止，<br>虚空啊，净化吾等。
translated_text: 恐惧加剧，<br>消除我们的欲望，<page>停止受苦，<br>虚空净化我们。
secondary_translated_text: Fear intensifies,<br>Eliminate our desires,<page>Stop suffering,<br>The void purifies us.

original_en_text: I have departed to scale Pharloom’s frigid mount. If any bug exists brave enough to match my pin’s fatal resolve, then climb and face me upon its stormward side.<br>- Pinstress
original_zh_text: 我将攀登纺络寒峰。若有虫愿意成全遗志，持针之决意者，请至风暴面峰顶相会。<br>——针姬
translated_text: 我已出发攀登法鲁寒冷的山峰。如果有任何虫子勇敢地匹配我别针的致命决心，那么就爬到风暴的一侧面对我。<br>- 公主
secondary_translated_text: I have set out to climb the cold peaks of Faro. If any bug bravely matches my pin's fatal determination, then climb to the side of the storm and face me.<br>- Princess

original_en_text: Flickering Flame<br>Five masks swirled soul, brought and broiled.<br>Four stones rage-baked, crushed powder coarse.<page>Three shells fresh from pilgrims fallen, to contain and age.
original_zh_text: 摇曳焰方<br>五具旋魂面甲，炙烤研磨。<br>四枚怒火焙石，碾作粗粉。<page>三副朝圣鲜壳，用以封存陈化。
translated_text: 闪烁火焰<br>五个面具旋转灵魂，带来并烘烤。<br>烘烤四块石头，将粗粉压碎。<page>三枚刚刚从朝圣者手中掉落的炮弹正在进行封存和老化。
secondary_translated_text: flickering flame<br>Five masks spin the soul, bring and bake.<br>Bake four stones and crush the coarse powder.<page>Three shells that had just fallen from the hands of the pilgrims are being sealed and aged.

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, mortally wounded.<br>Tracked and taken in the Blackbarrens.<br>Four Choristors, one Reed lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第八代织者，末裔，重伤濒死。<br>于黑荒原追捕擒获。<br>折损四名圣咏者，一名战士。
translated_text: 韦弗在第八局中在球队中排名垫底，他受了致命伤。<br>在黑荒原追踪和拍摄。<br>四名指挥官，其中一名里德因执行任务而丧生。
secondary_translated_text: Weaver, who finished at the bottom of the team in the eighth inning, suffered a fatal injury.<br>Tracking and filming in the Black Moor.<br>Four commanders, one of whom Reid was killed in the line of duty.

original_en_text: A machine displaying a model of the Citadel.
original_zh_text: 展示圣堡结构的机械模型。
secondary_translated_text: A machine that displays a model of the castle.

original_en_text: <hpage>The second spot marked by the child of steel. This camp too was used by their vassal, and another rite was conducted here, this one incomplete. <hpage>The action was clearly taken in haste. Did they believe themself pursued? The etchings here are crude, but the words are disturbing... and desperate.
original_zh_text: <hpage>钢铁之子标记的第二处地点。他们的仆从也在这里进行过仪式，但没完成。<hpage>行动如此匆忙，难道是怕被追杀？刻的字歪歪扭扭，内容让人不安……且绝望。
translated_text: <hpage>第二个地点由钢之子标记。这个营地也被他们的附庸使用，这里还举行了另一场仪式，但这次并不完整。<hpage>这一行动显然是仓促采取的。他们相信自己正在被追捕吗？这里的蚀刻很粗糙，但文字却令人不安……而且绝望。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The second location is marked by the Sons of Steel. The camp was also used by their vassals, and another ceremony was held here, but this time it was incomplete.<hpage>This action was clearly taken hastily. Do they believe they are being hunted? The etching here is rough, but the writing is disturbing... and desperate.

original_en_text: Cloth and incendiary materials that could be fashioned into an explosive weapon.
original_zh_text: 可制成爆燃武器的布料与易燃物。
translated_text: 可制成爆炸性武器的布料和燃烧材料。
secondary_translated_text: Cloth and incendiary materials that can be made into explosive weapons.

original_en_text: Shellplates and cogs that could be fashioned into a flying automaton.
original_zh_text: 可组装飞行自动机的壳板与齿轮。
translated_text: 弹壳和齿轮可以制成飞行机器人。
secondary_translated_text: Shell casings and gears can be made into flying robots.

original_en_text: In silence your voice,<br>In darkness your form,<page>We higher who see you seeking,<br>Our shells yearn for your embrace.
original_zh_text: 静默即汝声，<br>晦暗即汝形。<page>吾等高瞻汝之追寻，<br>甲壳渴求汝之怀抱。
translated_text: 默默地说出你的声音，<br>在黑暗中，你的形体，<page>我们更高的人看到你在看，<br>我们的贝壳渴望你的拥抱。
secondary_translated_text: Speak your voice silently,<br>In the darkness, your form,<page>Our taller people see you looking,<br>Our shells long for your hug.

original_en_text: -ilgrim<br>You who have held tight to faith have been carried far.<br>This station shall offer brief rest to those devout.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>虔信之虫方能抵达此远境。<br>此站给予诚心者片刻安歇。
translated_text: - 伊格林<br>你们中那些忠于自己信仰的人已经被带走了。<br>该车站将为那些虔诚的人提供短暂的休息。
secondary_translated_text: - Eaglin<br>Those of you who are true to your beliefs have been taken away.<br>The station will provide a short break for those who are pious.

original_en_text: Half-spawn of a distant land...<br>Within this cage I have waited...<br>Let my strength be bound to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our accursed kingdom...
original_zh_text: 异乡的半血之子啊……<br>我在此笼中久候……<br>愿以残力附汝身……<br>夺回这诅咒国度的未来……
translated_text: 遥远土地的一半后裔。<br>在这个笼子里，我一直在等待。<br>将我的力量与你的力量结合起来..<br>夺回我们被诅咒王国的未来……
secondary_translated_text: Half the descendants of distant lands.<br>In this cage, I've been waiting.<br>Combine my power with yours..<br>Retake the future of our cursed kingdom...

original_en_text: Child, I have answered the call to climb. I rise to join our elders in that holy place far above. May you, in time, grow strong enough to meet us there.
original_zh_text: 孩子，我已应召攀登，将赴上方圣地与前辈们相聚。愿你成长强健，来日同聚。
translated_text: 孩子，我已经响应了攀登的号召。我站起来，和长辈一起去了遥远的圣地。愿你最终变得足够强大，能够加入我们。
secondary_translated_text: Boy, I have answered the call to climb. I stood up and went to the distant holy land with my elders. May you eventually become strong enough to join us.

original_en_text: An old map of the Putrified Ducts.
translated_text: 一张腐烂管道的旧地图。
secondary_translated_text: An old map of a decaying pipe.

original_en_text: This low, her gaze escaped.<br>Prepare, sisters. Weave hope anew.<br>That we might break free this accursed web born of our naive foundation.
original_zh_text: 此处卑微隐秘，逃出她的视线。<br>准备吧，姊妹。重织希望。撕破这由我等天真所结的诅咒之网。
translated_text: 太低了，她的眼睛溜走了。<br>准备好吧，姐妹们。重新编织希望。<br>我们可以摆脱这个因我们天真的基础而诞生的被诅咒的网络。
secondary_translated_text: It was too low, and her eyes slipped away.<br>Get ready, sisters. Reweave hope.<br>We can get rid of this cursed network born of our naive foundation.

original_en_text: An ornate door closed with a simple lock.
translated_text: 一扇华丽的门用一把简单的锁关上。
secondary_translated_text: An ornate door closes with a simple lock.

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Accept the judgment of the rise beyond,<br>That all who stand at Pharloom’s holy crest prove pure of will and want.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>接受至高审判的洗礼。<br>凡欲立于纺络之巅者，当证心志纯净。
translated_text: 朝圣者<br>接受超越崛起的判断，<br>所有站在法鲁王冠上的人都表现出纯粹的意志和欲望。
secondary_translated_text: pilgrims<br>Accept the judgment of transcending rise,<br>All those who stood on the crown of Faro showed pure will and desire.

original_en_text: Two children born entwined, apart,<br>Two children marked to rule,<page>They danced, they sang, proved blades beyond,<br>But none forgot their birth,<br>For lovers born on beat exact shall be forever cursed.
original_zh_text: 双子缠绕共生，命运连结，<br>双子共掌权柄，注定称王，<page>舞若惊鸿，歌撼四座，剑技超群，<br>但出身不可磨灭，<br>同卵双生之爱侣，诅咒永世缠身。
translated_text: 两个孩子出生时就联系在一起，分开，<br>两个孩子被标记为裁决，<page>他们跳舞，他们唱歌，证明刀锋超越，<br>但没有人忘记自己的出生，<br>对于出生在节奏中的恋人来说，精确永远会受到诅咒。
secondary_translated_text: The two children were connected at birth, separated,<br>Two children were marked as verdicts,<page>They danced, they sang, proving that Blade transcended,<br>But no one forgets their birth,<br>For lovers born in rhythm, precision will always be cursed.

original_en_text: Great bugs! You who weep as your kingdom fades,<br>join me upon the Stage.<br> Together, we shall enflame the passion of Pharloom!
original_zh_text: 伟大的虫民！为王国衰颓而泣者。<br>请至剧台与我相会。<br>共燃纺络之激情！
translated_text: 伟大的错误！你的王国衰落，你哭泣，<br>和我一起上台吧。<br>我们将共同点燃法鲁的激情！
secondary_translated_text: Great mistake! Your kingdom declines, you weep,<br>Come onstage with me.<br>We will ignite Faro's passion together!

original_en_text: <hpage>This location was marked by the steel child. This camp is old, but still shows clear evidence of an attempt at a rite.<hpage>Whatever the vassal hoped to achieve here seems to have failed. The other marked locations may provide more clues to its intent.
original_zh_text: <hpage>这是钢铁之子标记的地点。营地虽然老旧，但明显有试图举行仪式的痕迹。<hpage>无论仆从想做什么，似乎是失败了。其他标记点或许会有更多线索。
translated_text: <hpage>这个位置是由一个钢铁男孩标记的。该营地很古老，但仍然有明显的证据表明有人试图举行仪式。<hpage>封臣希望在这里实现的一切似乎都失败了。其他标记的位置可能会提供更多有关其意图的线索。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>This position is marked by a steel boy. The camp is ancient, but there is still clear evidence of attempts to hold rituals.<hpage>Everything the vassals hoped to achieve here seemed to have failed. The location of other markers may provide more clues about their intentions.

original_en_text: Weaver, in quarter part, last of their line, staked to service.<br>Tracked and taken beneath the City of Steel.<br>Eight Choristors, twelve Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第四代织者，末裔，强制服役。<br>于钢铁之城地下追捕擒获。<br>折损八名圣咏使徒，十二名特使。
translated_text: 韦弗在四分之一部分（他们的最后一行）发球。<br>在钢铁之城下追踪和拍摄。<br>八戒十二使，因使命而失败。
secondary_translated_text: Weaver serves in the quarter-section (their last line).<br>Track and shoot under the City of Steel.<br>The twelve envoys of the Eight Rings failed because of their mission.

original_en_text: By our Citadel’s glory, you treasured devout may bask brief in its holy light.
original_zh_text: 沐浴圣堡荣光，虔信者可暂享圣辉。
translated_text: 有了我们城堡的荣耀，你所珍爱的虔诚的人可以沐浴在它神圣的光芒中。
secondary_translated_text: With the glory of our castle, the pious ones you cherish can bathe in its sacred light.

original_en_text: A husk with a map of the Slab etched upon its shell.
original_zh_text: 一具甲壳刻有罪石牢狱地图的尸骸
translated_text: 一个贝壳，贝壳上刻有石地图。
secondary_translated_text: A shell with a stone map engraved on the shell.
